Bahnar: Apinh ih dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei pơla Ih păng tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ tơmam Ih yua. Apinh Ih wei rong păng tơgŭm dŏng lu sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: Give unto the LORD, O you mighty ones, Give unto the LORD glory and strength.
Bahnar: Ơ lu kon Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rŏ păng mơsêh mơyang

English: Give unto the LORD the glory due to His name; Worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
Bahnar: Kơkuh bĕ kơ Kră Yang mơsêh mơyang Anăn Sư trŏ kơ pơư pơang, iŏk bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoha na kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: The voice of the LORD is over the waters; The God of glory thunders; The LORD is over many waters.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang ư-ang jơ̆p tơ kơpal đak. Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nơ̆r Sư pơma re jur thoi grơ̆m glaih.

English: The voice of the LORD is powerful; The voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang kơtang tơpă. Nơ̆r Kră Yang đei mơsêh krưp.

English: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars, Yes, the LORD splinters the cedars of Lebanon.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang pơm pơchah tơgơ̆ kơ 'long dơnơ̆ng pơchah. Tơpă, Kră Yang pơm tơgơ̆ kơ 'long dơnơ̆ng Liban.

English: He makes them also skip like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơ char Liban pơplŏng thoi kon rơmo, păng Sirionb pơplŏng thoi kon rơmo dăm.

English: The voice of the LORD divides the flames of fire.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang lĕch pla ŭnh.

English: The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; The LORD shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang pơm kơ tơmăn glă pơpơ̆. Kră Yang gơgŭ char 'blach Kalđê pơpơ̆.

English: The voice of the LORD makes the deer give birth, And strips the forests bare; And in His temple everyone says, “Glory!”
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ juei akăn tuh kon Păng lŏng lê̆ lu roh bri 'biơu-'biao. Lăm Hnam Sư đĭ-đăng ôr khan: “Ư-ang tơpă!”

English: The LORD sat enthroned at the Flood, And the LORD sits as King forever.
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei tơ kơpal đak lơ̆p, Kră Yang pơm pơtao ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch

English: The LORD will give strength to His people; The LORD will bless His people with peace.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn tơdrong kơtang kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư. Kră Yang gô ăn pŭn hiôk, rơnŭk rơnua kơ kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: I will extol You, O LORD, for You have lifted me up, And have not let my foes rejoice over me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, inh kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih, yua kơ Ih tơiung inh. Ưh kơ ăn kơ lu ayăt kơ inh chhôk yua kơ inh.

English: O LORD my God, I cried out to You, And You healed me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Inh krao apinh Ih, na Ih pơklaih inh.

English: O LORD, You brought my soul up from the grave; You have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih iŏk pơklaih bơhngol inha đơ̆ng dêh atâu. Ih ăn kơ inh arih. Wă kơ inh huay kơ huŏng tơ sơlŭng jrŭ.b

English: Sing praise to the LORD, you saints of His, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Sư. Bơnê kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgohc Sư.

English: For His anger is but for a moment, His favor is for life; Weeping may endure for a night, But joy comes in the morning.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong sư hil lăp tŏ sĕt, Gah tơdrong Sư mơnat đei đĭ chăl arih hloi: Tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi lăp kiơ̆ kơmăng đĕch, Mă-lei truh pơgê hrôih đei chơt hiôk.

English: Now in my prosperity I said, “I shall never be moved.”
Bahnar: Gah inh lăm năr pŭn hiôk, inh đei khan thoi âu: “Inh huay kơ đei tơdrŏ pơpơ̆,”

English: LORD, by Your favor You have made my mountain stand strong; You hid Your face, and I was troubled.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih ăn kơ inh gơh oei kơjăp thoi kông, d Ih ôn muh măt, inh ưh kơ hiôk hloi

English: I cried out to You, O LORD; And to the LORD I made supplication
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Inh ôr krao Ih. Păng krao apinh Kră Yang

English: “What profit is there in my blood, When I go down to the pit? Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your truth?
Bahnar: “Hăm đei yua kiơ dah inh lôch, inh jur tơ lăm bơsat. 'Mui teh hăm gô bơnê kơ Ih? Gô pơm kơdranh kơ tơdrong tơpăt Ih hă?e

English: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me; LORD, be my helper!”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh ih mơ̆ng păng mơnat kơ inh. Kră Yang ơi, tơgŭm inh bĕ,”

English: You have turned for me my mourning into dancing; You have put off my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness
Bahnar: Ih tơplih boih tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon inh jing tơdrong hiôk chơt Plôh lê̆ ao sơ'ngon inh,f pơhrŭk ăn kơ inh hăm tơdrong hiôk chơt.

English: To the end that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
Bahnar: Wă kơ bơhngol inh hơri bơnê kơ Ih pă pơdơh. Inh gô bơnê kơ Ih ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: In You, O LORD, I put my trust; Let me never be ashamed; Deliver me in Your righteousness.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, inh ôn kơ'nơp lăm Ih. 'Nĕ ăn kơ inh mơlâu ling-lang. Apinh tơdrong tơpăt Ih tơgŭm dŏng inh.

English: Bow down Your ear to me, Deliver me speedily; Be my rock of refuge, A fortress of defense to save me.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng inh, mă kuăng kuăng dŏng pơklaih inh; Pơm bĕ thoi tơmo tih kơjăp ăn kơ inh kơ'nơp, Păng thoi kơđông kơjăp dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: For You are my rock and my fortress; Therefore, for Your name’s sake, Lead me and guide me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih boih thoi tơmo tih păng anih kơjăp inh gơnang, yua kơ Anăn Ih Apinh chông ba inh.

English: Pull me out of the net which they have secretly laid for me, For You are my strength.
Bahnar: Pơklaih bĕ inh đơ̆ng hơnhuăl. Mă lu sư dăng tăp kơ inh, Yua kơ Ih boih anih mă inh kơ'nơp.

English: Into Your hand I commit my spirit; You have redeemed me, O LORD God of truth.
Bahnar: Inh jao bơhngol ih lăm ti Kră Yang. Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt sĭt tơpă. Ih huai iŏk inh boih.

English: I have hated those who regard useless idols; But I trust in the LORD.
Bahnar: Inha areh kơ lu bơngai kơkuh kơ rup man, hiong răm, Mă-lei inh gơnang kơ Kră Yang.

English: I will be glad and rejoice in Your mercy, For You have considered my trouble; You have known my soul in adversities
Bahnar: Inh gô chơt hiôk păng 'nă hal, Lăm tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat. Yua kơ Ih 'bôh boih tơdrong pơmat-tat inh, Băt boih kơ tơdrong bơhngol inh sơ'ngon.

English: And have not shut me up into the hand of the enemy; You have set my feet in a wide place.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ đei jao inh tơ lu ayăt. Mă-lei ăn kơ jơ̆ng inh dơ̆ng tơ anih rơhơi.

English: Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; My eye wastes away with grief, Yes, my soul and my body!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Mơnat bĕ kơ inh, yua kơ inh rŭng răng. Măt inh hrŏ yua kơ ơh sơ'ngon. Bơhngol păng akâu jăn inh kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: For my life is spent with grief, And my years with sighing; My strength fails because of my iniquity, And my bones waste away.
Bahnar: Tơdrong arih inh hiong hiach yua kơ ơh sơ'ngon. Lu sơnăm inh jur yua kơ tơtok tơtăm. Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ inh, b Tơdrong pran kơtang inh huach hiong păng Kơting inh hach răm.

English: I am a reproach among all my enemies, But especially among my neighbors, And am repulsive to my acquaintances; Those who see me outside flee from me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh, inh jing bơngai đe pơjăm pơjuă. Pơm kơ lu rông 'bôt rai pơjăm păng pơm kơ đe hli krê kơ inh, c Lu đe bu mă 'bôh inh oei tơ rok trong kơdâu weh ngăl.

English: I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; I am like a broken vessel.
Bahnar: Inh jing bơngai lu sư hiơt, d thoi lôch boih, Inh thoi minh pôm ge pơchah pơchek.

English: For I hear the slander of many; Fear is on every side; While they take counsel together against me, They scheme to take away my life.
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng boih lơ nơ̆r lu sư chă pơm tơdrong.e Hli krưp tăp kơ inh. Thoi lu sư pơđâu wă blah inh, Wă tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong arih inh.

English: But as for me, I trust in You, O LORD; I say, “You are my God.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ Kră Yang! Inh gơnang kơ Ih. Inh khan: “Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh.”

English: My times are in Your hand; Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from those who persecute me.
Bahnar: Chăl arihf inh, lăm ti Ih, Apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih inh dơ̆ng ti lu bơngai ayăt păng đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơmat inh

English: Make Your face shine upon Your servant; Save me for Your mercies’ sake.
Bahnar: Apinh pơdah muh măt Ih kơ lu đĭch đam Ih. Đơ̆ng tơdrong 'mêm Ih, dŏng pơklaih inh

English: Do not let me be ashamed, O LORD, for I have called upon You; Let the wicked be ashamed; Let them be silent in the grave.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! 'Nĕ ăn kơ inh mơlâu, yua kơ inh krao apinh ih. Ăn kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ mơlâu păng ngăn hreh jur tơ lăm dêh atâu!g

English: Let the lying lips be put to silence, Which speak insolent things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ kơ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai hơlĕnh kơmlo. Lu nơ̆r pơang, lu sư pơma pơjăm lu bơngai tơpăt.

English: Oh, how great is Your goodness, Which You have laid up for those who fear You, Which You have prepared for those who trust in You In the presence of the sons of men!
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih tih dêh, Mă ăn boih kơ lu bơngai hli yom kơ Ih păng ăn boih kơ lu bơngai năm kơ'nơp lăm Ih. 'Bơ̆t anăp lu kon bơngai.

English: You shall hide them in the secret place of Your presence From the plots of man; You shall keep them secretly in a pavilion From the strife of tongues.
Bahnar: Ih ôn lu sư tơ anih hlơp 'bơ̆t anăp Ih. Klaih đơ̆ng lu đe wă pơm kơnê̆, Ih ôn lu sư lăm bơsŭn. Klaih đơ̆ng hơpiĕt lu bơngai blah tơgar.

English: Blessed be the LORD, For He has shown me His marvelous kindness in a strong city!
Bahnar: Bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang. Yua kơ tơ lăm pơlei kơjăp Sư. Sư tơ'bôh ăn boih kơ inh tơdrong 'mêm mơnat hlĭch chrơp Sư!

English: For I said in my haste, “I am cut off from before Your eyes”; Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications When I cried out to You.
Bahnar: Lăm năr chhŭr nuih inh khan thoi âu: “Đe tơweh inh ataih boih đơ̆ng anăp Ih.” Mă-lei Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao apinh. Kơplah inh krao Ih dŏng pơklaih.

English: Oh, love the LORD, all you His saints! For the LORD preserves the faithful, And fully repays the proud person.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang, 'mêm bĕ kơ Sư. Kră Yang wei-lăng lu bơngai tơnen tơnăp. Mă-lei pơm 'mong tơpă kơ lu đe bu mă oei sa pơang.

English: Be of good courage, And He shall strengthen your heart, All you who hope in the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai mă chang gô Kră Yang. Chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m, hơđơ̆ng đon bĕ.

English: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, Whose sin is covered.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bơngai bu mă tơdrong yoch sư gơh mơnat ăn, Huay pă jô̆ yoch.

English: Blessed is the man to whom the LORD does not impute iniquity, And in whose spirit there is no deceit.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bu mă Kră Yang huay kơ jô̆ kơnê̆, Păng lăm jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ đei hơlĕnh!

English: When I kept silent, my bones grew old Through my groaning all the day long.
Bahnar: Mưh inh ĕnh, lu kơting inh hiong hiach đĭ păng inh ôr krao prăt năr.

English: For day and night Your hand was heavy upon me; My vitality was turned into the drought of summer. Selah
Bahnar: Kơmăng kơ'năr ti Kră Yang kơtĭt inh trăp dêh.a Tơdrong pran kơtang inh hrĕng krob thoi tŏ bơyan phang

English: I acknowledged my sin to You, And my iniquity I have not hidden. I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,” And You forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
Bahnar: Inh tơbral yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ưh pă đei ôn dôm yoch kơnê̆ inh. Inh khan: “Inh tơbral roi đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch glăi inh kơ Kră Yang. Ih huay pă jô̆ yoch inh.” Sêla

English: For this cause everyone who is godly shall pray to You In a time when You may be found; Surely in a flood of great waters They shall not come near him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai tơpătc băt chu yom krao khan kơ Ih. Lăm jơ mă oei gơh tơ'bơ̆p hăm Ih, Mă khan đei đak lơ̆p rai tih, kư̆m ưh kơ đei lơ̆p truh tơ sư.

English: You are my hiding place; You shall preserve me from trouble; You shall surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah
Bahnar: Ih bơih anih inh kơ'nơp, Ih tơgŭm inh lăm năr đei tơdrong truh, Ih wang tăp kơ inh hăm tơdrong hơrid dŏng pơklaih. Sêla

English: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will guide you with My eye.
Bahnar: Inh gô bơtho tơ'bôh kơ lu iĕm trong lu iĕm athei năm kiơ̆. Măt Inh gô wei-lăng păng na bơtho tơ'bôh kơ lu iĕm.e

English: Do not be like the horse or like the mule, Which have no understanding, Which must be harnessed with bit and bridle, Else they will not come near you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ thoi aseh păng aseh iĕ, ưh kơ đei đon tơchĕng, Iŏk bĕ dam pơhơ̆p, tơlei pơhơ̆p 'nao na gơh pơhơ̆p 'bơ̆r lu sư. Tơdah ưh, lu sư ưh kơ năm jê̆ Ih.

English: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked; But he who trusts in the LORD, mercy shall surround him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai yoch đei tơdrong pơmat-tat. Mă-lei bơngai bu băt gơnang kơ Kră Yang, tơdrong 'mêm mơnat war tăp kơ bơngai noh.

English: Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, you righteous; And shout for joy, all you upright in heart!
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai tơpăt, chơt hiôk bĕ Păng 'nă hal bĕ lăm Kră Yang! Ơ lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt, ôr jreo chơt bĕ!

English: Rejoice in the LORD, O you righteous! For praise from the upright is beautiful.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai tơpăt, chơt hiôk bĕ lăm Kră Yang. Tơdrong bơnê trŏ kơ lu bơngai tơpăt.

English: Praise the LORD with the harp; Make melody to Him with an instrument of ten strings.
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ tĭng-nĭng bơnê kơ Kră Yang, Yua bĕ brŏ mam mơjĭt dăng tơlei na hơri bơnê kơ Sư

English: Sing to Him a new song; Play skillfully with a shout of joy.
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ Kơ Sư minh 'bai hơri 'nao, reh brŏ tơlei mă hiôk păng hơri nơ̆r re chơt hiôk.

English: For the word of the LORD is right, And all His work is done in truth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơpăt, Lu tơdrong jang Sư pơm tă kơ 'blep trŏ ngăl.

English: He loves righteousness and justice; The earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.
Bahnar: Mơnat Sư lăp đon kơ tơdrong tơpăt păng tơdrong trŏ Tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Sư 'bĕnh-'bang kơ teh đak.

English: By the word of the LORD the heavens were made, And all the host of them by the breath of His mouth.
Bahnar: Lu plĕnh mă đei pơjing đơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang. Đĭ lu linh tơ plĕnh đơ̆ng hơyuh dui jơhngơ̆m đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư na đei.

English: He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap; He lays up the deep in storehouses.
Bahnar: Sư akŭm mong đak dơsĭ lăm đak poh-yă, Păng 'măn lu đak jrŭ lăm hnam mong lu sư.

English: Let all the earth fear the LORD; Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
Bahnar: Jơ̆p kơ teh đak hli yom bĕ kơ Kră Yang Đĭ kon bơngai lăm teh đak hli bĕ kơ Sư.

English: For He spoke, and it was done; He commanded, and it stood fast.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Sư sơkat, na đei hloi, Sư athei, na tơmam kơjăp hlŏng hloi.

English: The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to nothing; He makes the plans of the peoples of no effect.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơrăm lê̆ lu dêh char chă đon wă pơm kơnê̆. Tơhiong lê̆ tơdrong kon bơngai pơđâu wă pơm.

English: The counsel of the LORD stands forever, The plans of His heart to all generations.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong Kră Yang pơđâu kơjăp ling-lang, Jơhngơ̆m đon Sư tơchĕng oei đei dĭng truh đĭ jơhnơr.

English: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD, The people He has chosen as His own inheritance.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh char ayơ đei Kră Yang pơm 'Bok Kei-Dei sư. Adrĕch adrung ayơ mă Sư rơih pơm thoi tơmam Sư!

English: The LORD looks from heaven; He sees all the sons of men.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đơ̆ng plĕnh nger lăng, 'Bôh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai.

English: From the place of His dwelling He looks On all the inhabitants of the earth
Bahnar: Sư lăng đơ̆ng anih Sư oei. Tơ đĭ-đăng bơngai oei lăm teh đak

English: He fashions their hearts individually; He considers all their works.
Bahnar: Sư pơjing jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai, Sư lăng đĭ dôm tơdrong lu sư pơm.

English: No king is saved by the multitude of an army; A mighty man is not delivered by great strength.
Bahnar: Pơtao mă gơh klaih ưh kơ sĭ. Yua kơ Linh sư lơ. Bơngai mă pran kơtang kư̆m ưh kơ klaih hlôi đơ̆ng pran kơtang sư noh.

English: A horse is a vain hope for safety; Neither shall it deliver any by its great strength.
Bahnar: Gơnang kơ aseh wă kơ gơh klaih noh tơdrong kơ đei. Mă khan jơhngơ̆m sư pran kơtang kư̆m ưh kơ gơh klaih hlôi.

English: Behold, the eye of the LORD is on those who fear Him, On those who hope in His mercy
Bahnar: To măt Kră Yang lăng tơ lu bơngai mă hli yom kơ sư păng chang gô tơdrong 'mêm mơnat.

English: To deliver their soul from death, And to keep them alive in famine.
Bahnar: Wă pơklaih bơhngol lu sư đơ̆ng lôch, Păng bơwei tơdrong arih lu sư lăm năr pơngot rơwĕt.

English: Our soul waits for the LORD; He is our help and our shield.
Bahnar: Bơhngol lu nhôn chang gô Kră Yang, Sư boih tơdrong dŏng tơgŭm păng khêl lu nhôn.

English: For our heart shall rejoice in Him, Because we have trusted in His holy name.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m lu nhôn chơt hiôk lăm Sư, Yua kơ lu nhôn 'măn boih jơhngơ̆m lui yom lăm Anăn rơgoh Sư.

English: Let Your mercy, O LORD, be upon us, Just as we hope in You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, ăn tơdrong 'mêm mơnat ih jruh tơ lu nhôn, yua kơ lu nhôn chang hơmĕng lăm Ih.

English: I will bless the LORD at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.
Bahnar: Inh gô ư-ang akâu Kră Yang ling-lang. Tơdrong ư-ang kơ Sư oei 'bơ̆t hơkŭng inh

English: My soul shall make its boast in the LORD; The humble shall hear of it and be glad.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh gô pơư pơang lăm Kră Yang, Lu bơngai gô kơtơ̆ng păng chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: Oh, magnify the LORD with me, And let us exalt His name together.
Bahnar: Ơ kơkuh bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang hơdai inh. Bĕ lu bơ̆n pơư pơang anăn Kră Yang.

English: I sought the LORD, and He heard me, And delivered me from all my fears.
Bahnar: Inh krao apinh boih Kră Yang, Sư tơl boih nơ̆r inh. Sư pơklaih inh đơ̆ng tơdrong hli hlơt.

English: They looked to Him and were radiant, And their faces were not ashamed.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lăng tơ Kră Yang na Kră Yang pơchrang hơdah kơ lu sư. Muh măt lu sư ưh kơ mơlâu.

English: This poor man cried out, and the LORD heard him, And saved him out of all his troubles.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơmat âu ôr krao Kră Yang, Kră Yang mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư. Dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: The angel of the LORD encamps all around those who fear Him, And delivers them.
Bahnar: Linh jang Kră Yang war tăp dăr kơ lu đe bu mă hli yom kơ Sư. Păng dŏng pơklaih lu sư.

English: Oh, taste and see that the LORD is good; Blessed is the man who trusts in Him!
Bahnar: Pơlong lăng bĕ Kră Yang na 'bôh Sư 'lơ̆ng tơpăt dang yơ! Pŭn dêh kơ bu băt kơ'nơp lăm Sư!

English: Oh, fear the LORD, you His saints! There is no want to those who fear Him.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lăm Kră Yang, hli yom bĕ kơ Sư! Yua kơ bơngai bu mă hli yom kơ Sư ưh kơ đei kơ'bah kiơ.

English: The young lions lack and suffer hunger; But those who seek the LORD shall not lack any good thing.
Bahnar: Kon dăm-brang mơlôh khăi kơ tơmam sa păng pơngot. Mă-lei bơngai bu mă krao chă Kră Yang ưh kơ đei khăi kơ tơmam 'lơ̆ng ôh.

English: Come, you children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ lu kon năm mơ̆ng Inh bĕ, Inh gô bơtho kơ lu iĕm băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang.

English: Who is the man who desires life, And loves many days, that he may see good?
Bahnar: Bu 'maih wă đei tơdrong arih, Păng wă arih sota gô 'bôh tơdrong pŭn hiôk?

English: Keep your tongue from evil, And your lips from speaking deceit.
Bahnar: Bơwei bĕ hơpiĕt wă huay kơ pơma nơ̆r kơnê̆ păng hơkŭng huay kơ pơma nơ̆r plêl.

English: Depart from evil and do good; Seek peace and pursue it.
Bahnar: Weh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ păng pơm bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng. Chơchă bĕ tơdrong hiôk-hian păng druh kiơ̆ tơdrong ei.

English: The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, And His ears are open to their cry.
Bahnar: Măt Kră Yang lăng tơ lu bơngai tơpăt. Đon Sư mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu đe noh krao apinh.

English: The face of the LORD is against those who do evil, To cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
Bahnar: Muh măt Kră Yang hil kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆. Wă tơhiong lê̆ dôm tơdrong đe 'blŏk kơ lu sư tơ lăm teh đak.

English: The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears, And delivers them out of all their troubles.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Krao apinh, Kră Yang mơ̆ng hloi. Păng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: The LORD is near to those who have a broken heart, And saves such as have a contrite spirit.
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei jê̆ lu bơngai đei chhŭr nuih, Păng dŏng pơklaih lu bơhngol mă sơ'ngon kơ tơdrong yoch

English: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, But the LORD delivers him out of them all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đei lơ tơdrong pơmat-tat truh. Mă-lei Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih đĭ tơdrong noh.

English: He guards all his bones; Not one of them is broken.
Bahnar: Sư wei đĭ dôm kơting sư, Ưh kơ đei minh pôm ayơ mă tơgơ̆.

English: Evil shall slay the wicked, And those who hate the righteous shall be condemned.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ gô pơlôch lu bơngai kơnê̆, lu areh kơ bơngai 'lơ̆ng gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong phak.

English: The LORD redeems the soul of His servants, And none of those who trust in Him shall be condemned.
Bahnar: Kră Yang huai iŏk bơhngol lu đĭch đam sư. Bu mă gơneh gơnơm lăm Sư, huay pă pŭ tơdrong phak boih.

English: Plead my cause, O LORD, with those who strive with me; Fight against those who fight against me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, pơjah pơjăng bĕ, a hăm lu bơngai pơjah pơjăng hăm inh. Tơblah bĕ hăm lu bơngai tơblah păng inh.

English: Take hold of shield and buckler, And stand up for my help.
Bahnar: Apinh ih chĕp khêl Ih hăm khêl iĕ. Iung na tơgŭm dŏng inh.

English: Also draw out the spear, And stop those who pursue me. Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ hơlă, găn trong lu đe druh inh. Pơma bĕ hăm bơhngol inh. “Inh jơ̆ tơdrong dŏng pơklaih ih.”

English: Let those be put to shame and brought to dishonor Who seek after my life; Let those be turned back and brought to confusion Who plot my hurt.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu bơngai chă pơlôch tơ rŏng arih inh gô mơlâu păng hlơ̆l lĕm. Rŏ kơ pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai chă pơrăm inh kơdŭn tơ rŏng păng mơlâu.

English: Let them be like chaff before the wind, And let the angel of the LORD chase them.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư thoi hơkam 'ba kial bơbơ̆t, Ăn kơ Linh jang Kră Yang puh tơweh lu sư!

English: Let their way be dark and slippery, And let the angel of the LORD pursue them.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ trong lu sư măng mu păng rơbơ̆r tơsĕr. Apinh Linh jang Kră Yang puh tơweh lu sư!

English: For without cause they have hidden their net for me in a pit, Which they have dug without cause for my life.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư dăng hơnhuăl kơ inh tơdrong kơ đei. Păng lu sư sir sơlŭng jrŭ wă kơ inhb puh tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Let destruction come upon him unexpectedly, And let his net that he has hidden catch himself; Into that very destruction let him fall.
Bahnar: Ăn tơdrong răm truh kơ lu sư ưh kơ tam băt. Rŏ kơ hơnhuăl lu sư dăng 'leh lu sư kơdih. Ăn kơ lu sư huŏng tơ sơlŭng noh păng lôch đĭ.

English: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD; It shall rejoice in His salvation.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh gô chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang. Chhôk hal lăm Sư dŏng pơklaih

English: All my bones shall say, “LORD, who is like You, Delivering the poor from him who is too strong for him, Yes, the poor and the needy from him who plunders him?”
Bahnar: Lu kơting inh khan: “Ơ Kră Yang. Bu thoi Ih, Ih pơklaih lu bơngai tơrăn đơ̆ng lu bơngai pran hloh kơ sư. Tơgŭm lu bơngai pơmat păng lu bơngai dơnuh hoh kơđei đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai tơtông tơgar.”

English: Fierce witnesses rise up; They ask me things that I do not know.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr lu sư iung apinh dôm tơdrong mă inh ưh kơ băt

English: They reward me evil for good, To the sorrow of my soul.
Bahnar: Lu sư iŏk tơdrong kơnê̆ mong đêl inh pơm 'lơ̆ng Achăng lê̆ bơhngol inh pă đei hơmĕng kiơ.

English: But as for me, when they were sick, My clothing was sackcloth; I humbled myself with fasting; And my prayer would return to my own heart.
Bahnar: Gah inh 'bơ̆t năr sư jĭ, inh hrŭk 'bi. Ơ̆t kơ por pơmat akâu inh Nơ̆r inh krao khan ưh kơ đei tơl tơwih.c

English: I paced about as though he were my friend or brother; I bowed down heavily, as one who mourns for his mother.
Bahnar: Inh lăng lu sư thoi buăl juăt, thoi 'nhŏng oh. Inh sơ'ngon kŭp thoi đe hmoi ơh kơ mĕ sư lôch.

English: But in my adversity they rejoiced And gathered together; Attackers gathered against me, And I did not know it; They tore at me and did not cease
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm năr inh đei tơdrong truh, lu sư akŭm băl chơt hiôk, Lu sư akŭm pơđâu wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh, na inh ưh kơ băt, Lu sư hek sa inh pă đei pơdơh.

English: With ungodly mockers at feasts They gnashed at me with their teeth.
Bahnar: Lu sư kăp hơnĕnh wă pơm kơ inh. Lu bơngai kơnê̆ nŏng kơ blei hiap inh.

English: Lord, how long will You look on? Rescue me from their destructions, My precious life from the lions.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Ih wă gô lăng dĭng dang yơ? Apinh Ih pơklaih bơhngol inh đơ̆ng lu sư wă pơrăm. Păng dui iŏk tơdrong arih inh đơ̆ng dăm-brang.

English: I will give You thanks in the great assembly; I will praise You among many people.
Bahnar: Inh gô bơnê ư-ang kơ Ih lăm năr akŭm tih, Ư-ang kơ Ih 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk kon pơlei pơla lơ.

English: Let them not rejoice over me who are wrongfully my enemies; Nor let them wink with the eye who hate me without a cause.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh tơdrong kơ đei chơt hiôk. Kŭm 'nĕ kơ lê̆ lu areh kơ inh, kơ'mreh măt tơdrong kơ đei yua kơ Ih.

English: For they do not speak peace, But they devise deceitful matters Against the quiet ones in the land.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ đei nơ̆r hiôk 'biơ̆ Mă-lei tă kơ pơma hơlĕnh pơdăr. Blah lu bơngai dim iơ̆m lăm teh đak.

English: They also opened their mouth wide against me, And said, “Aha, aha! Our eyes have seen it.”
Bahnar: Lu sư ha 'bơ̆r wă pơm kơ inh, Na khan: “Ơ, ơ! Măt lu bơ̆n 'bôh boih.”

English: This You have seen, O LORD; Do not keep silence. O Lord, do not be far from me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Ih 'bôh boih tơdrong noh, Apinh lê̆ kơ ngăn. Kră Yang ơi! 'Nĕ kơ achăng inh.

English: Stir up Yourself, and awake to my vindication, To my cause, my God and my Lord.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơ̆ Kră Yang inh, hơđơ̆r bĕ, iung bĕ, Dŏng tơgŭm inh, d Păng dŏng bơwei inh.

English: Vindicate me, O LORD my God, according to Your righteousness; And let them not rejoice over me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, Dŏng inh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong tơpăt Ih. 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu sư chơt hiôk yua kơ inh.

English: Let them not say in their hearts, “Ah, so we would have it!” Let them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu sư khan lăm jơhngơ̆m: “Ơ! To, tơdrong mă lu bơ̆n wă,”e Dah khan: “Lu bơ̆n luăn đĭ sư boih.”

English: Let them be ashamed and brought to mutual confusion Who rejoice at my hurt; Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor Who exalt themselves against me.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ bơngai bu chơt hiôk kơ tơdrong pơmat inh hơdai mơlâu păng hlơ̆l đĭ-đăng. Rŏ kơ Lu bơngai mă pơang kơ inh, lê̆ lu sư mơlâu păng hlơ̆l pă kĕ.

English: Let them shout for joy and be glad, Who favor my righteous cause; And let them say continually, “Let the LORD be magnified, Who has pleasure in the prosperity of His servant.”
Bahnar: Ăn kơ đe bu mă chơt hiôk kơ tơdrong tơpăt inh, gô ôr chơt, hiôk-hian. Ăn kơ lu sư pơư ưh kơ pơdơh, “Kră Yang tih hloh tơpă! Sư hiôk tơpă ăn kơ lu đĭch đam Sư đei tơdrong hiôk-hian.”

English: And my tongue shall speak of Your righteousness And of Your praise all the day long.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, hơpiĕt inh gô roi tơdrong tơpăt Sư. Inh bơnê kơ Kră Yang prăt năr.

English: An oracle within my heart concerning the transgression of the wicked: There is no fear of God before his eyes.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ khan tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m inh. Ưh kơ đei tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bơ̆t anăp sư.

English: For he flatters himself in his own eyes, When he finds out his iniquity and when he hates.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp măt sư pơang kơdih khan: Tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ ưh kơ đei layơ đe băt păng ưh kơ đei bu areh.

English: The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit; He has ceased to be wise and to do good.
Bahnar: Lu nơ̆r lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư tă kơnê̆ hơlĕnh ngăl ưh pă pơm tơdrong tơpăt pơm 'lơ̆ng trŏ.

English: He devises wickedness on his bed; He sets himself in a way that is not good; He does not abhor evil.
Bahnar: Sư tơchĕng wă pơm kơnê̆ kơplah oei kơpal giơng, Sư kiơ̆ trong ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, sư ưh kơ achăng lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Your mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens; Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơdrong 'mêm Ih kơjung tĭk kơ plĕnh Tơdrong tơpăt ih truh tơ hơmơ̆l kok.

English: Your righteousness is like the great mountains; Your judgments are a great deep; O LORD, You preserve man and beast.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih nhen thoi kông tih.a Tơdrong Ih sek tơlang tơpăt thoi sơlŭng jrŭ. Ơ Kră Yang, Ih wei rongb kon bơngai păng sem brem.

English: How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God! Therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of Your wings.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơdrong 'mêm mơnat gĭt pă băt dang yơ! Kon bơngai năm kơ'nơp ala pơnăr Ih.

English: They are abundantly satisfied with the fullness of Your house, And You give them drink from the river of Your pleasures.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô et sa hiôk hrăp rơkah rơkai lăm hnam Ih Ih gô ăn kơ lu sư nhă đak krong hiôk-hian Ih.

English: For with You is the fountain of life; In Your light we see light.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơm tơdrong arih oei tơ Ih, Lăm tơdrong hơdah Ih nhôn 'bôh hơdah

English: Oh, continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, And Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
Bahnar: Apinh oei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu bơngai băt kơ Ih. Păng ăn tơdrong tơpăt Ih kơ lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt.

English: Let not the foot of pride come against me, And let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn jơ̆ng lu bơngai pơang druh tam inh Kŭm 'nĕ ăn ti lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ puh tơweh inh.

English: There the workers of iniquity have fallen; They have been cast down and are not able to rise.
Bahnar: Toc lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô pơ̆k huŏng. Đe gô tơlơ̆ pơ̆k, ưh pă kĕ iung dơ̆ng.

English: Do not fret because of evildoers, Nor be envious of the workers of iniquity.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ tơtăm kơ đe pơm kơnê̆, Kŭm 'nĕ kơ gar 'ngeng kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass, And wither as the green herb.
Bahnar: Thoi 'nhĕt lu sư gô jô kro păng thoi 'nhĕt hơdrih lu sư gô jô hŏnh.

English: Trust in the LORD, and do good; Dwell in the land, and feed on His faithfulness.
Bahnar: Gơnang bĕ kơ Kră Yang păng pơm 'lơ̆ng. Oei bĕ lăm dêh char păng oei arih lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư.

English: Delight yourself also in the LORD, And He shall give you the desires of your heart.
Bahnar: Hiôk chơt bĕ lăm Kră Yang, na Sư gô ăn kơ ih tơdrong kiơ ih 'maih wă.

English: Commit your way to the LORD, Trust also in Him, And He shall bring it to pass.
Bahnar: Jao bĕ trong bơ̆n kơ Kră Yang. Păng gơnang kơ Sư. Na Sư gô pơkeh tơdrong noh

English: He shall bring forth your righteousness as the light, And your justice as the noonday.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơdah tơdrong tơpăt ih thoi hơdah hơdong Păng sek tơ'bôh tơdronga trŏ ih thoi 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for Him; Do not fret because of him who prospers in his way, Because of the man who brings wicked schemes to pass.
Bahnar: Oei hreh bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng chang gô Sư. 'Nĕ kơ ơh klai yua kơ lu đe đei pŭn hiôk lăm trong lu sư. Dah yua kơ bơngai noh pơm keh lu tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; Do not fret—it only causes harm.
Bahnar: Ĕnh bĕ kơ hil păng lê̆ pă blĕk; Lê̆ kơ hiơ̆k tơdrong noh gô truh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: For evildoers shall be cut off; But those who wait on the LORD, They shall inherit the earth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô răm đĭ; Mă-lei gah lu bơngai chang gô Kră Yang gô đei teh jang sa.

English: For yet a little while and the wicked shall be no more; Indeed, you will look carefully for his place, But it shall be no more.
Bahnar: Pă 'biơ̆ kơnh lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh pă đei. Mă Ih chă lăng tơ anih sư, kư̆m pă đei 'bôh dơ̆ng.

English: But the meek shall inherit the earth, And shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô đei teh jang sa. Păng 'nă hal lăm tơdrong rơnŭk rơnua tih.

English: The wicked plots against the just, And gnashes at him with his teeth.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơđâu wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ bơngai tơpăt, Păng hơnganh kăp hơnĕnh kơ lu sư.

English: The Lord laughs at him, For He sees that his day is coming.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô hiĕk kơ lu sư, Yua kơ 'bôh khei 'năr wă phak lu sư wă jê̆ boih.b

English: The wicked have drawn the sword And have bent their bow, To cast down the poor and needy, To slay those who are of upright conduct.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ toh đao, Păng gŭt hră lu sư, Wă blah pơrăm lu bơngai pơmat-tat hăm lu bơngai dơnuh hin, Wă pơlôch lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt.

English: Their sword shall enter their own heart, And their bows shall be broken.
Bahnar: Đao lu sư gô 'bet jơhngơ̆m lu sư kơdih, Păng hră lu sư gô tơgơ̆.

English: A little that a righteous man has Is better than the riches of many wicked.
Bahnar: Tơmam lu bơngai tơpăt tŏ sĕt ră, Mă-lei đei 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ tơmam lu bơngaic kơnê̆ đei rơkah rơkai.

English: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken, But the LORD upholds the righteous.
Bahnar: Yua kơ kơkŏng ti lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô tơgơ̆, Mă-lei Kră Yang gô tưk pơkơ̆ng ti lu bơngai tơpăt.

English: The LORD knows the days of the upright, And their inheritance shall be forever.
Bahnar: Kră Yang băt năr lu bơngai tơpăt, Păng mŭk tơmam lu sư oei đei ling-lang.

English: They shall not be ashamed in the evil time, And in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
Bahnar: Lăm năr anat anot lu sư ưh kơ đei mơlâu; Lăm năr pơngot rơwĕt lu sư đei phĭ rơkah.

English: But the wicked shall perish; And the enemies of the LORD, Like the splendor of the meadows, shall vanish. Into smoke they shall vanish away.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô lôch răm, Lu bơngai ayăt kơ Kră Yang gô jing thoi tơmăn 'nhĕt bluh 'lơ̆ng.d Lu sư gô hach, hiong thoi 'nhui ŭnh.

English: The wicked borrows and does not repay, But the righteous shows mercy and gives.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ tŏk iŏk, na pơdrâu ưh kơ kĕ. Gah lu bơngai tơpăt hơmrah păng asong tŏk iŏk.

English: For those blessed by Him shall inherit the earth, But those cursed by Him shall be cut off.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai mă Kră Yang ăn pŭn hiôk gô đei iŏk teh jang sa; Gah lu bơngai mă Sư hiap pơtê̆ gô lôch răm đĭ.

English: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD, And He delights in his way.
Bahnar: Kră Yang wei kơjăp boih rim yak, Păng Sư lăp đon kơ trong lu sư

English: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down; For the LORD upholds him with His hand.
Bahnar: Mă sư kơtơih, kư̆m huay kơ pơ̆k; Yua kơ Kră Yang gô pôk tơiung sư.

English: I have been young, and now am old; Yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, Nor his descendants begging bread.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ inh oei 'lơ̆p, dang ei kră boih, tim 'bôh lu bơngai tơpăt khan đe achăng lê̆, Dah lu kon sâu sư chă apinh sa.

English: He is ever merciful, and lends; And his descendants are blessed.
Bahnar: Rim năr sư hơmrah păng asong ăn đe tŏk iŏk; Kon sâu sư đei pŭn hiôk.

English: Depart from evil, and do good; And dwell forevermore.
Bahnar: Weh bĕ dơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ păng pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, Na gơh oei arih ling-lang.

English: For the LORD loves justice, And does not forsake His saints; They are preserved forever, But the descendants of the wicked shall be cut off.
Bahnar: Kră Yang lăp đon kơ tơdrong tơpăt, Ưh kơ đei achăng lê̆ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư; Lu sư đei Kră Yang wei-lăng ling-lang: Mă-lei gah lu adrĕch adrung bơngai kơnê̆ gô răm đĭ.

English: The righteous shall inherit the land, And dwell in it forever.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt gô đei teh, Păng oei hloi tơ noh ling-lang.

English: The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom, And his tongue talks of justice.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r lu bơngai tơpăt pơma lĕch gơh hơgei, Păng hơpiĕt sư roi tơdrong tơpăt.

English: The law of his God is in his heart; None of his steps shall slide.
Bahnar: Khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm jơhngơ̆m sư; Rim yak sư huay kơ tơpling.

English: The wicked watches the righteous, And seeks to slay him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ hơrum tăp kơ lu bơngai tơpăt, Wă chă pơlôch.

English: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, Nor condemn him when he is judged.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ ăn sư lăm ti lu bơngai kơnê̆. Kŭm ưh kơ ăn đei jâu sư mơ̆n lăm năr sek tơlang.

English: Wait on the LORD, And keep His way, And He shall exalt you to inherit the land; When the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.
Bahnar: Chang gô bĕ Kră Yang păng wei kiơ̆ trong Sư, Sư gô hơtŏk ih wă kơ đei teh! Mưh lu kơnê̆ răm đĭ, Ih gô 'bôh tơdrong noh.

English: I have seen the wicked in great power, And spreading himself like a native green tree.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh boih lu bơngai kơnê̆ đei pran kơtang, Tih kơjung thoi 'long hơngo, chăt tơ char Liban.

English: Yet he passed away, and behold, he was no more; Indeed I sought him, but he could not be found.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei bơngai yak rok ei to, Sư pă 'bôh boih; Inh chơchă sư, mă-lei pă tơ'bơ̆p boih.

English: Mark the blameless man, and observe the upright; For the future of that man is peace.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ tơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng păng lăng lu bơngai tơpăt; Yua kơ tuch-luch lu bơngai tơpăt gô đei tơdrong hiôk-hian.e

English: But the transgressors shall be destroyed together; The future of the wicked shall be cut off.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai yoch lu sư gô pŭ tơdrong răm hơdai; Tơdrong chơt hiôk đe gô pơrăm đĭ tơ anăp lu bơngai kơnê̆.

English: But the salvation of the righteous is from the LORD; He is their strength in the time of trouble.
Bahnar: Tơdrong dŏng tơgŭm lu bơngai tơpăt truh đơ̆ng Kră Yang gô; Sư jing anih kơjăp lăm năr anat anot.

English: And the LORD shall help them and deliver them; He shall deliver them from the wicked, And save them, Because they trust in Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơgŭm pơklaih lu sư; Sư pơklaih lu sư dơ̆ng lu bơngai kơnê̆ păng tơgŭm dŏng lu sư, Yua kơ lu sư kơ'nơp boih lăm Kră Yang.

English: O LORD, do not rebuke me in Your wrath, Nor chasten me in Your hot displeasure!
Bahnar: Kră Yang! 'Nĕ hil kơ inh lăm năr Ih blĕk Kŭm 'nĕ phak bơtho inh năr Ih mĭl.

English: For Your arrows pierce me deeply, And Your hand presses me down.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'brơ̆m Ih 'bơm inh boih, Păng ti Ih kơtĭt inh trăp dêh.

English: There is no soundness in my flesh Because of Your anger, Nor any health in my bones Because of my sin.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih hil, sĕch inh ưh pă đei hơnĭl; Yua kơ tơdrong yoch inh, kơting inh kư̆m pă đei 'lơ̆ng.

English: For my iniquities have gone over my head; Like a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ inh, hloh kơ kơ̆l inh, Sư trăp dêh kơ inh, wă pŭ.

English: My wounds are foul and festering Because of my foolishness.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong yoch inh, Lu rơka inh ôm păng lĕch đak đuh.

English: I am troubled, I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
Bahnar: Inh drap kŭp kơ̆l tơ teh; Prăt năr inh yak lăm ơh sơ'ngon

English: For my loins are full of inflammation, And there is no soundness in my flesh.
Bahnar: Rŏng inh jĭ hang thoi ŭnh sa.a Na sĕch inh pă đei hơnĭl.

English: I am feeble and severely broken; I groan because of the turmoil of my heart.
Bahnar: Inh gleh lap păng rơdu rơmơ̆n,b Inh ôr krao, yua kơ lăm jơhngơ̆m inh rŭng răng.

English: Lord, all my desire is before You; And my sighing is not hidden from You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Ih băt đĭ tơdrong kiơ inh 'maih wă. Tơdrong inh ôr, ưh kơ đei hlơp kơ Ih ôh.

English: My heart pants, my strength fails me; As for the light of my eyes, it also has gone from me.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh tơtơ̆,c akâu inh rơdu. Tơdrong hơdah đơ̆ng măt inh kư̆m pă đei.

English: My loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague, And my relatives stand afar off.
Bahnar: Lu buăl juăt lu bơngai mơnat kơ inh oei ataih đơ̆ng inh yua kơ inh đei pơmat-tat. Păng 'nhŏng oh inh oei ataih kơ inh mơ̆n.

English: Those also who seek my life lay snares for me; Those who seek my hurt speak of destruction, And plan deception all the day long.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wă pơlôch inh, lu sư hơ'năk kơ inh hơđong. Lu bơngai chơchă wă pơrăm inh tă kơ pơma kơnê̆, Păng prăt năr chă hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: But I, like a deaf man, do not hear; And I am like a mute who does not open his mouth.
Bahnar: Inh thoi bơngai klĭk, ưh kơ đei kơtơ̆ng kiơ. Thoi bơngai kơmlo, ưh kơ gơh ha 'bơ̆r pơma.

English: Thus I am like a man who does not hear, And in whose mouth is no response.
Bahnar: Inh jing thoi bơngai ưh kơtơ̆ng. Ưh kơ đei 'bơ̆r nơ̆r pơma.

English: For in You, O LORD, I hope; You will hear, O Lord my God.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Inh chang gô Ih, Ih gô tơl tơwih. Ơ Kră Yang, jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh

English: For I said, “Hear me, lest they rejoice over me, Lest, when my foot slips, they exalt themselves against me.”
Bahnar: Inh khan: “'Nĕ ăn kơ lu sư chơt hiôk yua kơ inh! Pơư hloi kơ lu sư kơdih, mưh jơ̆ng inh tơpling.”

English: For I am ready to fall, And my sorrow is continually before me.
Bahnar: Inh wă jê̆ pơ̆k, tơdrong jĭ jăn oei 'bơ̆t anăp inh.

English: For I will declare my iniquity; I will be in anguish over my sin.
Bahnar: Inh gô roi tơdrong yoch inh, Inh ơh sơ'ngon, yua kơ tơdrong yoch inh.

English: But my enemies are vigorous, and they are strong; And those who hate me wrongfully have multiplied.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu ayăt kơ inh oei arih păng pran. Lu bơngai areh kơ inh tơdrong kơ đei lơ tơpă.

English: Those also who render evil for good, They are my adversaries, because I follow what is good.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'mong tơdrong kơnê̆, đêl inh pơm 'lơ̆ng. Noh kư̆m jâu inh, yua kơ inh kiơ̆ trong 'lơ̆ng.

English: Do not forsake me, O LORD; O my God, be not far from me!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! 'Nĕ achăng inh. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! 'Nĕ kơ weh ataih đơ̆ng inh.

English: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih inh, Tĕnh tĕnh bĕ tơgŭm inh.

English: I said, “I will guard my ways, Lest I sin with my tongue; I will restrain my mouth with a muzzle, While the wicked are before me.”
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Inh gô bơwei tơdrong arih sa inh, Wă kơ inh yua hơpiĕt inh, huay kơ pơma yoch, Kơplah lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp inh, Inh gô iŏk 'bông pơhơ̆p lê̆ 'bơ̆r inh.”

English: I was mute with silence, I held my peace even from good; And my sorrow was stirred up.
Bahnar: Inh ĕnh pơăm, ưh pă đei pơma, Dĭng mah nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng pă đei lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh, Tơdrong pơmat-tat inh rai tŏk.

English: My heart was hot within me; While I was musing, the fire burned. Then I spoke with my tongue
Bahnar: Lăm, jơhngơ̆m klơm klak tŏ hang, kơplah inh oei tơchĕng, ŭnh sa hloi. Kơplah noh hơpiĕt inh đei nơ̆r pơma

English: “LORD, make me to know my end, And what is the measure of my days, That I may know how frail I am.
Bahnar: “Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih ăn kơ inh băt kơ năr tôch inh, Păng băt kơ dôm năr inh oei arih Ăn kơ inh băt kơ tơdrong arih inh hơtăng hơtŏ dang yơ.

English: Indeed, You have made my days as handbreadths, And my age is as nothing before You; Certainly every man at his best state is but vapor. Selah
Bahnar: To, Ih pơm ăn kơ jơ 'năr inh kơjung lăp tŏ pah đĕch, Păng tơdrong arih thoi hoh-hoy đĕch 'bơ̆t anăp Ih. Sĭt tơpă, rim bơngai mă khan oei kơjăp, Kŭm lăp thoi dui jơhngơ̆m. Sêla

English: Surely every man walks about like a shadow; Surely they busy themselves in vain; He heaps up riches, And does not know who will gather them.
Bahnar: Tơpă rim 'nu yak năm, thoi lĕ kơ yơ̆p. Sư bơ̆jang gleh lap, tơdrong kơ đei. Bơngai mă mong mŭk tơmam, mă-lei ưh kơ băt bu wă iŏk yua.

English: “And now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, dang ei inh chang gô yă kiơ? Tơdrong inh chang gô tơ lăm Ih.

English: Deliver me from all my transgressions; Do not make me the reproach of the foolish.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih pơklaih inh đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong yoch inh pơm. 'Nĕ ăn kơ bơngai ưh kơ hlôh pơm kơ inh mơlâu.

English: I was mute, I did not open my mouth, Because it was You who did it.
Bahnar: Inh ngăn ưh pă đei ha 'bơ̆r, Yua kơ Ih pơm tơdrong noh.

English: Remove Your plague from me; I am consumed by the blow of Your hand.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih iŏk lê̆ tơdrong teh bơtho đơ̆ng inh. Inh gleh pă kĕ đơ̆ng ti Ih teh bơtho.

English: When with rebukes You correct man for iniquity, You make his beauty melt away like a moth; Surely every man is vapor. Selah
Bahnar: Kơplah Ih teh bơtho lu kon bơngai yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư. Na Ih pơm ăn tơdrong lu sư 'maih wă huach thoi bŭk răm. Sĭt tơpă, rim 'nu thoi kial dui jơhngơ̆m. Sêla

English: “Hear my prayer, O LORD, And give ear to my cry; Do not be silent at my tears; For I am a stranger with You, A sojourner, as all my fathers were.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh krao apinh, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh krao ôr. Apinh Inh 'nĕ kơ chĭt đon kơ đak măt inh nhơ̆m. Yua kơ inh thoi bơngai tơmoi. Bơngai tơmoi mă oei thoi yă 'bok inh.

English: Remove Your gaze from me, that I may regain strength, Before I go away and am no more.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh. Wă kơ inh đei jơhngơ̆m dơ̆ng, Adrol kơ inh wă năm păng ưh pă đei dơ̆ng.”

English: I waited patiently for the LORD; And He inclined to me, And heard my cry.
Bahnar: Inh adrin chang gô Kră Yang. Sư pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao ôr.

English: He also brought me up out of a horrible pit, Out of the miry clay, And set my feet upon a rock, And established my steps.
Bahnar: Sư dui hơtŏk inh đơ̆ng sơlŭng hli krưp. Pơklaih đơ̆ng hlŭt jrŭ, Sư dan jơ̆ng inh kơpal tơmo, Păng pơm ăn kơ rim yak inh kơjăp hơđơ̆ng.

English: He has put a new song in my mouth— Praise to our God; Many will see it and fear, And will trust in the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ 'bơ̆r inh đei 'bai hơri 'nao, Hơri bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n. Lơ bơngai gô 'bôh păng hli, Păng gơnang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Blessed is that man who makes the LORD his trust, And does not respect the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ đe bu mă gơnang kơ Kră Yang. Ưh kơ kiơ̆ lu bơngai pơang Păng lu bơngai chă yang glăi!a

English: Many, O LORD my God, are Your wonderful works Which You have done; And Your thoughts toward us Cannot be recounted to You in order; If I would declare and speak of them, They are more than can be numbered.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Ih đei pơm boih, Păng lu tơdrong Ih tơchĕng kơ lu nhôn. Ưh kơ gơh pơting bu hăm Ih.b Tơdah inh wă ră roi dah tơbăt. Tơpă lơlap dêh ưh kơ kĕ kơ jô̆

English: Sacrifice and offering You did not desire; My ears You have opened. Burnt offering and sin offering You did not require.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ wă ôh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r dah tơmam soi 'buh. Ih pơih đon inh boih. Ih ưh pă wă tơmam soh 'buh dah tơmam soi huai yoch.

English: Then I said, “Behold, I come; In the scroll of the book it is written of me.
Bahnar: Dang ei inh khan: “Âu inh truh, Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar đei chih boih gah inh.”

English: I delight to do Your will, O my God, And Your law is within my heart.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, inh hiôk tơpă pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Ih. Khôi juăt Ih oei tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m inh.

English: I have proclaimed the good news of righteousness In the great assembly; Indeed, I do not restrain my lips, O LORD, You Yourself know.
Bahnar: Lăm năr akŭm tih inh ră roi boih kơ tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih; to, inh ưh kơ đei ôn 'bơ̆r, Ơ Kră Yang, inh băt boih tơdrong noh.

English: I have not hidden Your righteousness within my heart; I have declared Your faithfulness and Your salvation; I have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth From the great assembly.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei ôn tơdrong tơpăt Ih lăm jơhngơ̆m inh, Inh roi tơbăt boih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng tơdrong Ih dŏng pơklaih, Inh ưh kơ đei ôn lăm năr akŭm tih gah tơdrong Ih 'mêm păng tơdrong Ih mơnat sĭt tơpă.

English: Do not withhold Your tender mercies from me, O LORD; Let Your lovingkindness and Your truth continually preserve me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! 'Nĕ chĭt jơhngơ̆m Ih 'mêm mơnat kơ inh. Apinh tơdrong 'mêm păng mơnat sĭt tơpă Ih wei-lăng inh ling-lang.

English: For innumerable evils have surrounded me; My iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; They are more than the hairs of my head; Therefore my heart fails me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đei tơdrong kơnê̆ lơ pă kĕ jô̆ wang tăp kơ inh. Tơdrong kơnê̆ inh druh tam inh boih, Dĭng inh pă gơh 'bôh. Sư lơ tơpă hloh kơ găr sŏk tơ kơpal kơ̆l inh. Jơhngơ̆m inh rơdu.c

English: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me; O LORD, make haste to help me!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih pơklaih inh, Ơ Kră Yang, tĕnh tĕnh bĕ tơgŭm inh.

English: Let them be ashamed and brought to mutual confusion Who seek to destroy my life; Let them be driven backward and brought to dishonor Who wish me evil.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai mă wă pơlôch tơdrong arih inh. Ăn kơ lu sư kơdơ̆ mơlâu păng rŭng răng đĭ-đăng bĕ. Dôm kơ lu bơngai mă wă kơ pơrăm inh Ăn kơ lu sư kơdŭn tơ rŏng mơlâu rŭng răng

English: Let them be confounded because of their shame, Who say to me, “Aha, aha!”
Bahnar: Lu đe bu mă khan kơ inh: “Ha ha!” Ăn kơ lu sư hơwơ̆l yua kơ tơdrong mơlâu lu sư.

English: Let all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; Let such as love Your salvation say continually, “The LORD be magnified!”
Bahnar: Apinh ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă krao chă Ih. Đei tơdrong chơt hiôk păng rơnŭk rơnua lăm Ih. Ăn kơ lu đe bu mă 'mêm kơ tơdrong Ih dŏng pơklaih ling-lang pơma khan thoi âu: “Kră Yang tih hloh?”

English: But I am poor and needy; Yet the LORD thinks upon me. You are my help and my deliverer; Do not delay, O my God.
Bahnar: Gah inh jing dơnuh păng pơmat-tat. Apinh, Kră Yang 'blŏk kơ inh. Ih jơ̆ Kră Yang tơgŭm dŏng inh, Păng Kră Yang pơklaih inh. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Ih 'nĕ pă hiơ̆.

English: Blessed is he who considers the poor; The LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh bơngai bu mă 'blŏk tơtăm bơngai rơdu tơrăn! Lăm năr anat anot Kră Yang gô tơgŭm dŏng sư.

English: The LORD will preserve him and keep him alive, And he will be blessed on the earth; You will not deliver him to the will of his enemies.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô wei-lăng păng wei wêr tơdrong arih sư. Sư gô đei pŭn hiôk kơpal teh păng Kră Yang ưh kơ đei lê̆ bơngai noh kiơ̆ thoi lu ayăt kơ sư wă

English: The LORD will strengthen him on his bed of illness; You will sustain him on his sickbed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơgŭm sư kơplah sư oei jĭ 'bĭch kơpal giơng păng pơklaih tơdrong jĭ bơlŏ sư.b

English: I said, “LORD, be merciful to me; Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh, pơklaih bơhngol inh, yua kơ inh pơm yoch boih hăm Ih.”

English: My enemies speak evil of me: “When will he die, and his name perish?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh, hiap inh: “Sư gô lôch layơ? Anăn sư gô hiong layơ?”

English: And if he comes to see me, he speaks lies; His heart gathers iniquity to itself; When he goes out, he tells it.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu bơngai năm hơpong kơ inh, pơma hơlĕnh kơ inh. Jơhngơ̆m lu sư 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆, lu sư lĕch tơ 'nguaih ră roi tơdrong noh.

English: All who hate me whisper together against me; Against me they devise my hurt.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu areh kơ inh, kư̆m hơnganh kơ inh, Lu sư chă đon wă pơrăm inh.c

English: “An evil disease,” they say, “clings to him. And now that he lies down, he will rise up no more.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Sư jĭ kơnê̆ boih,” ưh pă kĕ layơ iung dơ̆ng. Đơ̆ng anih sư 'bĭch

English: Even my own familiar friend in whom I trusted, Who ate my bread, Has lifted up his heel against me.
Bahnar: Truh tơ buăl inh juăt, d Mă inh gơnang bơngai mă sa boih 'bĕng inh, Kŭm hiŏng kơnơl wă 'lơ̆r inh.

English: But You, O LORD, be merciful to me, and raise me up, That I may repay them.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh mơnat kơ inh păng tơgŭm dŏng inh, Wă kơ inh gơh pơm tơwih kơ lu sư.

English: By this I know that You are well pleased with me, Because my enemy does not triumph over me.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu ayăt ưh pă kĕ jei đơ̆ng noh boih inh băt kơ Ih lăp đon kơ inh.

English: As for me, You uphold me in my integrity, And set me before Your face forever.
Bahnar: Na, đơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt inh, Ih tơiung inh, Ăn inh kơjăp 'bơ̆t anăp Ih ling-lang.

English: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel From everlasting to everlasting! Amen and Amen.
Bahnar: Trŏ kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael Đơ̆ng âu truh tơ ning-mônh ling-lang A-men, A-men!

English: As the deer pants for the water brooks, So pants my soul for You, O God.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Bơhngol inh chang gô Ih. Thoi kon juei 'maih kơ đak glung.

English: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and appear before God?
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh rơhing kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang. Layơ inh gô tơ'bơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: My tears have been my food day and night, While they continually say to me, “Where is your God?”
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t kơplah đe ngăl apinh inh: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih tơ yơ? Na đak măt pơm tơmam sa inh năr păng măng.

English: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul within me. For I used to go with the multitude; I went with them to the house of God, With the voice of joy and praise, With a multitude that kept a pilgrim feast.
Bahnar: Âu inh 'blŏk kơ tơdrong âu, năr bơhngol inh sơ'ngon. Sơ̆ inh năm hăm tơpôl lơ, ba lu sư truh tơ hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Đei nơ̆r jreo chơt păng kơkuh bơnê minh tơpôl lơlap pơm giĕng.

English: Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God, for I shall yet praise Him For the help of His countenance.
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh, yua kơ kiơ ih rơdu klai păng rŭng răng lăm akâu inh. Chang hơmĕng bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Inh oei bơnê ư-ang kơ Sư. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; Therefore I will remember You from the land of the Jordan, And from the heights of Hermon, From the Hill Mizar.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Bơhngol inh rơdu klai lăm ih Na inh 'blŏk kơ Ih. Đơ̆ng char Jôrđăn, Đơ̆ng kơ̆l kông Hermôn păng đơ̆ng groi Misêa.

English: Deep calls unto deep at the noise of Your waterfalls; All Your waves and billows have gone over me.
Bahnar: Anih jrŭ krao anih jrŭ, kiơ̆ jơwa đơ̆ng chơkơi đak Ih. Lu đak poh-yă păng đak tih Ih lơ̆p inh boih.

English: The LORD will command His lovingkindness in the daytime, And in the night His song shall be with me— A prayer to the God of my life.
Bahnar: Kơ'năr Kră Yang pơdah ăn tơdrong Sư mơnat. Gah kơmăng nơ̆r hơri Sư oei hơdai inh.a Nơ̆r krao khan kơ Kră Yang. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ tơdrong arih inh,b

English: I will say to God my Rock, “Why have You forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
Bahnar: Inh gô khan hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơ̆ Tơmo Tih inh: “Yua kơ kiơ ih hiơt kơ inh. Yua kơ kiơ inh sơ'ngon. Yua kơ lu ayăt pơjuă inh.”

English: As with a breaking of my bones, My enemies reproach me, While they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
Bahnar: Prăt năr ngăl apinh: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih tơ yơ?” Kơplah lu sư pơjăm inh pơm kơ kơting inh thoi tơgơ̆ đĭ.c

English: Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God; For I shall yet praise Him, The help of my countenance and my God.
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh, yua kơ kiơ ih rơdu klai păng liơ ih rŭng răng lăm akâu inh? Chang hơmĕng bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Inh oei bơnê ư-ang kơ sư, Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: Vindicate me, O God, And plead my cause against an ungodly nation; Oh, deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Sek tơlang kơ inh bĕ, Păng dŏng inha đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei ưh kơ lui.b Apinh pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơm kơnê̆.

English: For You are the God of my strength; Why do You cast me off? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
Bahnar: Ih boih Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Ih Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh. Liơ Ih achăng lê̆ inh? Liơ inh oei ơh sơ'ngon thoi âu? Yua kơ lu ayăt kơ inh oei pơjuă inh.

English: Oh, send out Your light and Your truth! Let them lead me; Let them bring me to Your holy hill And to Your tabernacle.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih pơchrang tơdrong hơdah păng tơdrong tơpăt Ih. Chông ba inh, truh tơ kông 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng anih Ih oei.

English: Then I will go to the altar of God, To God my exceeding joy; And on the harp I will praise You, O God, my God.
Bahnar: Dang ei inh gô năm truh tơ anih Chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Wă khan truh tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, noh boih tơdrong mă inh chơt hiôk 'nă hal, Ơ Kră Yang, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, Inh gô iŏk brŏ reh bơnê ư-ang kơ Ih.

English: Why are you cast down, O my soul? And why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God; For I shall yet praise Him, The help of my countenance and my God.
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh, yua kơ kiơ ih ơh sơ'ngon? Păng rŭng răng lăm akâu inh? Chang hơmĕng bĕ, kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh oei bơnê kơ Sư, Sư Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh.c

English: We have heard with our ears, O God, Our fathers have told us, The deeds You did in their days, In days of old
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, đon lu nhôn đei kơtơ̆ng, Lu 'bok yă nhôn đei roi ăn, Tơdrong jang Kră Yang đei pơm lăm chăl arih lu sư. Sơ̆ ki sơ̆ kach.

English: You drove out the nations with Your hand, But them You planted; You afflicted the peoples, and cast them out.
Bahnar: Ih đei yua ti Ih puh tơweh kon pơlei pơla, na pơtăm lu 'bok yă nhôn. Ih pơma kơ lu kon pơlei pơla, mă ăn kơ lu 'bok yă nhôn rai pŭn hiôk.

English: For they did not gain possession of the land by their own sword, Nor did their own arm save them; But it was Your right hand, Your arm, and the light of Your countenance, Because You favored them.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ đơ̆ng yua khêl đao sư mă đei dêh char, kư̆m ưh kơ đei đơ̆ng tơpang ti kơdih mă đei jơnei.a Mă-lei đơ̆ng ti 'ma Ih, kơkŏng Ih păng tơdrong hơdah đơ̆ng muh măt Ih. Yua kơ Ih 'mêm kơ lu sư.

English: You are my King, O God; Command victories for Jacob.
Bahnar: Ih boih Kră Yang pơtao inh. Tơ'ngla ăn tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Jakôp.b

English: Through You we will push down our enemies; Through Your name we will trample those who rise up against us.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng Ih lu nhôn puh tơlơ̆ lu ayăt kơ nhôn. Hăm anăn Ih, lu nhôn gô pơjuă lu ayăt mă blah lu nhôn.

English: For I will not trust in my bow, Nor shall my sword save me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh ưh kơ đei gơnang kơ hră inh kơdih Đao inh kư̆m ưh kơ pơklaih inh

English: But You have saved us from our enemies, And have put to shame those who hated us.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih pơklaih lu nhôn boih đơ̆ng lu bơngai areh kơ nhôn, Pơm ăn kơ lu ayăt kơ nhôn mơlâu

English: In God we boast all day long, And praise Your name forever. Selah
Bahnar: Rim năr lu nhôn pơư lăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Păng bơnê kơ anăn Kră Yang ling-lang, truh tơ ning-mônh. Sêla

English: But You have cast us off and put us to shame, And You do not go out with our armies.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei Ih achăng lê̆ lu nhôn boih, pơm ăn kơ lu nhôn mơlâu. Ih kư̆m ưh pă đei nămc hăm lu linh nhôn boih

English: You make us turn back from the enemy, And those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves.
Bahnar: Ih pơm ăn kơ lu nhôn kơdŭn 'bơ̆t anăp lu ayăt, Păng lu areh kơ nhôn, tơgar iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng lu nhôn

English: You have given us up like sheep intended for food, And have scattered us among the nations.
Bahnar: Ih jao lu nhôn nhen thoi triu wă pơm 'nhĕm, Păng pơm ăn kơ lu nhôn tơklah tơklang tơ jơ̆p-jang dêh char.

English: You sell Your people for next to nothing, And are not enriched by selling them.
Bahnar: Ih tĕch boih kon pơlei Ih ưh kơ kăp, Păng lăng lu sư ưh kơ gĭt.

English: You make us a reproach to our neighbors, A scorn and a derision to those all around us.
Bahnar: Ih pơm ăn kơ lu nhôn jing bơngai rông 'bôt nhôn pơjăm, ăn kơ nhôn jing tơmam hơnul păng ăn kơ lu bơngai oei tăp dăr kơ nhôn areh păng hiĕk ăr.

English: You make us a byword among the nations, A shaking of the head among the peoples.
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơ lu nhôn jing đe pơjăm pơđơ̆k tơ jơ̆p teh đak, Kon pơlei, 'bôh nhôn tơtreh kơ̆l.

English: My dishonor is continually before me, And the shame of my face has covered me
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơlâu 'bơ̆t anăp inh rim năr. Tơdrong mơlâu gom đĭ muh măt inh

English: Because of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, Because of the enemy and the avenger.
Bahnar: Păng hiĕk ăr kơ lu nhôn Păng đei lu bơngai ayăt, lu bơngai wă pơm 'mong.

English: All this has come upon us; But we have not forgotten You, Nor have we dealt falsely with Your covenant.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong noh truh boih kơ lu nhôn, mă-lei lu nhôn ưh kơ đei hiơt kơ Ih. Kŭm ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm Ih.

English: Our heart has not turned back, Nor have our steps departed from Your way
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m lu nhôn ưh kơdŭn, jơ̆ng lu nhôn yak ưh kơ đei cheng oei kiơ̆ trong Ih.

English: But You have severely broken us in the place of jackals, And covered us with the shadow of death.
Bahnar: Mă Kră Yang pơrăm nhôn lăm anih lu kŏ bri. Klơ̆p lê̆ lu nhôn hăm măng mu.

English: If we had forgotten the name of our God, Or stretched out our hands to a foreign god
Bahnar: Dah lu nhôn đei hiơt kơ anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, Păng yơ̆r tid năm kiơ̆ yang nai.

English: Would not God search this out? For He knows the secrets of the heart.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ băt tơdrong noh hă? Yua kơ Ih băt tơdrong hlơp lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Yet for Your sake we are killed all day long; We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă, yua kơ Ih boih na đe pơlôch nhôn rim năr. Lu nhôn thoi lu kon triu đe wă 'buh sa.

English: Awake! Why do You sleep, O Lord? Arise! Do not cast us off forever.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, hơđơ̆r bĕ, yua kơ kiơ Ih oei tep? Iung bĕ, 'nĕ kơ achăng lê̆ lu nhôn ling-lang.

English: Why do You hide Your face, And forget our affliction and our oppression?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ Ih ôn muh măt. Hiơt đĭ lu tơdrong pơmat-tat păng đe pơjuă lu nhôn.

English: For our soul is bowed down to the dust; Our body clings to the ground.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơhngol lu nhôn Ih tơmôch tơ lăm 'mui teh. Akâu jăn lu nhôn đĭ klepe tơ teh.

English: Arise for our help, And redeem us for Your mercies’ sake.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih, iung na tơgŭm lu nhôn iŏk bĕ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Ih dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn.

English: My heart is overflowing with a good theme; I recite my composition concerning the King; My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh chhôka hăm tơdrongb 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Inh hơri pơđơ̆kc pôk pơư pơang kơ pơtao, Hơpiĕt inh thoi pla 'long chih lu bơngai hơgei chih.

English: You are fairer than the sons of men; Grace is poured upon Your lips; Therefore God has blessed You forever.
Bahnar: Ih 'lơ̆ng rŏ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo kon bơngai. Hơkŭng 'bơ̆r 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong mơnat. Thoi noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn boih pŭn kơ ih dĭng ning-mônh.

English: Gird Your sword upon Your thigh, O Mighty One, With Your glory and Your majesty.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang nuih pran, tơ̆n bĕ đao tơ kơiĕng Ihd Noh jơ̆ tơdrong ư-ang păng tơdrong tih rŏ Ih.

English: And in Your majesty ride prosperously because of truth, humility, and righteousness; And Your right hand shall teach You awesome things.
Bahnar: Hăm tơdrong tơpăt, tơdrong dim iơ̆m păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Iŏk bĕ tơdrong tih rŏ Ih năm tŏk kĕ jei, Ti 'ma Ih tơ'bôh dôm tơdrong krưp.

English: Your arrows are sharp in the heart of the King’s enemies; The peoples fall under You.
Bahnar: Lu 'brơ̆m Ih suĕng păng han tơpă, prah 'bơm plei nuih lu ayăt kơ pơtao Kon pơlei gô pơ̆k tơ ala jơ̆ng Ih.

English: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; A scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your kingdom.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tang-dŏ pơtao Ih oei oei ling-lang. 'Long jra pơgơ̆r dêh char pơtao Ih, jing 'long jra pơgơ̆r tơpăt.

English: You love righteousness and hate wickedness; Therefore God, Your God, has anointed You With the oil of gladness more than Your companions.
Bahnar: Kră Yang lăp kơ tơdrong tơpăt păng areh tơdrong kơnê̆. Thoi noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Ih, tuh boih đak rơmă kơ Ih. Hăm đak rơmă tơdrong chơt hiôk hloh kơ buăl ih.e

English: All Your garments are scented with myrrh and aloes and cassia, Out of the ivory palaces, by which they have made You glad.
Bahnar: Lu ao tai Ih 'bâu phu pơgang, hơliĕng brang păng hol. Đơ̆ng lăm anih pơtao pơm păng bơla đe reh brŏ đei tơlei pơm kơ Ih chơt hiôk.

English: Kings’ daughters are among Your honorable women; At Your right hand stands the queen in gold from Ophir.
Bahnar: Lăm lu drŏ-kăn mă pơtao gĭt noh đei lu bia, Akăn pơtao oei gah 'ma kơ Ih, Pơguăng păng maih Ôphir.f

English: Listen, O daughter, Consider and incline your ear; Forget your own people also, and your father’s house
Bahnar: Ơ kon drŏ-kăng inh, mơ̆ng bĕ, tơtĭnh bĕ, pơgling đon bĕ. Hiơt bĕ kơ kon pơlei păng hnam dơnŏ 'Bă ih.

English: So the King will greatly desire your beauty; Because He is your Lord, worship Him.
Bahnar: Na pơtao gô hưch wă kơ 'lơ̆ng guăng ih. Yua kơ sư jơ̆ yŏng kơdră ih, Chu yom bĕ kơ sư.

English: And the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift; The rich among the people will seek your favor.
Bahnar: Kon adruhh Tir gô năm ba ăn tơmam, Păng lu bơngai mơdrŏng hloh lăm kon pơlei gô năm apinh tơdrong mơnat ih.

English: The royal daughter is all glorious within the palace; Her clothing is woven with gold.
Bahnar: Kon pơtao lăm anihi pơtao gô ư-ang. Ao tai sư tanh pơgong păng maih

English: She shall be brought to the King in robes of many colors; The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to You.
Bahnar: Sư gô hrŭk ao taij na năm tơ anăp pơtao, Lu adruh hlek jing buăl sư kư̆m năm kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng sư ba sư truh tơ pơtao.l

English: With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought; They shall enter the King’s palace.
Bahnar: Đe gô anhăk ba lu sư truh hăm tơdrong chơt hiôk 'nă hal. Mơ̆t tơ anih pơtao.

English: Instead of Your fathers shall be Your sons, Whom You shall make princes in all the earth.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo ih gô tơplih kơ lu 'bok Ih. Ih gô pơjing lu sư pơm tih pơgơ̆r lăm jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: I will make Your name to be remembered in all generations; Therefore the people shall praise You forever and ever.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơ'blŏk kơ anăn Ih, kơ rim chăl. Yua kơ thoi noh lu kon pơlei pơla gô bơnê kơ Ih ling-lang ưh kơ tôch.

English: God is our refuge and strength, A very present help in trouble.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ anih kơ'nơp păng tơdrong pran kơtang lu nhôn. Sư gôa tơgŭm hloi 'bơ̆t năr anat anot.

English: Therefore we will not fear, Even though the earth be removed, And though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na lu nhôn huay kơ hli mă teh tơplih. Kông pơpơ̆ păng huŏng tơ lăm đak dơsĭ.b

English: Though its waters roar and be troubled, Though the mountains shake with its swelling. Selah
Bahnar: Mă khan đak dơsĭ poh-yă grơ̆m grăm đei blôk. Păng lu kông pơpơ̆ păng tơdrŏ. Sêla

English: There is a river whose streams shall make glad the city of God, The holy place of the tabernacle of the Most High.
Bahnar: Đei đak glung krong ro sư wă pơm chơt hiôk ăn kơ pơlei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Jơ̆ anih rơgoh, pơlei mă Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei

English: God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God shall help her, just at the break of dawn.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm pơlei noh, pơlei ei ưh kơ đei pơpơ̆. Lăp 'brưch pơgê hrôih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư boih.

English: The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved; He uttered His voice, the earth melted.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei rŭng răng, dêh char noh pơpơ̆ ying-yông. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Deic sơkat, teh gô lek đĭ.

English: The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei hơdai lu nhôn. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp jơ̆ anih mă lu nhôn kơ'nơp. Sêla

English: Come, behold the works of the LORD, Who has made desolations in the earth.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ dôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang. Tơdrong sư pơrăm, boih tơ teh đak âu?

English: He makes wars cease to the end of the earth; He breaks the bow and cuts the spear in two; He burns the chariot in the fire.
Bahnar: Sư pơtôch tơdrong tơblah jơ̆p-jang teh đak. Gơ̆ lê̆ hră, gơ̆ lê̆? Tơju rơkhai rơkhônh. Sư soh lê̆ gre tơ lăm ŭnh.

English: Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth!
Bahnar: Hreh bĕ athei băt Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh đe gô pôk pơư tơ jơ̆p dêh char, kư̆m pôk pơư kơ Inh tơ kơpal teh.

English: The LORD of hosts is with us; The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei hăm lu nhôn, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp jơ̆ anih lu nhôn kơ'nơp. Sêla

English: Oh, clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with the voice of triumph!
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla, tap ti bĕ, iŏk nơ̆r jei tih na jreo chhôk kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For the LORD Most High is awesome; He is a great King over all the earth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, a trŏ kơ hli yom. Sư jơ̆ pơtao Tih Hloh kơpal teh đak âu.

English: He will subdue the peoples under us, And the nations under our feet.
Bahnar: Sư pơm ăn kơ lu kon pơlei pơla, chu yom kơ lu nhôn. Păng pơm ăn kơ đĭ teh đak drap ala jơ̆ng lu nhôn.

English: He will choose our inheritance for us, The excellence of Jacob whom He loves. Selah
Bahnar: Sư rơih teh jang sa kơ lu nhôn jơ̆ tơdrong ư-ang Jakôpb mă sư 'mêm. Sêla

English: God has gone up with a shout, The LORD with the sound of a trumpet.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tŏk hăm nơ̆r jreo chơt hiôk, Kră Yang tŏk păr lăm jơwa keng re

English: Sing praises to God, sing praises! Sing praises to our King, sing praises!
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, hơri bĕ, Hơri kơkuh bĕ kơ pơtao lu bơ̆n hơri bĕ.

English: For God is the King of all the earth; Sing praises with understanding.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ pơtao đĭ kơ plĕnh teh. Hơri bơnê jô̆c pơđơ̆k pôk kơ sư bĕ.

English: God reigns over the nations; God sits on His holy throne.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r đĭ teh đak. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ anih Rơgoh Sư.

English: The princes of the people have gathered together, The people of the God of Abraham. For the shields of the earth belong to God; He is greatly exalted.
Bahnar: Yang pơgơ̆r jơ̆p kơ teh đak gô akŭm băl. Pơm kon pơlei pơla Kră Yang Kei-Dei, 'Bok Abraham. Yua kơ khŭl pơtaod lăm teh đak âu tă gah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl. Pôk pơư kơ sư yŏng Tih Hloh.

English: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised In the city of our God, In His holy mountain.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jơ̆ Yŏng mơng, trŏ kơ kơkuh. Lăm pơlei 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, tơ kơpal kông Rơgoh Sư.

English: Beautiful in elevation, The joy of the whole earth, Is Mount Zion on the sides of the north, The city of the great King.
Bahnar: Kông Siôn 'lơ̆ng rŏ chơngôl kơjung, thoi anih kơjung Saphon noh, kông Siôn pơlei kơ pơtao tih oei, jing tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ đĭ teh đak.

English: God is in her palaces; He is known as her refuge.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei tih noh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơdah boih akâu sư kơdih thoi minh anih kơ'nơp kơjăp.

English: For behold, the kings assembled, They passed by together.
Bahnar: Yua kơ to lu pơtao pơkă băl. Kŭm wang năm hơdai blah pơlei noh.

English: They saw it, and so they marveled; They were troubled, they hastened away.
Bahnar: Lu sư truh, 'bôh pơlei Siôn lăng chrêu kơ đon hli, na hăt hot kơdâu ôn.

English: Fear took hold of them there, And pain, as of a woman in birth pangs
Bahnar: Tơ noh lu sư hli tơtơ̆.a Lu sư jĭ jăn pơmat thoi drŏ-kăn tơpŭ.

English: As when You break the ships of Tarshish With an east wind.
Bahnar: Ih yua kial đơ̆ng hơlĕch pơrăm pơchah lu Duk Tarsis

English: As we have heard, So we have seen In the city of the LORD of hosts, In the city of our God: God will establish it forever. Selah
Bahnar: Tơdrong kiơ̆ mă lu nhôn kơtơ̆ng noh lu nhôn 'bôh boih. Lăm pơlei Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Wă khan lăm pơlei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing boih pơlei noh. Kơjăp ling-lang, ling-lang. Sêla

English: We have thought, O God, on Your lovingkindness, In the midst of Your temple.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lăm Hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Ih. Lu nhôn tơtĭnh 'blŏk kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat đơ̆ng Ih.

English: According to Your name, O God, So is Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is full of righteousness.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, anăn Ih thoi yơ! Na tơdrong kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih, Kŭm thoi noh truh tơ tôch kơ teh đak. Ti 'ma Ih 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong tơpăt.

English: Let Mount Zion rejoice, Let the daughters of Judah be glad, Because of Your judgments.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong Ih sek tơlang, na lu kông Siôn chơt hiôk, Lu kon adruhb Juđa 'nă hal

English: Walk about Zion, And go all around her. Count her towers
Bahnar: Dăr bĕ tăp kơ Siôn yak tăp dăr bĕ kơ pơlei tih. Jô̆ bĕ lu Hnam thôt Sư.

English: Mark well her bulwarks; Consider her palaces; That you may tell it to the generation following.
Bahnar: Lăng hơlen bĕ lu anih kơjăp Sư,c dur kơjăp sư. Wă kơ gơh roi kơ lu bơngai đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng.

English: For this is God, Our God forever and ever; He will be our guide Even to death.
Bahnar: Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'nâu jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn ling-lang hlŏng hloi. Sư gô chông anhăk nhôn ling-lang hlŏng hloi.d

English: Hear this, all peoples; Give ear, all inhabitants of the world
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla, mơ̆ng bĕ tơdrong âu, Ơ đĭ-đăng bơngai oei kơpal teh. Pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ.

English: Both low and high, Rich and poor together.
Bahnar: Mă bơngai pơm iĕa dah bơngai pơm tih.b Đĭ bơngai mơdrŏng kư̆m thoi bơngai dơnuh hin.

English: My mouth shall speak wisdom, And the meditation of my heart shall give understanding.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r inh gô pơma tơdrong hơgeic tơdrong tơchĕng đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m gô jing tơdrong hlôh wao.d

English: I will incline my ear to a proverb; I will disclose my dark saying on the harp.
Bahnar: Inh gô mơ̆ng nơ̆r pơđơ̆k, Inh gô iŏk brŏ reh tơlang tơdrong pơpơn.

English: Why should I fear in the days of evil, When the iniquity at my heels surrounds me?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ inh athei hli lăm năr đei tơdrong gleh truh. Dah tơdrong kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăte wang tăp kơ inh?

English: Those who trust in their wealth And boast in the multitude of their riches
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gơnang kơ jên tơmam lu sư, Pơư mŭk tơmam lơ, mơdrŏng lu sư.

English: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, Nor give to God a ransom for him
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh huai iŏk 'nhŏng oh lu sư kơdih.f Kŭm ưh kơ đei bu kĕ ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmam wă huai iŏk.

English: For the redemption of their souls is costly, And it shall cease forever
Bahnar: Wă kơ gơh đei arih ling-lang. Huay kơ 'bôh tơdrong ôm răm.g

English: That he should continue to live eternally, And not see the Pit.
Bahnar: Yua kơ huai iŏk tơdrong arih lu sư kăp dêh tơpă. Sư wă răt ưh kơ kĕ.h

English: For he sees wise men die; Likewise the fool and the senseless person perish, And leave their wealth to others.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư 'bôh bơngai hơgei lôch, lu bơngai wơnh păng lu kơtul kơwao kư̆m lôch lei-lăi mơ̆n. Mŭk tơmam sư kơ đe nai.

English: Their inner thought is that their houses will last forever, Their dwelling places to all generations; They call their lands after their own names.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơchĕng khan. Hnam inh gô oei oei ling-lang, Păng anih inh oei oei lăm đĭ jơhnơr. Lu sư kư̆m iŏk anăn lu sư pơm anăn kơ chŭn mir lu sư.

English: Nevertheless man, though in honor, does not remain; He is like the beasts that perish.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai mă khan mơdrŏng tih kư̆m pă oei ling-langi Lu sư thoi sem brem gô hiong răm.

English: This is the way of those who are foolish, And of their posterity who approve their sayings. Selah
Bahnar: Âu boih trong mă lu sư kiơ̆, noh jơ̆ tơdrong kơtul kơ hlôh lu sư. Đei bơngai kư̆m lăp kơ tơdrong lu sư pơma. Sêla

English: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; Death shall feed on them; The upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; And their beauty shall be consumed in the grave, far from their dwelling.
Bahnar: Thoi khŭl triu, đe wă 'bŭ lăm bơsat. Tơdrong lôch gô wei lu sư: Truh pơgê lu bơngai tơpăt gô pơgơ̆r lu sư, Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ lu sư ôm răm đĭ tơ pơlei lôch, ataih đơ̆ng anih lu sư oei.

English: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave, For He shall receive me. Selah
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô huai iŏk bơhngol inh đơ̆ng dêh atâu.j Yua kơ sư gô sơng iŏk inh. Sêla

English: Do not be afraid when one becomes rich, When the glory of his house is increased
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli mă bơngai bu rai mơdrŏng, tơdah hnam sư noh mŭk tơmam rai dêh lơ

English: For when he dies he shall carry nothing away; His glory shall not descend after him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ dah sư lôch ưh kơ đei gơh chĕp ba kiơ. Mŭk măk sư kư̆m ưh kơ kiơ̆ sư tơ lăm bơsat mơ̆n.

English: Though while he lives he blesses himself (For men will praise you when you do well for yourself)
Bahnar: Mă khan kơplah oei arih sư đei pŭn hiôk.k Đe pơư kơ sư đei 'bôh jang sa mơdrŏng

English: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; They shall never see light.
Bahnar: Sư gô năm kiơ̆ tơ anih 'bok yă lu sư; Lu sư pă đei 'bôh boih tơdrong hơdah.

English: A man who is in honor, yet does not understand, Is like the beasts that perish.
Bahnar: Bơngai mơdrŏng mơng, Mă-lei ưh kơ hlôh wao Kŭm thoi sem brem gô hiong răm.

English: The Mighty One, God the LORD, Has spoken and called the earth From the rising of the sun to its going down.
Bahnar: Tơ'ngla mơsêh, jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kră Yang khan: Sư krao kon bơngai lăm teh đak. Đơ̆ng gah măt 'năr lĕch, truh tơ gah măt 'năr mơ̆ta

English: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God will shine forth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Siôn 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơchrang boih. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư.

English: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silent; A fire shall devour before Him, And it shall be very tempestuous all around Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n truh ưh kơ đei ngăn đĕch ôh. 'Bơ̆t anăp Sư đei pla ŭnh soh chhông Tăp dăr kơ Sư đei hơbŭt hơbang tih tơpă.

English: He shall call to the heavens from above, And to the earth, that He may judge His people
Bahnar: Sư krao lu plĕnh kơpal ti, Păng tơ ala teh âu wă sek tơlang kon pơlei pơla Sư

English: “Gather My saints together to Me, Those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
Bahnar: “Akŭm bĕ hăm Inh! Ơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, lu bơngai iŏk boih tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'bih Inh hăm tơmam soi.”

English: Let the heavens declare His righteousness, For God Himself is Judge. Selah
Bahnar: Tơ plĕnh roi tơbăt tơdrong tơpăt Sư. Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei boih Tơ'ngla sek tơlang. Sêla

English: “Hear, O My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you; I am God, your God!
Bahnar: “Ơ kon pơlei inh, mơ̆ng bĕ, inh gô pơma. Ơ Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ, Inh gô pơm kơdranh plơ̆ hăm iĕm. Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: I will not rebuke you for your sacrifices Or your burnt offerings, Which are continually before Me.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ chrih ôh tơmam soi ih pơyơ̆r wă khan tơmam soi 'buh ih juăt pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: I will not take a bull from your house, Nor goats out of your folds.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m ưh kơ kălb kơ Rơmo tơno đơ̆ng hnam ih. Dah bơbe bram đơ̆ng lăm khŭl bơbe ih

English: For every beast of the forest is Mine, And the cattle on a thousand hills.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng sem bri tă kơ tơmam Inh ngăl. Lu khŭl kon sem tơ rơbâu bon kông groi kư̆m lei-lăi.c
