English: I know all the birds of the mountains, And the wild beasts of the field are Mine.
Bahnar: Inh băt đĭ lu sem păr lăm kông, Đĭ dôm tơmam pơpơ̆ lăm chŭn mir tă kơ gah Inh ngăl.

English: “If I were hungry, I would not tell you; For the world is Mine, and all its fullness.
Bahnar: Tơdah inh pơngot, Inh ưh kơ roi kơ ih; Yua kơ teh đak păng tôm tơmam lăm noh tă kơ tơmam inh ngăl.

English: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, Or drink the blood of goats?
Bahnar: Inh hăm sa 'nhĕm rơmo tơno, Dah hăm huch pham bơbe bram?

English: Offer to God thanksgiving, And pay your vows to the Most High.
Bahnar: Pơyơ̆r nơ̆r bơnê ih kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, păng pơkeh nơ̆r pơkă ih hăm Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr anat anot krao bĕ Inh. Inh gô pơklaih ih, na ih gô bơnê ư-ang kơ Inh.”

English: But to the wicked God says: “What right have you to declare My statutes, Or take My covenant in your mouth
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆: “Liơ ih oei roi dôm tơdrong juăt Inh? Yua kơ kiơ 'bơ̆r ih pơma gah tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh?

English: Seeing you hate instruction And cast My words behind you?
Bahnar: Tơpă ih areh kơ tơdrong Inh bơtho pơrăm, Hŭt lê̆ tơ rŏng dôm nơ̆r Inh bơtho

English: When you saw a thief, you consented with him, And have been a partaker with adulterers.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih 'bôh bơngai tơtông, na lăp đon hơdai sư.d Ih wang lăp đon kiơ̆ bơngai pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: You give your mouth to evil, And your tongue frames deceit.
Bahnar: Ih yua 'bơ̆r ih pơma kơnê̆, Hơpiĕt ih huăt kư̆ kă hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: You sit and speak against your brother; You slander your own mother’s son.
Bahnar: Ih pơma kơnê̆ kơ lu 'nhŏng oh pơma hơlĕnh kơ kon drŏ-nglo mĕ ih.

English: These things you have done, and I kept silent; You thought that I was altogether like you; But I will rebuke you, And set them in order before your eyes.
Bahnar: Noh boih mă tơdrong ih đei pơm. Mă-lei Inh hreh đĕch Ih tơchĕng Inh lei-lăi kơ ih, Mă-lei Inh gô chrih kơ ih, păng jô̆ hloi ih yoch 'bơ̆t anăp ih.

English: “Now consider this, you who forget God, Lest I tear you in pieces, And there be none to deliver
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ơ lu bơngai hiơt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lăng bĕ tơdrong 'nâu. Inh gô hek pơrăm ih, ưh kơ đei bu dŏng ôh.

English: Whoever offers praise glorifies Me; And to him who orders his conduct aright I will show the salvation of God.”
Bahnar: Bu pơyơ̆r nơ̆r bơnê tơmam soi kơkuh ư-ang kơ Inh; păng sư kiơ̆ trong Inh; Inh gô tơ'bôh tơdrong dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Have mercy upon me, O God, According to Your lovingkindness; According to the multitude of Your tender mercies, Blot out my transgressions.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh mơnat ăn kơ inh kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong 'mêm Ih. Apinh Ih sut lê̆ dôm tơdrong inh pơm yoch, kiơ̆ kơ Ih mơnat.

English: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, And cleanse me from my sin.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih ôp rơgoh đĭ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ inh, Păng ăn kơ inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đơ̆ng yoch.

English: For I acknowledge my transgressions, And my sin is always before me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh băt kơ inh đei pơm yoch, tơdrong yoch oei 'bơ̆t anăp inh ling-lang.

English: Against You, You only, have I sinned, And done this evil in Your sight— That You may be found just when You speak, And blameless when You judge.
Bahnar: Inh pơm yoch boih hăm Ih. Lăp minh 'nu Ih đĕch, păng pơm kơnê̆ boih 'bơ̆t anăp Ih. Ih tơpăt, mưh Ih sek tơdrong păng trŏ 'lơ̆ng dah Ih sek tơlang.

English: Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity, And in sin my mother conceived me.
Bahnar: Tơpă, tơpŭ kơ inh lăm tơdrong kơnê̆, mĕ inh anăp kơ inh lăm tơdrong yoch.

English: Behold, You desire truth in the inward parts, And in the hidden part You will make me to know wisdom.
Bahnar: Âu, Ih wă kơ 'bôh đei tơdrong tơpăt tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m Ih pơhrăm inh đei tơdrong hơgei mă hlơp lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih iŏk hla bơngăl sut rơgoh yoch inh, na inh gô 'lơ̆ng, Apinh ôp inh, na inh gô jing kok hloh kơ prĕl.

English: Make me hear joy and gladness, That the bones You have broken may rejoice.
Bahnar: Ăn bĕ kơ inh tơdrong chơt hiôk 'nă hal. Wă kơ lu kơting kơtong mă Kră Yang gơ̆ lê̆ gô hiôk-hian.

English: Hide Your face from my sins, And blot out all my iniquities.
Bahnar: Ôn muh măt Ih 'nĕ pă lăng tơdrong yoch inh, Păng sut rơgoh đĭ yoch kơnê̆ inh.

English: Create in me a clean heart, O God, And renew a steadfast spirit within me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh Ih pơjing lăm Inh đei minh jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng rơgoh,a Păng pơjing ming 'nao lăm inh minh pôm bơhngol tơpăt.

English: Do not cast me away from Your presence, And do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
Bahnar: Apinh 'nĕ puh lê̆ inh đơ̆ng anăp Ih. Kŭm 'nĕ kơ iŏk lê̆ Yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng Ih đơ̆ng inh.

English: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, And uphold me by Your generous Spirit.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih ăn kơ inh tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ tơdrong dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng Ih. Ăn kơ inh đei jơhngơ̆m 'maih kiơ̆ păng tơgŭm hloi inh đei kơjăp inh oei kơjăp.

English: Then I will teach transgressors Your ways, And sinners shall be converted to You.
Bahnar: Na inh gô bơtho trong Ih kơ lu pơm glăi, Păng lu bơngai đei yoch gô wih tơ Ih.

English: Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God, The God of my salvation, And my tongue shall sing aloud of Your righteousness.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng pơklaih inh, Apinh ih pơklaih inh đơ̆ng tơdrong tơlĕch pham, Noh na hơpiĕt inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: O Lord, open my lips, And my mouth shall show forth Your praise.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih pơih 'bơ̆r inh. Na 'bơ̆r inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih.

English: For You do not desire sacrifice, or else I would give it; You do not delight in burnt offering.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih ưh kơ wă tơmam soi ră mă-lei inh pơyơ̆r boih. Lu tơmam soi 'buh Ih kư̆m ưh kơ lăp đon.

English: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit, A broken and a contrite heart— These, O God, You will not despise.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơm Yang lăp đon Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei noh jơ̆ jơhngơ̆m pơchah. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Jơhngơ̆m tơbral pơchah Ih kư̆m ưh kơ pơdê.

English: Do good in Your good pleasure to Zion; Build the walls of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pơm 'lơ̆ngb bĕ kơ Siôn kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong Ih tơchĕng 'lơ̆ng. Man pơdơ̆ngc bĕ dur Anăp.

English: Then You shall be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, With burnt offering and whole burnt offering; Then they shall offer bulls on Your altar.
Bahnar: Dang ei Kră Yang lăp đon kơ tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'buh pơkhôi đĭ akâu, Dang ei rơmo dăm gô pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal chơnang soi Ih.

English: Why do you boast in evil, O mighty man? The goodness of God endures continually.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai nuih pran, liơ ih pơang kơdih tơdrong kơnê̆. Tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei oei ling-lang.

English: Your tongue devises destruction, Like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
Bahnar: Đĭ năr ih chă pơm kơnê̆. Hơpiĕt thoi săng kôih han ih pơma hơlĕnh.

English: You love evil more than good, Lying rather than speaking righteousness. Selah
Bahnar: Ih wă kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ hloh kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, 'Maih pơma hơlĕnh hloh kơ pơma tơpăt Sêla

English: You love all devouring words, You deceitful tongue.
Bahnar: Ơ hơpiĕt hơlĕnh. Ih 'mêm dêh kơ nơ̆r wă pơrăm.a

English: God shall likewise destroy you forever; He shall take you away, and pluck you out of your dwelling place, And uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơrăm ih hlŏng hloi, Sư gô rôp ih, dui tơlĕch đơ̆ng anih ih. Păng buch lê̆b ih đơ̆ng teh lu bơngai arih. Sêla

English: The righteous also shall see and fear, And shall laugh at him, saying
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt gô 'bôh păng hli, Păng hiĕk kơ sư na khan

English: “Here is the man who did not make God his strength, But trusted in the abundance of his riches, And strengthened himself in his wickedness.”
Bahnar: “To, bơngai mă ưh kơ gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wei sư pran kơjăp. Mă-lei gơnang kơ tơdrong sư mơdrŏng.c Wă pơm kơ sư kơjăp lăm tơdrong sư pơm kơnê̆!”

English: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever.
Bahnar: Gah inh thoi 'long ôliwơ hơdrih 'lơ̆ng lăm Hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh lui gơnang kơ tơdrong 'mêm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: I will praise You forever, Because You have done it; And in the presence of Your saints I will wait on Your name, for it is good.
Bahnar: Inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih ling-lang, yua kơ Ih đei pơm tơdrong noh, Inh gô gơnang kơ Anăn Ih 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai lui gơnang kơ Ih,d yua kơ Anăn Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity; There is none who does good.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơtul kơwao khan: “Lăm jơhngơ̆m sư, ưh kơ đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.” Lu sư răm-'băm, pơm kơnê̆ krưp. Ưh kơ đei bu pơm 'lơ̆ng.

English: God looks down from heaven upon the children of men, To see if there are any who understand, who seek God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh, nger lăng kon bơngai,a Wă lăng hăm đei bu gơh hơgei wă chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh.

English: Every one of them has turned aside; They have together become corrupt; There is none who does good, No, not one.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư kơdŭn tơ rŏng jing răm-'băm Ưh kơ đei bu pơm 'lơ̆ng, 'nhŏ kơ minh 'nu hoh-hoy.

English: Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, Who eat up my people as they eat bread, And do not call upon God?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ hăm trŏ kơ lu sư bơngai kơ hlôh kơ băt? Lu sư luăn sa kon Pơlei Inh, thoi sa 'bĕng, Păng kư̆m kuă kơ apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: There they are in great fear Where no fear was, For God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you; You have put them to shame, Because God has despised them.
Bahnar: To lu sư hli tơrơ. Mă tơ anih noh ưh kơ đei kiơ hli ră. Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hŭt lê̆ kơting bơngai blah ih. Ih pơm kơ lu sư mơlâu, yua kơ Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei achăng lê̆ lu sư boih.

English: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When God brings back the captivity of His people, Let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.
Bahnar: Ơ! Kuă kơ kiơ đơ̆ng Siôn tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Isơrael jah truh! Kơplah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ba tơbrŏk lu kon pơlei sư đêl pơm bơnă. Kơplah noh Jakôp gô chơt hiôk păng Isơrael gô 'nă hal.

English: Save me, O God, by Your name, And vindicate me by Your strength.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Hăm anăn Ih pơklaih inh. Yua tơdrong mơsêh Ih sek dŏng inh tơpăt.

English: Hear my prayer, O God; Give ear to the words of my mouth.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao khan. Pơgling đon Ih, mơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh krao khan.

English: For strangers have risen up against me, And oppressors have sought after my life; They have not set God before them. Selah
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai tơmoia blah inh; Bơngai kơnê̆ chă wă pơrăm tơdrong arih inh.b Lu sư ưh kơ tơchĕng kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, Sêla

English: Behold, God is my helper; The Lord is with those who uphold my life.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei boih tơgŭm dŏng inh; Kră Yang boih Tơ'ngla wei bơhngol inh.

English: He will repay my enemies for their evil. Cut them off in Your truth.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơm tơwihc kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh; Apinh pơlôch bĕ lu sư, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih.

English: I will freely sacrifice to You; I will praise Your name, O LORD, for it is good.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, inh gô pơyơ̆r kơ Ih tơmam soi đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m wă. Kŭm gô hơri bơnê kơ anăn Ih, Yua kơ Anăn Ih 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: For He has delivered me out of all trouble; And my eye has seen its desire upon my enemies.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih pơklaih inh đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat; Măt inh 'bôh lu ayăt thuơ kơ inh boih.d

English: Give ear to my prayer, O God, And do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao khan. 'Nĕ kơ ôn muh măt Ih, kơ tơdrong inh krao apinh.

English: Attend to me, and hear me; I am restless in my complaint, and moan noisily
Bahnar: Apinh Ih mơ̆ng păng tơl tơwih kơ inh. Inh sơ'ngon, tơtăm păng rŭng răng.

English: Because of the voice of the enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked; For they bring down trouble upon me, And in wrath they hate me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r lu ayăt ôr pơret păng đơ̆ng lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơjuă pơđep inh; Yua kơ lu sư thim tơdrong kơnê̆ tơ inh. Pơmat inh krưp tơpă. Păng druh pơm kơ inh hăm hil blĕk dêh.

English: My heart is severely pained within me, And the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
Bahnar: Inh jĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m inh dêh, Tơdrong hli kơ lôch blah inh.

English: Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me, And horror has overwhelmed me.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli păng tơrơ truh tơ inh. Tơdrong hli krưp kư̆m gom inh.

English: So I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest.
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Ơ rŏ kơ inh đei pơnăr thoi sem kơtơp, na gô păr pơdơh tơ anih nai.

English: Indeed, I would wander far off, And remain in the wilderness. Selah
Bahnar: Tơpă, inh gô kơdâu ôn tơ ataih, na oei tơ lăm char glă. Sêla

English: I would hasten my escape From the windy storm and tempest.”
Bahnar: Inh hăt hot kơdâu kơ'nơp đơ̆ng kial tih wă weh hlôi đơ̆ng hơbŭt hơbang.”

English: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues, For I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, pơrŭng bĕ lu sư, pơm kơ nơ̆r lu sư jing hơwơ̆l; Inh 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ tơgar pơjah băl lăm plei tih.

English: Day and night they go around it on its walls; Iniquity and trouble are also in the midst of it.
Bahnar: Măng păng năr lu sư dăr tăp kơ dur pơlei tih; Đei pơm kơnê̆ băl păng tơhil băl lăm plei tih.

English: Destruction is in its midst; Oppression and deceit do not depart from its streets.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơrăm băl oei lăm noh, tơdrong pơjuă băl păng hơlĕnh pơdăr ưh kơ weh đơ̆ng trong tih.

English: For it is not an enemy who reproaches me; Then I could bear it. Nor is it one who hates me who has exalted himself against me; Then I could hide from him.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ lu ayăt kơ inh che bơle kơ inh, tơdah thoi ei, na inh kĕ pŭ iŏk mơ̆n; Kŭm ưh kơ sĭ lu areh kơ inh, pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh; Tơdah thoi ei lei inh kơdâu đơ̆ng sư.

English: But it was you, a man my equal, My companion and my acquaintance.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih boih lei-lăi kơ inh, bôl hăm inh, buăl juăt inh.

English: We took sweet counsel together, And walked to the house of God in the throng.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn đei pơđâu băl 'lơ̆ng tơpă; lu nhôn năm hơdai tơpôl lơ truh tơ hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Let death seize them; Let them go down alive into hell, For wickedness is in their dwellings and among them.
Bahnar: Ăn tơdrong lôch truh tơ lu ayăt kơ inh! Tơjur lu sư oei arih tơ lăm dêh atâu. Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ oei tơ lăm hnam, lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư.

English: As for me, I will call upon God, And the LORD shall save me.
Bahnar: Gah inh krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: Evening and morning and at noon I will pray, and cry aloud, And He shall hear my voice.
Bahnar: Pơgê hrôih, 'năr dơ̆ng glơh kơsơ̆, Inh gô sơ'ngon hơdrĭ ôr krao; Sư gô mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh.

English: He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me, For there were many against me.
Bahnar: Sư pơklaih bơhngol inh đơ̆ng tơdrong tơblah, Păng ăn kơ inh hiôk-hian. Yua kơ lơ tơpă bơngai tơblah păng inh.

English: God will hear, and afflict them, Even He who abides from of old. Selah Because they do not change, Therefore they do not fear God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơ̆ Tơ'ngla đơ̆ng sơ̆. Gô mơ̆ng păng pơm tơwih pơrăm lu sư. Sêla Yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ đei tơplih lăm tơdrong lu sư pơm. Kŭm ưh kơ hli kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: He has put forth his hands against those who were at peace with him; He has broken his covenant.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh hiŏng ti pơrăm lu bơngai oei 'lơ̆ng hăm lu sư. Păng plơ̆ plĕch nơ̆r lu sư pơkă.

English: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, But war was in his heart; His words were softer than oil, Yet they were drawn swords.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r lu sư pơma rơbơ̆r hloh kơ rơmă. Mă-lei lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư chă tơdrong tơblah. Nơ̆r lu sư rơngơp hloh kơ rơmă, mă-lei nhen đao toh boih đơ̆ng hơnglop.

English: Cast your burden on the LORD, And He shall sustain you; He shall never permit the righteous to be moved.
Bahnar: Jao bĕ pŭ trăp ih kơ Kră Yang. Sư gô tơiung Ih; Sư ưh kơ đei lê̆ lu bơngai tơpăt pơ̆k.

English: But You, O God, shall bring them down to the pit of destruction; Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; But I will trust in You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih boih gô. Klơ̆m lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ chă pơhlŭ đe. Lu sư ưh pă đei arih truh minh puăt chăl đêl pơkă. Gah inh gô lui gơnang kơ Ih.

English: Be merciful to me, O God, for man would swallow me up; Fighting all day he oppresses me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh; Yua kơ đe wă pơjuăa inh; Rim năr lu sư blah inh.

English: My enemies would hound me all day, For there are many who fight against me, O Most High.
Bahnar: Prăt năr lu ayăt kơ inh, 'maih pơm kơ inh. Yua kơ lu bơngai tơblah păng inh lu sư pơang dêh.

English: Whenever I am afraid, I will trust in You.
Bahnar: Lăm năr hli tơrơ. Inh gô gơnang kơ Ih.

English: In God (I will praise His word), In God I have put my trust; I will not fear. What can flesh do to me?
Bahnar: Inh hơmĕng kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hơri bơnê kơ nơ̆r Sư. Inh lui gơnang kơb Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, inh ưh kơ đei hli kơ kiơ. Kon bơngai sĕch akar gô pơm kiơ kơ inh.

English: All day they twist my words; All their thoughts are against me for evil.
Bahnar: Rim năr lu sư chă pơma hơlĕnh kơ nơ̆r inh,c dôm đon lu sư tơchĕng wă pơrăm inh.

English: They gather together, They hide, they mark my steps, When they lie in wait for my life.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơđâud chop lănge đêl jơ̆ng inh yak. Lu sư 'maih pơrăm tơdrong arih inh.

English: Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, O God!
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm kơnê̆ thoi noh na lê̆ lu sư klaih hă? Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lăm tơdrong Ih hil păng apinh Ih blah tơhuŏng lu kon pơlei.

English: You number my wanderings; Put my tears into Your bottle; Are they not in Your book?
Bahnar: Kră Yang jô̆ rim yak inh, mă năm mă brŏk;f Ih mong đak măt inh lăm kơhnŏk Ih. Đak măt inh Ih ưh kơ chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar ih hă?

English: When I cry out to You, Then my enemies will turn back; This I know, because God is for me.
Bahnar: Năr inh krao apinh, lu ayăt kơ inh gô kơdŭn tơ rŏng; Inh băt kơ tơdrong 'nâu, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai inh.

English: In God (I will praise His word), In the LORD (I will praise His word)
Bahnar: Inh gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hơri bơnê kơ nơ̆r Sư. Inh gơnang kơ Kră Yang păng hơri bơnê kơ nơ̆r Sư.

English: In God I have put my trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
Bahnar: Inh gô gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, huay pă hli kơ kiơ; Lu kon bơngai gơh pơm kiơ kơ inh?

English: Vows made to You are binding upon me, O God; I will render praises to You
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơdrong inh pơkă hăm Ih,g inh gô pơsĭt. Inh gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi bơnê kơ Ih.

English: For You have delivered my soul from death. Have You not kept my feet from falling, That I may walk before God In the light of the living?
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih dŏng pơklaih bơhngol inh đơ̆ng lôch; Ih kiơ̆ bơwei jơ̆ng inh huay kơ tơpling pơ̆k! Wă kơ inh năm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih hơdah hơdong.

English: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me! For my soul trusts in You; And in the shadow of Your wings I will make my refuge, Until these calamities have passed by.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh mơnat kơ inh, apinh mơnat kơ inh; Yua kơ bơhngol inh kơ'nơp tơ lăm Ih. Inh gô kơ'nơp tơ ala pơnăr Ih. Dĭng hloh kơ năr kơnê̆ pă đei.

English: I will cry out to God Most High, To God who performs all things for me.
Bahnar: Inh krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă pơm pơsĭt tôm tơdrong kơ inh.

English: He shall send from heaven and save me; He reproaches the one who would swallow me up. Selah God shall send forth His mercy and His truth.
Bahnar: Sư tơjur ăn đơ̆ng plĕnha tơdrong dŏng pơklaih inh. Sư gô hil chrih kơ lu bơngai pơjuă inh. Sêla Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơih ăn tơdrong 'mêm mơnat păng tơdrong tơpăt Sư.

English: My soul is among lions; I lie among the sons of men Who are set on fire, Whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh oei tŏk-bŏk dăm-brang Inh 'bĭch tŏk-bŏk lu sem bri sa bơngai. Mă đei hơnĕnh thoi tơju păng thoi 'brơ̆m, Hơpiĕt lu sư nhen đao suĕng han.

English: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let Your glory be above all the earth.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ăn kơ anăn Ih kơkuh pơyom hloh kơ plĕnh. Ăn tơdrong ư-ang tơ jơ̆p kơpal kơ teh!

English: They have prepared a net for my steps; My soul is bowed down; They have dug a pit before me; Into the midst of it they themselves have fallen. Selah
Bahnar: Lu sư dăng hơnhuăl kơ jơ̆ng inh. Bơhngol inh rơdu rơmơ̆n. Lu sư sir sơlŭng 'bơ̆t anăp inh. Mă-lei lu sư huŏng kơdih tơ lăm noh. Sêla

English: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and give praise.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơhngơ̆m inh kơjăp, jơhngơ̆m inh kơjăp boih. Inh gô hơri păng hơri bơnê Kơ Sư.

English: Awake, my glory! Awake, lute and harp! I will awaken the dawn.
Bahnar: Hơđơ̆r bĕ ơ bơhngol inh! Ơ tĭng-nĭng păng brŏ tơlei, hơdơ̆r bĕ! Inh kư̆m hơdơ̆r đơ̆ng hrôih.

English: I will praise You, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing to You among the nations.
Bahnar: Kră Yang inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih lăm kon pơlei pơla. Hơri bơnê kơ Ih tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: For Your mercy reaches unto the heavens, And Your truth unto the clouds.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Ih truh tơ plĕnh. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih kơjung truh tơ hơmơ̆l.

English: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; Let Your glory be above all the earth.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ anăn Ih kơkuh pơyom hloh tơ kơpal plĕnh. Ăn kơ tơdrong ư-ang Ih tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: Do you indeed speak righteousness, you silent ones? Do you judge uprightly, you sons of men?
Bahnar: Ơ lu drŏ-nglo kon bơngai, lu iĕm ngăn hăm trŏ pơma 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ưh? Lu iĕm sek tơlang kon bơngai tơpăt hă?

English: No, in heart you work wickedness; You weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth.
Bahnar: Ưh ôh lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm tơchĕng tơdrong kơnê̆, na ti iĕm pơm kơnê̆a Tơ lăm teh đak.

English: The wicked are estranged from the womb; They go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đei đơ̆ng oei lăm klak mĕ sư. Lu sư pơma hơlĕnh plêl iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao tơpŭ.

English: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent; They are like the deaf cobra that stops its ear
Bahnar: Hơkăm lu sư thoi hơkăm 'bih: Lu sư thoi 'bih dong klĭk chĭt lê̆ đon sư.

English: Which will not heed the voice of charmers, Charming ever so skillfully.
Bahnar: Ưh pă 'maih mơ̆ng nơ̆r bơngai pơhlŭ; Mă pơhlŭ hơlĕnh hơgei dang yơ.

English: Break their teeth in their mouth, O God! Break out the fangs of the young lions, O LORD!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh ih gơ̆ lê̆ hơnĕnh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu sư. Ơ Kră Yang, apinh gơ̆ lê̆ grĕng dăm-brang mơlôh.

English: Let them flow away as waters which run continually; When he bends his bow, Let his arrows be as if cut in pieces.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư hiong, thoi đak pơhoch! Dah sư tah 'brơ̆m rĕng, pơm kơ 'brơ̆m noh tŭl.

English: Let them be like a snail which melts away as it goes, Like a stillborn child of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư thoi hơbâu hiong biŏng năm tơ nai. Kŭm thoi nge đe tơhuŏng rơngăt. Ưh kơ 'bôh măt 'năr!

English: Before your pots can feel the burning thorns, He shall take them away as with a whirlwind, As in His living and burning wrath.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ pla ŭnh truh tơ gŏ lu iĕm. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kial hơbŭt tih pơđông lê̆ hơpaih. Mă oei hơdrih dah ŭnh oei sa.

English: The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt gô chơt hiôk dah lu sư 'bôh tơdrong pơm tơwih, kơ bơngai kơnê̆. Lu sư gô tong jơ̆ng tơ pham lu bơngai kơnê̆.

English: So that men will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous; Surely He is God who judges in the earth.”
Bahnar: Na đe gô khan: “Sĭt tơpă gô đei apah kơ lu bơngai tơpăt, Sĭt tơpă đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang kơpal teh.”

English: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; Defend me from those who rise up against me.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh ih dŏng pơklaih inh, đơ̆ng lu ayăt kơ inh. Tơgŭm dŏng inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai iung blah inh

English: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, And save me from bloodthirsty men.
Bahnar: Apinh pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆! Păng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai chă pơlôch đe.

English: For look, they lie in wait for my life; The mighty gather against me, Not for my transgression nor for my sin, O LORD.
Bahnar: Yua kơ to, lu sư răp wă pơlôch inh; Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơđâu băl wă pơm kơ inh. Ưh kơ trŏ yua kơ inh pơm glăi. Kŭm ưh kơ trŏ yua kơ tơdrong yoch inh.

English: They run and prepare themselves through no fault of mine. Awake to help me, and behold!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang. Inh huay kơ glăi ră mă-lei lu sư wă druh blah inh. Apinh Ih, hơđơ̆r bĕ tơgŭm dŏng inh păng lăng inh.

English: You therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, Awake to punish all the nations; Do not be merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih boih 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael. Iung bĕ na phak đĭ kơ teh đak. 'Nĕ kơ mơnat kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Sêla

English: At evening they return, They growl like a dog, And go all around the city.
Bahnar: Kơsơ̆ lu sư hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng, lu sư grĕnh thoi kŏ, Păng dăr tăp pơlei.

English: Indeed, they belch with their mouth; Swords are in their lips; For they say, “Who hears?”
Bahnar: To 'bơ̆r lu sư lĕch nơ̆r blei hiap. Hơkŭng lu sư thoi đao. Yua kơ lu sư khan: “Kơbĭ bu kơtơ̆ng.”

English: But You, O LORD, shall laugh at them; You shall have all the nations in derision.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Ih gô hiĕk kơ lu sư. Păng pơjăm đĭ lu teh đak noh.

English: I will wait for You, O You his Strength; For God is my defense.
Bahnar: Ơ pran kơtang inh, inh gô lăng tơ Ih. Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ anih kơjăp mă inh kơ'nơp.

English: My God of mercy shall come to meet me; God shall let me see my desire on my enemies.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'mêm kơ inh Sư gô năm tơ'bơ̆p inh. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh tơdrong jei jơnei inh lu ayăt kơ inh.

English: Do not slay them, lest my people forget; Scatter them by Your power, And bring them down, O Lord our shield.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, jơ̆ khêl pĕng dŏng lu nhôn. 'Nĕ kơ pơlôch lu sư, hli kơ kon pơlei pơla hiơt; Yua bĕ tơdrong mơsêh Ih na pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang păng tơhuŏng lu sư.

English: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips, Let them even be taken in their pride, And for the cursing and lying which they speak.
Bahnar: Yua kơ yoch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r lu sư, nơ̆r đơ̆ng hơkŭng lu sư păng yua kơ lu sư pơma blei hiap hăm hơlĕnh. Ăn kơ lu sư 'leh đom lăm tơdrong pơang lu sư kơdih!

English: Consume them in wrath, consume them, That they may not be; And let them know that God rules in Jacob To the ends of the earth. Selah
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang hil păng pơlôch lu sư, tơpă pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu sư. Wă kơ lu sư ưh pă đei dơ̆ng; Ăn kơ kon bơngai băt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng păng pơgơ̆r? Jakôp! Truh tơ tôch teh đak. Sêla

English: And at evening they return, They growl like a dog, And go all around the city.
Bahnar: Mưh kơsơ̆ lu sư hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng, grĕnh thoi kŏ. Păng dăr tăp pơlei.

English: They wander up and down for food, And howl if they are not satisfied.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă sa yak tơ âu tơ to; Dah ưh kơ phĭ lu sư grĕnh oei kơtă prăt măng.

English: But I will sing of Your power; Yes, I will sing aloud of Your mercy in the morning; For You have been my defense And refuge in the day of my trouble.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh gô hơri bơnê, tơdrong mơsêh Ih Pơgê hrôih drôih hơri re kơ tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat; Yua kơ Ih jing anih kơjăp inh kơ'nơp. Minh anih inh kơ'nơp lăm năr đei tơdrong anat anot.

English: To You, O my Strength, I will sing praises; For God is my defense, My God of mercy.
Bahnar: Ơ tơdrong pran kơtang inh, inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Ih anih kơjăp inh kơ'nơp, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'mêm kơ inh.

English: O God, You have cast us off; You have broken us down; You have been displeased; Oh, restore us again!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Ih achăng lê̆ lu nhôn, pă đei dŏng lu nhôn; Ih hil boih, apinh Ih tơiung lu nhôn dơ̆ng.

English: You have made the earth tremble; You have broken it; Heal its breaches, for it is shaking.
Bahnar: Ih pơm boih kơ teh tơdrŏ, păng pơm kơ lu sư hơđang. Apinh Ih hơmet ming lu hơđang sư noh, yua kơ đêl sư pơpơ̆.

English: You have shown Your people hard things; You have made us drink the wine of confusion.
Bahnar: Ih pơm boih kơ lu kon pơlei 'bôh tơdrong pơmat. Ăn kơ lu nhôn et sik, suai wing măt.

English: You have given a banner to those who fear You, That it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah
Bahnar: Ih ăn boih kơ lu bơngai mă chu yom hla-kơ Ih. Wă kơ pơdah sư kơ tơdrong tơpăt sĭt. Sêla

English: That Your beloved may be delivered, Save with Your right hand, and hear me.
Bahnar: Wă kơ bơngai bu mă Ih 'mêm gơh klaih hlôi. Apinh Kră Yang yua ti 'ma Ih pơklaih păng tơl tơwih kơ nhôn.

English: God has spoken in His holiness: “I will rejoice; I will divide Shechem And measure out the Valley of Succoth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei khan đơ̆ng lăm anih rơgoh Sư. “Inh chơt hiôk, Inh gô asong tơring Sichem păng pơtŏ thŭng Sikôt.

English: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim also is the helmet for My head; Judah is My lawgiver.
Bahnar: Gileat gah inh, Manase kư̆m lei lai; Êphraim môk kơlăm pĕng kơ̆l inh. Juđa jơ̆ 'long jra pơtao inh.

English: Moab is My washpot; Over Edom I will cast My shoe; Philistia, shout in triumph because of Me.”
Bahnar: Môap jơ̆ anih inh hum, 'nhao. Inh plôh chơkhŏ inh tơ Eđôm. Chơt hiôk bĕ yua kơ jei inh boih char Philistin.”

English: Who will bring me to the strong city? Who will lead me to Edom?
Bahnar: Bu gô ba inh mơ̆t tơ anih pơlei kơjăp? Bu gô ba inh truh tơ Eđôm?

English: Is it not You, O God, who cast us off? And You, O God, who did not go out with our armies?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih hăm trŏ Kră Yang mă achăng lê̆ lu nhôn? Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih ưh pă năm tơblah hơdai hăm linh lu nhôn boih hă?

English: Give us help from trouble, For the help of man is useless.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih nhôn đơ̆ng lu ayăt. Yua kơ tơduă kon bơngai dŏng tơgŭm jing tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Through God we will do valiantly, For it is He who shall tread down our enemies.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n gơh kĕ jei; Yua kơ sư gô juă bơhlơ̆r lu ayăt kơ nhôn.

English: Hear my cry, O God; Attend to my prayer.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao ôr. Mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao khan.

English: From the end of the earth I will cry to You, When my heart is overwhelmed; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak, inh gô ôr krao Ih, tơdah jơhngơ̆m inh rơdu boih; Apinh Ih chông ba inh 'bơ̆t tơmo kơjung hloh kơ inh.

English: For You have been a shelter for me, A strong tower from the enemy.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih jơ̆ anih inh kơ'nơp; Minh pôm hnam thôt kơjăp, wă blah lu ayăt.

English: I will abide in Your tabernacle forever; I will trust in the shelter of Your wings. Selah
Bahnar: Ăn kơ inh oei lăm hnam khăn Ih ling-lang. Păng kơ'nơp tơ ala pơnăr Ih. Sêla

English: For You, O God, have heard my vows; You have given me the heritage of those who fear Your name.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r inh pơkă. Ih Jao ăn boih kơ inh mŭk tơmam lu bơngai mă chu yom kơ anăn Ih.

English: You will prolong the king’s life, His years as many generations.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih hơtŏk thim năr kơ pơtao arih. Ăn kơ sư arih lăm lơ jơhnơr.

English: He shall abide before God forever. Oh, prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ sư pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp ling-lang hloi.a Apinh Ih ăn tơdrong 'mêm mơnat sĭt, wă kơ wei-lăng sư.

English: So I will sing praise to Your name forever, That I may daily perform my vows.
Bahnar: Thoi noh inh gô hơri bơnê kơ anăn ling-lang. Păng rim năr pơm pơkeh dôm tơdrong inh pơkă.

English: Truly my soul silently waits for God; From Him comes my salvation.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh pơdơh hiôk lăm minh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch; Tơdrong dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng Sư.

English: He only is my rock and my salvation; He is my defense; I shall not be greatly moved.
Bahnar: Lăp minh 'nu Sư đĕch tơmo pĕng inh, Păng dŏng pơklaih inh, Kơđông kơjăp inh. Inh huay pă pơgơ̆.

English: How long will you attack a man? You shall be slain, all of you, Like a leaning wall and a tottering fence.
Bahnar: Dĭng dang yơ dơ̆ng iĕm wă blah minh 'nu bơngai. Đĭ-đăng lu iĕm hơdai wang wă pơlôch sư. Thoi lĕ kơ tơnăr grê, thoi dur wă păk.

English: They only consult to cast him down from his high position; They delight in lies; They bless with their mouth, But they curse inwardly. Selah
Bahnar: Lu sư lăp pơđâu đĕch wă blah lê̆ sư đơ̆ng anih đe pôk sư; Lu sư lăp kơ pơma hơlĕnh, 'bơ̆r lu sư hơpơi pŭn hiôk. Mă-lei lăm jơhngơ̆m hiap pơtê̆. Sêla

English: My soul, wait silently for God alone, For my expectation is from Him.
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh pơdơh bĕ tơ anih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Yua kơ inh chang hơmĕng kơ Sư.

English: He only is my rock and my salvation; He is my defense; I shall not be moved.
Bahnar: Lăp minh 'nu Sư đĕch mă tơmo inh gơnang, Păng dŏng pơklaih inh, Păng anih kơjăp inh, inh ưh pă pơpơ̆.

English: In God is my salvation and my glory; The rock of my strength, And my refuge, is in God.
Bahnar: Tơdrong dŏng pơklaih păng tơdrong ư-ang inh lăm. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmo kơjăp; Tơmo inh păng anih inh kơ'nơp.

English: Trust in Him at all times, you people; Pour out your heart before Him; God is a refuge for us. Selah
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei, gơnang bĕ đĭ kơ Sư, ling-lang. Tuh bĕ jơhngơ̆m ih kơ Sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư boih mă anih bơ̆n kơ'nơp. Sêla

English: Surely men of low degree are a vapor, Men of high degree are a lie; If they are weighed on the scales, They are altogether lighter than vapor.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă, bơngai đe ưh kơ gĭt thoi kial dui jơhngơ̆m. Bơngai đe gĭt 'biơ̆ kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei. Atŏk tơ kơpal kĭ lu sư phiơl. Đĭ lu sư hơiơch hloh kơ hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m.

English: Do not trust in oppression, Nor vainly hope in robbery; If riches increase, Do not set your heart on them.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ gơnang kơ kĕ pơjuă đe. 'Nĕ gơnang hơmĕng kơ tơtông klĕ, Mă đei mŭk tơmam lơ, 'nĕ kơ hơđơ̆ng kơ noh.

English: God has spoken once, Twice I have heard this: That power belongs to God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei khan, thoi âu: Inh kơtơ̆ng 'bar wơ̆t tơdrong mơsêh noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Also to You, O Lord, belongs mercy; For You render to each one according to his work.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang tơdrong 'mêm mơnat lăm Ih; Yua kơ Kră Yang apah kơ rim 'nu kiơ̆ thoi đêl lu sư jang.

English: O God, You are my God; Early will I seek You; My soul thirsts for You; My flesh longs for You In a dry and thirsty land Where there is no water.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, inh krao chă Ih; thoi teh hrĕng kro, hơđang, ưh kơ đei đak. Bơhngol inh rơhing kơ Ih. Akâu jăn inh hơpơi kơ Ih.

English: So I have looked for You in the sanctuary, To see Your power and Your glory.
Bahnar: 'Bôh tơdrong mơyang păng, tơdrong ư-ang Ih. Thoi inh 'bôh Ih lăm anih rơgoh.

English: Because Your lovingkindness is better than life, My lips shall praise You.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Ih, Gĭt hloh kơ tơdrong arih; Hơkŭng inh bơnê ư-ang kơ Ih.

English: Thus I will bless You while I live; I will lift up my hands in Your name.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih đĭ chăl arih inh; Hăm anăn Ih inh gô yơ̆r ti krao khan.

English: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness, And my mouth shall praise You with joyful lips.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh phĭ thoi lĕ sa 'ngăl păng rơmă. 'Bơ̆r inh gô ư-ang hăm hơkŭng hơri bơnê kơ Ih.

English: When I remember You on my bed, I meditate on You in the night watches.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh 'bĭch kơpal giơng inh 'blŏk kơ Ih. Na inh kral gak prăt măng tơchĕng kơ Ih ling-lang

English: Because You have been my help, Therefore in the shadow of Your wings I will rejoice.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih đei tơgŭm inh boih, Ala yơ̆p pơnăr Ih na inh gô hơri chơt hiôk.

English: My soul follows close behind You; Your right hand upholds me.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh oei kơjăp lăm Ih, ti 'ma Ih tơgŭm tơiung inh.

English: But those who seek my life, to destroy it, Shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
Bahnar: Lu đe bu chă wă pơrăm tơdrong arih inh. Gô jur tơ jrŭ ala teha sŭng.

English: They shall fall by the sword; They shall be a portion for jackals.
Bahnar: Lu sư noh gô jao kơ đe koh sư hăm đao gưm wă pơm 'nhĕm ăn kơ kŏ bri sa.

English: But the king shall rejoice in God; Everyone who swears by Him shall glory; But the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao gô chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bu pơkă hăm anăn Kră Yang gô pôk pơư kơ Kră Yang; Yua kơ Sư gô chĭt lê̆ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai pơma plêl.

English: Hear my voice, O God, in my meditation; Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh ôr krao. Wei tơdrong arih inh huay kơ hli kơ lu ayăt.

English: Hide me from the secret plots of the wicked, From the rebellion of the workers of iniquity
Bahnar: Ôn inh hlơp đơ̆ng lu bơngai kơnê̆ chă đon noh. Păng đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpôl pơm kơnê̆.

English: Who sharpen their tongue like a sword, And bend their bows to shoot their arrows—bitter words
Bahnar: Lu sư pat hơpiĕt thoi pat đao. Lu sư prah 'brơ̆m wă khan nơ̆r pơma jĭ.

English: That they may shoot in secret at the blameless; Suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih hlơp noh, lu sư prah klĕnh tơ lu bơngai tơpăt 'lơ̆ng: 'Bôh 'băi blư lu sư prah ưh pă hli kơ kiơ.

English: They encourage themselves in an evil matter; They talk of laying snares secretly; They say, “Who will see them?”
Bahnar: Lu sư pơtơm băl pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư. Pơđâu băl wă hơ'năk hơđong hlơp, Na khan: “Bu 'bôh 'băi bơ̆n.”

English: They devise iniquities: “We have perfected a shrewd scheme.” Both the inward thought and the heart of man are deep.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă wă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆; Lu sư khan: “Lu bơ̆n pơđâu boih wă pơm.” Đon tơchĕng păng jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai kơnê̆ tơpă.

English: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; Suddenly they shall be wounded.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô prah lu sư. 'Bôh 'băi lu sư đei rơka đơ̆ng 'brơ̆m.

English: So He will make them stumble over their own tongue; All who see them shall flee away.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơlôch lu sư, hơpiĕt lu sư gô blah plơ̆ lu sư kơdih; Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'bôh lu sư gô tơtreh kơ̆l.

English: All men shall fear, And shall declare the work of God; For they shall wisely consider His doing.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô hli; Lu sư gô ră roi tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm boih.

English: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and trust in Him. And all the upright in heart shall glory.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt gô chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang păng kơ'nơp tơ lăm Sư; Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt lu sư gô hơri ư-ang kơ sư.

English: Praise is awaiting You, O God, in Zion; And to You the vow shall be performed.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơ Siôn Ih trŏ kơ đe kơkuh bơnê. Lu sư gô pơkeh dôm nơ̆r đêl lu sư pơkă, hăm Ih!

English: O You who hear prayer, To You all flesh will come.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang mă mơ̆ng nơ̆r krao khan, Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô năm tơ Ih.

English: Iniquities prevail against me; As for our transgressions, You will provide atonement for them.
Bahnar: Tơdah jei tơdrong kơnê̆. Tơdrong mă lu nhôn pơm yoch Ih gô mơnat ăn.

English: Blessed is the man You choose, And cause to approach You, That he may dwell in Your courts. We shall be satisfied with the goodness of Your house, Of Your holy temple.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bơngai bu mă Ih đei rơih păng ăn jê̆ Ih. Wă kơ oei tơ cham Ih: Lu nhôn gô phĭ jơnap đei tơmam 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng hnam Ih.

English: By awesome deeds in righteousness You will answer us, O God of our salvation, You who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth, And of the far-off seas
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn. Hăm tơdrong trŏ Ih gô tơl tơwih kơ lu nhôn kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt. Ih jơ̆ anih lu bơngai đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak păng jơ̆p kơpal đak dơsĭ ataih hơđơ̆ng hơmĕng.

English: Who established the mountains by His strength, Being clothed with power
Bahnar: Ih yua tơdrong mơsêh pơjing lu kông gei kơjăp, yua kơ ih tơ̆n păng tơlei tơ̆n pran kơtang

English: You who still the noise of the seas, The noise of their waves, And the tumult of the peoples.
Bahnar: Ih khă lu jơwa đak dơsĭ poh-yă kial hơbŭt ngăn hreh. Păng tơdrong kon pơlei iung pơm kơnê̆.

English: They also who dwell in the farthest parts are afraid of Your signs; You make the outgoings of the morning and evening rejoice.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei tôch kơ teh đak. 'Bôh tơdrong hlĭch chrơp đơ̆ng Ih na hli tơrơ: Ih pơm kơ tơdrong hơdah pơgê hrôih păng kơsơ̆ 'năr mơ̆t đei chơt hiôk.

English: You visit the earth and water it, You greatly enrich it; The river of God is full of water; You provide their grain, For so You have prepared it.
Bahnar: Ih wei-lăng teh păng ruh kơ teh hơiuh. Pơm ăn kơ sư đei mơ̆r; glung Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bĕnh kơ đak. Yua kơ Ih pơjing boih teh, chăt Ih ăn 'ba hơ'bo kơ kon bơngai.

English: You water its ridges abundantly, You settle its furrows; You make it soft with showers, You bless its growth.
Bahnar: Ih ruh rim trong lu sư rơuơ pơm ăn kơ teh hơiuh. Ăn 'mi chruh pơm kơ sư rơmuăn păng ăn pŭn kơ tơmam bluh chăt wơ̆.

English: You crown the year with Your goodness, And Your paths drip with abundance.
Bahnar: Ih pơyơ̆l ăn môk pŭn hiôk kơ sơnăm. Rim trong Ih năm tơ noh đei hiôk jơnap.

English: They drop on the pastures of the wilderness, And the little hills rejoice on every side.
Bahnar: Lu tơmăn 'nhĕt lăm char glă bluh 'lơ̆ng, Păng lu kông groi đei chơt hiôk.

English: The pastures are clothed with flocks; The valleys also are covered with grain; They shout for joy, they also sing.
Bahnar: Anih 'nhĕt hơdrih 'bĕnh kơ sem dơrong. Dôm lu thŭng 'bĕnh kơ hơ'bo 'ba pia tôl: Jơ̆p-jang anih noh chơt hiôk păng hơri 'nă hal.

English: Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng lăm teh đak chhôk ngă 'nă hal bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Sing out the honor of His name; Make His praise glorious.
Bahnar: Hơri ư-ang kơ anăn Sư păng pôk bơnê kơ Sư bĕ.

English: Say to God, “How awesome are Your works! Through the greatness of Your power Your enemies shall submit themselves to You.
Bahnar: Pơma bĕ hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Dôm tơdrong jang Ih trŏ kơ hli yom tơpă! Đơ̆ng tơdrong mơsêh tih Ih; na dôm lu ayăt gô wih hli yom kơ Ih.

English: All the earth shall worship You And sing praises to You; They shall sing praises to Your name.” Selah
Bahnar: Jơ̆p-jang kơpal teh đak kơkuh kơ Ih. Hơri bơnê kơ ih. Lu sư hơri bơnê anăn Ih.” Sêla

English: Come and see the works of God; He is awesome in His doing toward the sons of men.
Bahnar: Năm lăng, bĕ dôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: Tơdrong jang Sư pơm kơ kon bơngai trŏ hli yom tơpă.

English: He turned the sea into dry land; They went through the river on foot. There we will rejoice in Him.
Bahnar: Sư tơplih đak dơsĭ jing teh hrĕng kro. Kon bơngai yak jơ̆ng tŏk kơ đak krong. Bĕ bơ̆n chơt hiôk lăm Sư.

English: He rules by His power forever; His eyes observe the nations; Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah
Bahnar: Sư yua tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư pơgơ̆r ling-lang hloi; Măt Sư sek lăng lu dêh char: Ơ lu bơngai ayăt 'nĕ kơ pơang. Sêla

English: Oh, bless our God, you peoples! And make the voice of His praise to be heard
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla, kơkuh bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n. Ăn kơ đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r iĕm ư-ang Kơ Sư.

English: Who keeps our soul among the living, And does not allow our feet to be moved.
Bahnar: Sư boih bơwei tơdrong arih lu bơ̆n. Ưh kơ ăn jơ̆ng lu bơ̆n tơpling.

English: For You, O God, have tested us; You have refined us as silver is refined.
Bahnar: Yua kơ, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih pơlong lăng lu nhôn thoi rơ̆ Hu.

English: You brought us into the net; You laid affliction on our backs.
Bahnar: Ih ba lu nhôn puh lăm hơnhuăl. Ih tơpŭ ăn tơ kơdŭ lu nhôn trăp dêh.

English: You have caused men to ride over our heads; We went through fire and through water; But You brought us out to rich fulfillment.
Bahnar: Ih ăn kơ đe hao tơ kơpal kơ̆l lu nhôn; Lu nhôn năm hlôi kơ đak, yak mơ̆t hlôi kơ ŭnh Mă-lei Ih ăn kơ lu nhôn lĕch năm tơ anih đei tơmam sa rơkah rơkai.

English: I will go into Your house with burnt offerings; I will pay You my vows
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk tơmam soi 'buh na mơ̆t lăm hnam Ih. Pơkeh kơ nơ̆r đêl inh pơkă hăm Kră Yang.

English: Which my lips have uttered And my mouth has spoken when I was in trouble.
Bahnar: Đêl hơkŭng inh đei pơkă; Mă 'bơ̆r inh pơma, 'bơ̆t năr pơmat-tat.

English: I will offer You burnt sacrifices of fat animals, With the sweet aroma of rams; I will offer bulls with goats. Selah
Bahnar: Inh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang sem dơrong bek 'lơ̆ng wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh. Hơdai hăm triu tơno pơm tơmam soi 'buh. Inh kư̆m gô pơyơ̆r lu rơmo tơno păng bơbe bram. Sêla

English: Come and hear, all you who fear God, And I will declare what He has done for my soul.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai mă băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, mơ̆ng bĕ. Inh gô roi dôm tơdrong mă Kră Yang đei pơm kơ bơhngol inh

English: I cried to Him with my mouth, And He was extolled with my tongue.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r inh krao apinh Sư, păng hơpiĕt inh ư-ang kơ Sư.

English: If I regard iniquity in my heart, The Lord will not hear.
Bahnar: Tơdah jơhngơ̆m inh mong răk tơdrong kơnê̆; Lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kuă kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh.

English: But certainly God has heard me; He has attended to the voice of my prayer.
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆ng boih; Sư pơgling boih đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao khan.

English: Blessed be God, Who has not turned away my prayer, Nor His mercy from me!
Bahnar: Kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ sư ưh kơ đei sơngah kơ nơ̆r inh krao khan. Kŭm ưh kơ đei lê̆ iŏk tơdrong Sư 'mêm kơ inh.

English: God be merciful to us and bless us, And cause His face to shine upon us, Selah
Bahnar: Hơpơi apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat păng ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu nhôn. Pơdah muh măt Ih tơ lu nhôn. Sêla

English: That Your way may be known on earth, Your salvation among all nations.
Bahnar: Wă kơ trong Ih đe gơh băt tơ kơpal teh. Păng tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Ih gơh băt tơ jơ̆p lăm lu dêh char.

English: Let the peoples praise You, O God; Let all the peoples praise You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ kon pơlei kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih! Ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai hơri bơnê kơ Ih!

English: Oh, let the nations be glad and sing for joy! For You shall judge the people righteously, And govern the nations on earth. Selah
Bahnar: Ơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak chơt hiôk hơri 'nă hal bĕ; Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư sek tơlang tơpăt ăn kơ kon pơlei. Păng pơgơ̆r chông ba kon bơngai. Lăm teh đak. Sêla

English: Let the peoples praise You, O God; Let all the peoples praise You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ăn kơ kon pơlei kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih! Ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai hơri bơnê kơ Ih.

English: Then the earth shall yield her increase; God, our own God, shall bless us.
Bahnar: Teh pơjing boih kơ lu 'nhot sa hla pơkao. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu nhôn.

English: God shall bless us, And all the ends of the earth shall fear Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn boih tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu nhôn. Ăn kơ kon bơngai jơ̆p teh đak hli yom bĕ kơ Sư.

English: Let God arise, Let His enemies be scattered; Let those also who hate Him flee before Him.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iung bĕ, pơm ăn kơ lu ayăt kơ Ih tơklah tơklang. Ăn kơ lu bơngai hil areh kơ Sư kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng anăp Sư.

English: As smoke is driven away, So drive them away; As wax melts before the fire, So let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
Bahnar: 'Nhui đông hach thoi yơ, Kră Yang gô pơm kơ lu sư hach thoi noh mơ̆n; Kŭm thoi jrĕnh lek kơ ŭnh thoi yơ, Dôm lu bơngai kơnê̆ gô lôch 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: But let the righteous be glad; Let them rejoice before God; Yes, let them rejoice exceedingly.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt gô 'nă hal, chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Tơpă lu sư gô đei jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk.

English: Sing to God, sing praises to His name; Extol Him who rides on the clouds, By His name YAH, And rejoice before Him.
Bahnar: Hơri pơư bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơnê bĕ kơ anăn Sư; Man hơmet bĕ trong kơ Kră Yang hao hơmơ̆l năm rok anih glă; Anăn Sư jơ̆ Kră Yang; Chơt hiôk bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: A father of the fatherless, a defender of widows, Is God in His holy habitation.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ anih rơgoh. Sư jing 'Bă kơ lu mơti, Păng jing Tơ'ngla wei lu drŏ-kăn adro.

English: God sets the solitary in families; He brings out those who are bound into prosperity; But the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai hơdrô̆ đei hnam dơnŏ. Chông ba lu bơngai bơnă ăn kơ lu sư pŭn hiôk; Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ ayăt gô oei tơ teh kro pơdang.

English: O God, when You went out before Your people, When You marched through the wilderness, Selah
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah Ih năm 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei pơla Ih; Kơplah Ih yak truh tơ char 'blach Sêla

English: The earth shook; The heavens also dropped rain at the presence of God; Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
Bahnar: Teh gô pơpơ̆, đơ̆ng plĕnh gô đei 'mi jur 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Kông Sinai kư̆m pơpơ̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: You, O God, sent a plentiful rain, Whereby You confirmed Your inheritance, When it was weary.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Ih ăn 'mi jruh lơ tơpă Ih ăn tơmam iung hơdrih. Dah lu sư jô hŏnh boih.

English: Your congregation dwelt in it; You, O God, provided from Your goodness for the poor.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, khŭl kon pơlei Ih oei tơ noh. Yua kơ Ih đei jơhngơ̆m 'mêm mơnat. Ih hơmet boih tơmam kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat.

English: The Lord gave the word; Great was the company of those who proclaimed it
Bahnar: Kră Yang hơtă nơ̆r; mă lu drŏ-kăn kư̆m roi tơbăt nơ̆r ei kư̆m thoi minh khŭl lơ dêh.

English: “Kings of armies flee, they flee, And she who remains at home divides the spoil.
Bahnar: “Lu pơtao lu wei linh kơdâu ôn, lu sư kơdâu ôn đĭ; Lu drŏ-kăn oei tơ lăm hnam asong băl tơmam đêl lu sư blah iŏk.

English: Though you lie down among the sheepfolds, You will be like the wings of a dove covered with silver, And her feathers with yellow gold.”
Bahnar: Mă lu bơngai oei tơ lăm hơdrong triu, Lu sư nhen thoi pơnăr kơtơp lom păng hu. Păng sŏk sư dreng thoi maih.”

English: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, It was white as snow in Zalmon.
Bahnar: Kră Yang mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang pơpuh lu pơtao tơ noh; Thoi prĕl jur tơ kông Salmôn.

English: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; A mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.
Bahnar: Kông Basan jơ̆ kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, kông Basan rŏ krưp đei lơ kơ̆l kông kơjung.

English: Why do you fume with envy, you mountains of many peaks? This is the mountain which God desires to dwell in; Yes, the LORD will dwell in it forever.
Bahnar: Ơ lu kông đei kơ̆l kơjung liơ iĕm lăng klai areh? Kông mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei rơih boih, pơm anih Sư oei? Tơpă, Kră Yang gô oei tơ noh ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, Even thousands of thousands; The Lord is among them as in Sinai, in the Holy Place.
Bahnar: Gre aseh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bar hơngan. Lơ rơbâu hơngan, Kră Yang oei tơ lăm gre ei, năm đơ̆ng kông Sinai mơ̆t lăm anih rơgoh.

English: You have ascended on high, You have led captivity captive; You have received gifts among men, Even from the rebellious, That the LORD God might dwell there.
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei tơ kơpal kông. Anhăk ba lu bơnă; Kră Yang iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng kon bơngai pơyơ̆r, Păng kư̆m iŏk đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt mơ̆n. Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô oei hơdai hăm sư.

English: Blessed be the Lord, Who daily loads us with benefits, The God of our salvation! Selah
Bahnar: Bơnê kơkuh bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, Kră Yang mă rim năr pŭ trăp yua kơ bơ̆n. Wă khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih lu nhôn. Sêla

English: Our God is the God of salvation; And to GOD the Lord belong escapes from death.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă huai iŏk lu bơ̆n; Noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang na mă bơ̆n gơh klaih đơ̆ng lôch

English: But God will wound the head of His enemies, The hairy scalp of the one who still goes on in his trespasses.
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơjuă pơhĕch lê̆ kơ̆l lu ayăt kơ Sư. Kơpal bơwĕnh sŏk mă lu bơngai oei pơm kơnê̆.

English: The Lord said, “I will bring back from Bashan, I will bring them back from the depths of the sea
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Đơ̆ng kông Basan inh gô chông ba lu sư brŏk. Inh gô chông anhăk lu sư đơ̆ng lu anih jrŭ đak dơsĭ.

English: That your foot may crush them in blood, And the tongues of your dogs may have their portion from your enemies.”
Bahnar: Lê̆ jơ̆ng lu sư juă lăm pham, lu ayăt păng hơpiĕt kŏ lu sư kư̆m đei liah sa sĕch lu ayăt kơ lu sư.”

English: They have seen Your procession, O God, The procession of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe 'bôh boih Ih năm sơng. Ih jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sơng inh, Pơtao inh, năm tơ anih rơgoh.

English: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; Among them were the maidens playing timbrels.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơri yak adrol lu brŏ reh kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng. Tŏk-bŏk đei lu adruh teh hơgơ̆r.

English: Bless God in the congregations, The Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
Bahnar: “Ô lu kon sâu Isơrael kơkuh bơnê bĕ lăm năr iĕm akŭm tih. Hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư boih Kră Yang.”

English: There is little Benjamin, their leader, The princes of Judah and their company, The princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
Bahnar: To Bênjamin adrĕch tŏ sĕt, mă wei pơgơ̆r lu sư. Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđa, hăm khŭl lu sư. Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r Sabulôn păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r Neptali.

English: Your God has commanded your strength; Strengthen, O God, what You have done for us.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư ăn boih tơdrong pran kơtang kơ ih; Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơ'bôh ăn bĕ tơdrong mơsêh Ih mă tơdrong jang Ih đei pơm kơ lu nhôn.

English: Because of Your temple at Jerusalem, Kings will bring presents to You.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Hnam akŭm Ih tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Lu pơtao gô pơyơ̆r Tơmam Soi kơ Ih.

English: Rebuke the beasts of the reeds, The herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples, Till everyone submits himself with pieces of silver. Scatter the peoples who delight in war.
Bahnar: Hil bĕ kơ lu kon sem bri tơ lăm 'nhĕt pơtăng, Hil bĕ kơ lu rơmo tơno păng lu kon iĕ rơmo kon pơlei; Dĭng dôm lu bơngai hơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng pơyơ̆r hu. Ih puh tơweh lê̆ lu bơngai mă 'maih tơblah tơblŭng.

English: Envoys will come out of Egypt; Ethiopia will quickly stretch out her hands to God.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt gô lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ. Bơngai Êthiôpi gô hăt hot yơ̆r ti krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth; Oh, sing praises to the Lord, Selah
Bahnar: Ơ lu dêh char kơpal teh, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Hat hơri bĕ kơ Kră Yang. Sêla

English: To Him who rides on the heaven of heavens, which were of old! Indeed, He sends out His voice, a mighty voice.
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ Kră Yang mă hao kơpal lu plĕnh, lu plĕnh so sơ̆. To Sư tơlĕch nơ̆r, nơ̆r Sư pơma mơsêh re jơwa dêh.

English: Ascribe strength to God; His excellence is over Israel, And His strength is in the clouds.
Bahnar: Athei pôk pơư pơang tơdrong mơsêh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong ư-ang krưp rŏ Sư oei tơ kơpal Isơrael păng tơdrong pran kơtang Sư oei tơ lu tăl plĕnh.

English: O God, You are more awesome than Your holy places. The God of Israel is He who gives strength and power to His people. Blessed be God!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih trŏ boih kơ nhôn hli kơkuh lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong pran păng mơsêh mơyang kơ kon pơlei Isơrael Ih. Kơkuh bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei!

English: Save me, O God! For the waters have come up to my neck.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih inh. Yua kơ đak lơ̆p truh tơ hơko inh boih.

English: I sink in deep mire, Where there is no standing; I have come into deep waters, Where the floods overflow me.
Bahnar: Inh puh lăm hlŭt jrŭ, anih chro jơ̆ng ưh pă tôch. Inh glơ̆k lăm đak jrŭ, đak lơ̆p lê̆ inh.

English: I am weary with my crying; My throat is dry; My eyes fail while I wait for my God.
Bahnar: Inh ôr đĭ lap, hơlŏng inh đĭ kro; Măt inh đĭ rơgah yua kơ chang gô Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Those who hate me without a cause Are more than the hairs of my head; They are mighty who would destroy me, Being my enemies wrongfully; Though I have stolen nothing, I still must restore it.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai areh kơ inh tơdrong kơđei, lơ hloh kơ sŏk kơpal kơ̆l inh; Lu pơm ayăt kơ inh tơdrong kơ đei, lu bơngai wă pơrăm inh kơtang tơpă. Inh athei 'mong dôm tơmam mă inh ưh kơ tơtông iŏk ră.

English: O God, You know my foolishness; And my sins are not hidden from You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Ih băt kơ tơdrong kơtul kơwao inh. Dôm tơdrong yoch inh ưh kơ gơh ôn kơ Ih.

English: Let not those who wait for You, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed because of me; Let not those who seek You be confounded because of me, O God of Israel.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'nĕ ăn kơ lu bơngai chang gô Ih đei mơlâu yua kơ inh. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael! 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu bơngai mă chă Ih đe pơ'brơh yua kơ inh.

English: Because for Your sake I have borne reproach; Shame has covered my face.
Bahnar: Noh yua kơ Ih na inh pŭ iŏk tơdrong đe pơjăm, tơdrong mơlâu 'bĕnh kơ muh măt inh.

English: I have become a stranger to my brothers, And an alien to my mother’s children
Bahnar: Inh jing thoi bơngai tơmoi kơ 'nhŏng oh inh. Thoi gơ̆p nai kơ lu 'nhŏng oh drŏ-nglo kon mĕ inh

English: Because zeal for Your house has eaten me up, And the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen on me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong hưch hanh kơ Hnam Ih dang luăn sa inh. Tơdrong đe hiĕk pơjăm Ih 'bơm boih tơ inh.

English: When I wept and chastened my soul with fasting, That became my reproach.
Bahnar: Mă inh nhơ̆m ơh, păng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa. Noh kư̆m pơm kơ inh mơlâu.

English: I also made sackcloth my garment; I became a byword to them.
Bahnar: Mă inh iŏk 'bi hrŭk pơm ao tai, Inh jing pơm kơ lu sư hiĕk ăr.

English: Those who sit in the gate speak against me, And I am the song of the drunkards.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ngôi 'bơ̆t măng jang che bơle kơ inh; Inh jing nơ̆r lu et tơdrô hơri jô̆.

English: But as for me, my prayer is to You, O LORD, in the acceptable time; O God, in the multitude of Your mercy, Hear me in the truth of Your salvation.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ơ Kră Yang! Inh krao apinh kơ Ih! Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat apinh Ih tơl tơwih nơ̆r inh, Hăm tơdrong dŏng pơklaih sĭt Ih.

English: Deliver me out of the mire, And let me not sink; Let me be delivered from those who hate me, And out of the deep waters.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lăm hlŭt, 'nĕ ăn kơ inh đom. Tơgŭm kơ inh hlôi đơ̆ng lu bơngai areh kơ inh, păng hlôi kơ đak jrŭ.

English: Let not the floodwater overflow me, Nor let the deep swallow me up; And let not the pit shut its mouth on me.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ đak lơ̆p inh, păng sơlŭng jrŭ hiup inh. 'Bơ̆r hơlŭng hơlih klơ̆p inh.

English: Hear me, O LORD, for Your lovingkindness is good; Turn to me according to the multitude of Your tender mercies.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih tơl tơwih kơ inh, yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm 'lơ̆ng Ih; Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Ih, apinh wih tơ inh.

English: And do not hide Your face from Your servant, For I am in trouble; Hear me speedily.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'nĕ kơ ôn muh măt Ih kơ inh, Đĭch đam Ih, yua kơ inh oei pơmat-tat; Jah drơ̆ng nơ̆r inh bĕ.

English: Draw near to my soul, and redeem it; Deliver me because of my enemies.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih năm jê̆ inh păng huai iŏk bơhngol inh. Apinh dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng lu bơngai ayăt.

English: You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; My adversaries are all before You.
Bahnar: Ih băt tơdrong mơlâu, tơdrong đe pơjăm pơjuă păng tơdrong đe pơ'brơh kơ inh. Lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh oei 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: Reproach has broken my heart, And I am full of heaviness; I looked for someone to take pity, but there was none; And for comforters, but I found none.
Bahnar: Inh pơmat-tat dêh, jơhngơ̆m inh pơchah yua kơ tơdrong mơlâu. Inh oei chang bơngai mơnat kơ inh, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu; Inh chang đei bơngai pơlung, mă-lei ưh đei 'bôh bu.

English: They also gave me gall for my food, And for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn hla tăng pơm tơmam sa inh. Păng ăn kơ inh nhă đak iŭ kơplah rơhing.

English: Let their table become a snare before them, And their well-being a trap.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ gơ'bang sŏng sa lu sư jing hơđong hơ'năk kơ lu sư. Sŏng sa hiôk-hian nhen hơnhuăl hrơ̆p lu sư kơdih.

English: Let their eyes be darkened, so that they do not see; And make their loins shake continually.
Bahnar: Ăn kơiĕng lu sư pơpơ̆ hơnơ̆ng ăn kơ măt lu sư tol, ưh pă 'bôh dơ̆ng.

English: Pour out Your indignation upon them, And let Your wrathful anger take hold of them.
Bahnar: Tuh bĕ tơdrong hil Ih tơ lu sư. Ăn tơdrong hil mĭl Ih truh tơ lu sư.

English: Let their dwelling place be desolate; Let no one live in their tents.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ anih oei lu sư jing juơ. Ưh pă đei bu oei tơ lăm anih noh dơ̆ng.

English: For they persecute the ones You have struck, And talk of the grief of those You have wounded.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư pơmat lu bơngai mă Kră Yang teh boih, Păng lu sư chă roi tơdrong pơmat-tat lu bơngai mă Ih ăn đei rơka.

English: Add iniquity to their iniquity, And let them not come into Your righteousness.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih pơthim tơdrong kơnê̆ kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư; 'Nĕ jô̆ kơ lu sư đei lăm tơdrong tơpăt Ih.

English: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, And not be written with the righteous.
Bahnar: Sŭt lê̆ anăn lu sư đơ̆ng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong arih. Ưh kơ gơh chih tơmơ̆t hơdai hăm lu bơngai tơpăt

English: But I am poor and sorrowful; Let Your salvation, O God, set me up on high.
Bahnar: Gah inh pơmat-tat răm-'băm: Na ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih păng hơtŏk inh tơ anih kơjung.

English: I will praise the name of God with a song, And will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
Bahnar: Inh gô bơnê kơ anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm nơ̆r hơri. Yua nơ̆r bơnê na pơư pơang kơ Sư.

English: This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bull, Which has horns and hooves.
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu lăp đon Kră Yang hloh kơ tơmam pơyơ̆r hăm rơmo, Mă rơmo tơno đei hơke păng kơchôp blah.

English: The humble shall see this and be glad; And you who seek God, your hearts shall live.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơmat-tat 'bôh tơdrong noh gô chơt hiôk, Ơ lu bơngai mă krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm gô arih.

English: For the LORD hears the poor, And does not despise His prisoners.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang mơ̆ng lu bơngai dơnuh hin. Ưh kơ đei areh ôh kơ lu bơngai mă đe pơm bơnă.

English: Let heaven and earth praise Him, The seas and everything that moves in them.
Bahnar: Ơ plĕnh, teh, đak dơsĭ păng kon sem brem lăm noh, đĭ-đăng bơnê bĕ kơ Sư.

English: For God will save Zion And build the cities of Judah, That they may dwell there and possess it.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih Siôn păng wă pơjing dơ̆ng lu pơlei tih lăm Juđa; Kon pơlei Sư gô oei tơ noh, iŏk teh jang sa.

English: Also, the descendants of His servants shall inherit it, And those who love His name shall dwell in it.
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung đĭch đam sư gô yua iŏk teh noh jang sa. Dôm lu đe bu mă 'mêm kơ anăn Sư gô oei tơ noh.

English: Make haste, O God, to deliver me! Make haste to help me, O LORD!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Tĕnh jah dŏng pơklaih inh; Kră Yang! Tĕnh jah tơgŭm inh.

English: Let them be ashamed and confounded Who seek my life; Let them be turned back and confused Who desire my hurt.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu bơngai wă pơrăm tơdrong arih inh, Đĭ-đăng gô kơdơ̆ mơlâu. Ăn kơ lu bơngai 'maih pơmat inh. Kơdŭn tơ rŏng păng mơlâu.

English: Let them be turned back because of their shame, Who say, “Aha, aha!”
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu bơngai hiĕk kơ inh: “Ha, ha! Ha, ha?” Kơdŭn tơ rŏng, yua kơ lu sư kơdơ̆ mơlâu

English: Let all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; And let those who love Your salvation say continually, “Let God be magnified!”
Bahnar: Ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă krao chă Ih, chhôk ngă 'nă hal tơ lăm Ih; Ăn kơ lu bơngai mă 'mêm tơdrong Ih dŏng pơklaih. Khan ling-lang: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tih-tin.”

English: But I am poor and needy; Make haste to me, O God! You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.
Bahnar: Gah inh tơnat pat, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Mă kuăng bĕ năm tơ inh. Ih boih Tơ'ngla dŏng tơgŭm inh păng pơklaih inh; Ơ Kră Yang 'nĕ kơ pơhiơ̆.

English: In You, O LORD, I put my trust; Let me never be put to shame.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Inh kơ'nơp lăm Ih; 'Nĕ ăn kơ inh kơdơ̆ mơlâu.

English: Deliver me in Your righteousness, and cause me to escape; Incline Your ear to me, and save me.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong tơpăt Ih, apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih inh păng ăn kơ inh gơh rơngei. Pơgling đon mơ̆ng inh păng pơklaih inh.

English: Be my strong refuge, To which I may resort continually; You have given the commandment to save me, For You are my rock and my fortress.
Bahnar: Ih thoi tơmo tih, anih inh kơ'nơp; tơ lăm noh ling-lang; Ăn nơ̆r tơtă wă pơklaih inh. Yua kơ Ih jơ̆ kơđông păng tơmo pĕng inh.

English: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, Out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, apinh dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, Klaih đơ̆ng ti lu hơlĕnh păng bơngai pơm kơnê̆ dêh.

English: For You are my hope, O Lord GOD; You are my trust from my youth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ, ơ Kră Yang! Ih boih mă inh chang gô. Mă inh gơnang đơ̆ng inh oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆.

English: By You I have been upheld from birth; You are He who took me out of my mother’s womb. My praise shall be continually of You.
Bahnar: Inh hơđơ̆ng kơ Ih đơ̆ng 'nao tơpŭ sơ̆; Ih boih Kră Yang ăn mĕ inh hơiơch kơ inh. Inh gô bơnê kơ Ih ling-lang

English: I have become as a wonder to many, But You are my strong refuge.
Bahnar: Inh nhen tơmam pơm hlĭch kơ lơ bơngai, mă-lei Ih jơ̆ anih inh kơ'nơp kơjăp.

English: Let my mouth be filled with Your praise And with Your glory all the day.
Bahnar: Rim năr 'bơ̆r inh hơri bơnê kơ Ih, păng kơkuh pơyom kơ Ih.

English: Do not cast me off in the time of old age; Do not forsake me when my strength fails.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'nĕ pơpuh inh kơplah inh đĭ kră, dah jơhngơ̆m inh pă kĕ.

English: For my enemies speak against me; And those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu bơngai ayăt pơma ayăt kơ inh, Lu sư pơđâu băl wă pơlôch inh.

English: Saying, “God has forsaken him; Pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver him.”
Bahnar: Păng khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei achăng lê̆ sư boih; Bĕ druh rôp sư, yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu dŏng pơklaih sư.”

English: O God, do not be far from me; O my God, make haste to help me!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Lê̆ kơ hơtaih đơ̆ng inh. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơgŭm pơklaih inh mă kuăng kuăng.

English: Let them be confounded and consumed Who are adversaries of my life; Let them be covered with reproach and dishonor Who seek my hurt.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu ayăt kơ inh mơlâu păng răm đĭ; Ăn bĕ kơ lu bơngai chă pơlôch inh, đe pă pơyom păng hlơ̆l mơlâu

English: But I will hope continually, And will praise You yet more and more.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah inh chang hơmĕng kơ Ih ling-lang. Păng bơnê kơ Ih rai dêh.

English: My mouth shall tell of Your righteousness And Your salvation all the day, For I do not know their limits.
Bahnar: Rim năr 'bơ̆r inh gô ră roi tơdrong tơpăt păng tơdrong Ih dŏng pơklaih. Mă inh ưh kơ băt jô̆ lơ dôm yơ.

English: I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD; I will make mention of Your righteousness, of Yours only.
Bahnar: Inh gô năm păng roi tơdrong mơsêh Kră Yang; Inh gô lăp minh Ih roi gah tơdrong tơpăt Ih đĕch
Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih bơtho boih inh đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p. Dĭng truh tơ dang ei, inh oei roi tơbăt gah tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Ih.

English: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, do not forsake me, Until I declare Your strength to this generation, Your power to everyone who is to come.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă khan inh kră, hăm sŏk ko boih. Apinh Ih 'nĕ achăng lê̆ inh, Dĭng inh đei ră roi kơ rim jơhnơr, tơdrong pran kơtang Ih. Păng tơdrong gơh kĕ mơsêh mơyang Ih kơ lu bơngai.

English: Also Your righteousness, O God, is very high, You who have done great things; O God, who is like You?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơdrong tơpăt Ih kơjung tĭk tơ plĕnh. Ih đei pơm boih tơdrong jang tih. Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, bu đei thoi Ih?

English: You, who have shown me great and severe troubles, Shall revive me again, And bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
Bahnar: Ih đei ăn boih kơ inh tơdrong gleh pơmat krưp: Ih gô pơrih inh păng pôk hơtŏk inh đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ lăm teh đak.

English: You shall increase my greatness, And comfort me on every side.
Bahnar: Ih gô pơư kơ inh rai dêh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ rai dêh. Hơlơ̆k pơlung inh dơ̆ng.

English: Also with the lute I will praise You— And Your faithfulness, O my God! To You I will sing with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Inh gô yua tĭng-nĭng reh hơri bơnê kơ Ih. Inh gô hơri kơ tơdrong tơpăt Ih; Ơ Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đe Isơrael, Inh gô yua tĭng-nĭng dơ̆ng hơri bơnê kơ Ih.

English: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing to You, And my soul, which You have redeemed.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r păng bơhngol inh mă Ih đei huai iŏk. Gô ôr chơt, mưh inh hơri bơnê kơ Ih.

English: My tongue also shall talk of Your righteousness all the day long; For they are confounded, For they are brought to shame Who seek my hurt.
Bahnar: Rim năr hơpiĕt inh gô roi tơdrong tơpăt Ih; Yua kơ lu bơngai chă pơrăm inh mơlâu đĭ păng hlơ̆l kơdơ̆ ngăl boih.

English: Give the king Your judgments, O God, And Your righteousness to the king’s Son.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih ăn kơ pơtao gơh sek tơlang, Păng ăn kơ kon pơtao tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đơ̆ng Ih.

English: He will judge Your people with righteousness, And Your poor with justice.
Bahnar: Sư gô sek tơlang kon pơlei Ih tơpăt hơnơ̆ng. Sek lu bơngai dơnuh hin trŏ tơpăt.

English: The mountains will bring peace to the people, And the little hills, by righteousness.
Bahnar: Ăn lu kông gô ba tơdrong hiôk jơnap kơ kon pơlei pơla, lu groi đei plei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt

English: He will bring justice to the poor of the people; He will save the children of the needy, And will break in pieces the oppressor.
Bahnar: Sư gô sek dŏng lu bơngai dơnuh hin lăm kon pơlei. Dŏng pơklaih lu kon lu bơngai kơ'bah kơ'bôch păng pơrăm lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep đe

English: They shall fear You As long as the sun and moon endure, Throughout all generations.
Bahnar: Măt 'năr măt khei oei đei truh dang yơ. Lu sư kư̆m hli yom kơ Kră Yang dang noh, truh tơ lăm đĭ jơhnơr

English: He shall come down like rain upon the grass before mowing, Like showers that water the earth.
Bahnar: Pơtao gô jur thoi 'mi jruh tơ kơpal mir nhen thoi 'mi tih jruh hơiuh tơ teh.

English: In His days the righteous shall flourish, And abundance of peace, Until the moon is no more.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah pơtao oei pơgơ̆r ăn kơ bơngai tơpăt hiôk jơnap. Ăn tơdrong rơnŭk rơnua dĭng măt khei pă đei.

English: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, And from the River to the ends of the earth.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ sư pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ âu truh tơ đak dơsĭ nai. Đơ̆ng krong âu truh tơ tôch teh đak.

English: Those who dwell in the wilderness will bow before Him, And His enemies will lick the dust.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei tơ lăm char 'blach gô kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp sư. Lu ayăt kơ sư gô liah 'mui teh

English: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles Will bring presents; The kings of Sheba and Seba Will offer gifts.
Bahnar: Lu pơtao Tarêsi păng lu bŏl đak dơsĭ gô ăn thuê̆ kơ sư. Pơtao Seba păng Seba gô pơyơ̆r ăn kơ sư.

English: Yes, all kings shall fall down before Him; All nations shall serve Him.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng pơtao gô drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp sư; Rim teh đak gô bơ̆jang kơ sư.

English: For He will deliver the needy when he cries, The poor also, and him who has no helper.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư gô pơklaih lu bơngai dơnuh hin, dah lu sư krao apinh. Păng dŏng pơklaih lu pơmat-tat mă ưh kơ đei bu tơgŭm.

English: He will spare the poor and needy, And will save the souls of the needy.
Bahnar: Sư gô mơnat kơ lu pơmat-tat păng lu hoh kơ đei, Păng pơklaih tơdrong arih lu bơngai kơ'bah kơ'bôch.

English: He will redeem their life from oppression and violence; And precious shall be their blood in His sight.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơklaih tơdrong arih lu bơngai đe pơjuă pơđep păng đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Păng lăng pham lu sư gĭt tơpă.

English: And He shall live; And the gold of Sheba will be given to Him; Prayer also will be made for Him continually, And daily He shall be praised.
Bahnar: Sư gô oei arih sot, na gô pơyơ̆r maih Seba ăn kơ sư. Đe gô krao khan kơ sư ling-lang; Păng rim năr sơkat pŭn hiôk kơ sư.

English: There will be an abundance of grain in the earth, On the top of the mountains; Its fruit shall wave like Lebanon; And those of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ đei 'ba hơbŏ rơkah rơkai tơ kơpal teh păng 'bĕnh tơ kơpal kông; plei 'long sa lơlap thoi bri tơ char Liban. Ăn kơ kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei tih gô hrôh ngôh thoi 'nhĕt tơ mir.

English: His name shall endure forever; His name shall continue as long as the sun. And men shall be blessed in Him; All nations shall call Him blessed.
Bahnar: Anăn sư gô oei đei ling-lang. Măt 'năr sư oei đei dang yơ, anăn sư gô oei dang noh; Kon pơlei đei pŭn hiôk đơ̆ng sư! Lu kon pơlei gô sơkat kơ sư đei pŭn hiôk.

English: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, Who only does wondrous things!
Bahnar: Trŏ kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, Lăp minh 'nu Sư đĕch pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp!

English: And blessed be His glorious name forever! And let the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen and Amen.
Bahnar: Trŏ hơri bơnê ư-ang anăn Sư ling-lang truh ning-mônh. Ăn tơdrong ư-ang Sư 'bĕnh-'bang jơ̆p kơ teh đak! A-men! A-men!

English: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Đawit, kon drŏ-nglo Êsai krao khan tôch dâu.

English: Truly God is good to Israel, To such as are pure in heart.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael. Lu bơngai mă đei jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled; My steps had nearly slipped.
Bahnar: Mă-lei jơ̆ng inh pă 'biơ̆ wă jê̆ kơtơih yak inh wă jê̆ tơsĕr pơ̆k.

English: For I was envious of the boastful, When I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh 'bôh lu bơngai kơnê̆ đei tơdrong hiôk chơt. Inh đei jơhngơ̆m gar lu bơngai pơang.

English: For there are no pangs in their death, But their strength is firm.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ đei jĭ pơmat. Akâu jăn lu sư oei pran hiôk

English: They are not in trouble as other men, Nor are they plagued like other men.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ đei pơmat thoi đe nai. Kŭm huay kơ răm thoi gơ̆p buăl.

English: Therefore pride serves as their necklace; Violence covers them like a garment.
Bahnar: Lei na lu sư iŏk tơdrong pơang pơm thoi rơbưn maih 'băk tơ hơko. Lu sư iŏk tơdrong kơnê̆ pơm thoi ao pĕng akâu.

English: Their eyes bulge with abundance; They have more than heart could wish.
Bahnar: Măt lu sư pơ'ngeh yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆; jơhngơ̆m lu sư 'bĕnh kơtul kơwao.

English: They scoff and speak wickedly concerning oppression; They speak loftily.
Bahnar: Lu sư blei hiap, pơma kơnê̆ tơpă; Lu sư pơjăm pơjuă đe nai, na chă đon wă pơjuă bơngai nai.

English: They set their mouth against the heavens, And their tongue walks through the earth.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r lu sư pơma kơnê̆ kơ Kră Yang tơ plĕnh. Hơpiĕt lu sư chă hơlĕnh kơ bơngai lăm teh đak.

English: Therefore his people return here, And waters of a full cup are drained by them.
Bahnar: Lei na kon pơlei wơ̆t kiơ̆ lu sư, pơm kiơ̆ pơđĭ thoi tơdrong lu sư chă đon.

English: And they say, “How does God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Liơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh băt? Thoi yơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh gơh hlôh?”

English: Behold, these are the ungodly, Who are always at ease; They increase in riches.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ thoi noh, Lu sư oei hiôk-hian rai mơdrŏng dêh.

English: Surely I have cleansed my heart in vain, And washed my hands in innocence.
Bahnar: Tơdrong kơ đei inh kư̆ hrăn wei jơhngơ̆m rơgoh, ôp ti huay kơ pơm yoch.

English: For all day long I have been plagued, And chastened every morning.
Bahnar: Prăt năr inh đei gleh truh, rim pơgê inh đei phak pơjĭ.

English: If I had said, “I will speak thus,” Behold, I would have been untrue to the generation of Your children.
Bahnar: Dah inh đei khan: “Inh gô pơma thoi âu,” Lei inh pơm ưh kơ tơpăt kơ lu adrĕch adrung kon pơlei Ih boih.

English: When I thought how to understand this, It was too painful for me
Bahnar: Mưh inh tơchĕng wă kơ băt đĭ tơdrong noh, lei gleh dêh kơ inh.

English: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; Then I understood their end.
Bahnar: Dĭng truh tơ inh mơ̆t lăm anih rơgoh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Lei inh băt gah năr tôch lu sư.

English: Surely You set them in slippery places; You cast them down to destruction.
Bahnar: Tơpă Ih dan boih lu sư 'bơ̆t trong tơsĕr. Ăn kơ lu sư huŏng tơ lăm anih lôch hiong.

English: Oh, how they are brought to desolation, as in a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors.
Bahnar: Ơ lăng deh, lu sư răm hloi 'bônh đĕch! Tơdrong hli krưp hơpuih pơgoh lu sư.

English: As a dream when one awakes, So, Lord, when You awake, You shall despise their image.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang nhen thoi apo wă hơđơ̆r 'biao, wă Ih iung Ih hiơt kơ lu sư thoi noh mơ̆n

English: Thus my heart was grieved, And I was vexed in my mind.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh ơh sơ'ngon, inh jĭ jơhngơ̆m thoi sa tăng.

English: I was so foolish and ignorant; I was like a beast before You.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh inh oei kơtul kơwao ưh kơ băt tơdrong kiơ. 'Bơ̆t anăp Ih inh nhen thoi sem brem đĕch.

English: Nevertheless I am continually with You; You hold me by my right hand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, inh oei hăm Ih ling-lang; Ih rôp ti 'ma inh.

English: You will guide me with Your counsel, And afterward receive me to glory.
Bahnar: Ih yua tơdrong bơtho tơ'bôh na dui ba inh. Đơ̆ng noh sơng iŏk inh lăm tơdrong ư-ang.

English: Whom have I in heaven but You? And there is none upon earth that I desire besides You.
