Bahnar: Tơ kơpal plĕnh inh ưh kơ đei bu, 'nguaih Kơ Kră Yang? Lăm teh đak, inh ưh kơ đei hơpơi chă bu nai 'nguaih Kơ Ih.

English: My flesh and my heart fail; But God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
Bahnar: Sĕch akar păng jơhngơ̆m inh gô răm; Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn jơhngơ̆m inh pran kơtang păng tơmam inh yua gĭt ling-lang.

English: For indeed, those who are far from You shall perish; You have destroyed all those who desert You for harlotry.
Bahnar: To lu bơngai ataih đơ̆ng Ih gô hiong răm; Ih gô pơrăm lê̆ lu bơngai kuă kơ chu Ih.

English: But it is good for me to draw near to God; I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, That I may declare all Your works.
Bahnar: Gah inh 'lơ̆ng dêh, oei jê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh gơnang kơ Kră Yang jing anih inh kơ'nơp wă kơ inh ră roi dôm tơdrong jang Ih.

English: O God, why have You cast us off forever? Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ kiơ Ih achăng lê̆ nhôn ling-lang? Liơ Ih hil kơ lu triu lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt hơdrih Ih?

English: Remember Your congregation, which You have purchased of old, The tribe of Your inheritance, which You have redeemed— This Mount Zion where You have dwelt.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ kon pơlei mă Ih đei huai iŏk sơ̆, Adrĕch adrung mă ih đei dŏng pơklaih wă jing kon pơlei Ih. Apinh 'blŏk kơ Kông Siôn, mă anih Ih oei boih.

English: Lift up Your feet to the perpetual desolations. The enemy has damaged everything in the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih yak bĕ tơ anih mă pơrăm noh. Lu ayăt pơrăm lê̆ đĭ boih anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: Your enemies roar in the midst of Your meeting place; They set up their banners for signs.
Bahnar: Lu ayăt kơ Ih mă ôr tơkĕch boih tơ lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih. Lu sư pơdơ̆ng boih hla-kơ wă pơm tơdra jei sư.

English: They seem like men who lift up Axes among the thick trees.
Bahnar: Lu sư thoi bơngai chĕp sung yơ̆r hơ-ô wă kăl 'long.

English: And now they break down its carved work, all at once, With axes and hammers.
Bahnar: Lu sư yua sung păng mut teh tơpăk pơchah đĭ tơmam pơm păng 'long đe traih pơiel.

English: They have set fire to Your sanctuary; They have defiled the dwelling place of Your name to the ground.
Bahnar: Lu sư soh lê̆ anih 'Lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih truh tơ teh, lu sư pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ anih Anăn Ih.

English: They said in their hearts, “Let us destroy them altogether.” They have burned up all the meeting places of God in the land.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan lăm jơhngơ̆m: “Bĕ lu bơ̆n pơrăm pơgoh!” Lu sư soh lê̆ boih hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal teh

English: We do not see our signs; There is no longer any prophet; Nor is there any among us who knows how long.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn pă đei 'bôh tơdra hlĭch. Ưh pă đei bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơ lăm lu nhôn kư̆m ưh pă đei bu băt tơdrong âu dĭng truh tơ dang yơ.

English: O God, how long will the adversary reproach? Will the enemy blaspheme Your name forever?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu ayăt gô pơjăm pơjuă Ih dĭng truh dang yơ? Wă lê̆ lu ayăt pơma kơnê̆ kơ anăn Ih ling-lang đĕch hă?

English: Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand? Take it out of Your bosom and destroy them.
Bahnar: Liơ Ih dui lê̆ ti gah 'ma Ih noh. Yơ̆r bĕ ti Ih păng pơlôch đĭ lu sư.

English: For God is my King from of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ pơtao inh đơ̆ng sơ̆. Oei dŏng pơklaih tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: You divided the sea by Your strength; You broke the heads of the sea serpents in the waters.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yua boih tơdrong mơsêh Ih klah asong đak dơsĭ. Teh pơchah kơ̆l sem brem kơnê̆ lăm đak.

English: You broke the heads of Leviathan in pieces, And gave him as food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Ih pơjuă pơhĕch lê̆ kơ̆l Lêwiathan; Pơm kơ sư jing tơmam sa kơ lu bơngai mă oei tơ char 'blach.

English: You broke open the fountain and the flood; You dried up mighty rivers.
Bahnar: Ih boih pơih tu đak lĕch ăn kơ krong đei đak ro, păng pơhrơ̆ lê̆ lu đak krong tih.

English: The day is Yours, the night also is Yours; You have prepared the light and the sun.
Bahnar: Kơ'năr jơ̆ Ih kơmăng kư̆m lei-lăi; Ih boih pơjing kơ măt khei măt 'năr.

English: You have set all the borders of the earth; You have made summer and winter.
Bahnar: Ih đei pơjing boih kơ teh, Păng pơjing kơ bơyan puih, bơyan hngach.

English: Remember this, that the enemy has reproached, O LORD, And that a foolish people has blasphemed Your name.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'blŏk bĕ lu ayăt kơ Ih pơjăm Ih, Kon pơlei pơjăm Ih, kon pơlei kơtul kơwao blei hiap anăn Ih.

English: Oh, do not deliver the life of Your turtledove to the wild beast! Do not forget the life of Your poor forever.
Bahnar: Apinh 'nĕ pơjao tơdrong arih sem kơtơp Ih kơ lu sem bri. 'Nĕ hiơt ling-lang kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat Ih.

English: Have respect to the covenant; For the dark places of the earth are full of the haunts of cruelty.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ đêl nơ̆r pơgơ̆p; Yua kơ anih măng mu lăm teh đak 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Oh, do not let the oppressed return ashamed! Let the poor and needy praise Your name.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu bơngai mă đe pơjuă mơlâu. Ăn kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat păng dơnuh hin băt hơri bơnê kơ anăn Ih

English: Arise, O God, plead Your own cause; Remember how the foolish man reproaches You daily.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, iung bĕ dŏng tơdrong Ih, Athei 'blŏk bĕ lu kơtul pơjăm Ih prăt năr?

English: Do not forget the voice of Your enemies; The tumult of those who rise up against You increases continually.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hiơt kơ nơ̆r lu ayăt kơ Ih Nơ̆r ôr tơkĕch tơjrông tơjrang pă pơdơh blah Ih

English: We give thanks to You, O God, we give thanks! For Your wondrous works declare that Your name is near.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu nhôn bơnê kơ Ih, Lu nhôn kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih, yua kơ Ih jê̆ lu nhôn: Lu nhôn ră roi tơdrong hlĭch chrơp đơ̆ng Ih pơm

English: “When I choose the proper time, I will judge uprightly.
Bahnar: Truh 'bơ̆t jơ Inh pơkă boih, Inh gô đei sek tơlang tơpăt.

English: The earth and all its inhabitants are dissolved; I set up its pillars firmly. Selah
Bahnar: Mă khan teh păng kon pơlei oei kơpal teh pơpơ̆, Inh boih pơkơ̆ng jrăng sư kơjăp. Sêla

English: “I said to the boastful, ‘Do not deal boastfully,’ And to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up the horn.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu pơang: “'Nĕ pă pơang.” Hăm khan kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆: “'Nĕ pă pơư khan pran kơtang.

English: Do not lift up your horn on high; Do not speak with a stiff neck.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă tưk hơke kơjung wă blah plĕnh. 'Nĕ pă pơma pơrŏ toh hơko.”

English: For exaltation comes neither from the east Nor from the west nor from the south.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch gah bơmơ̆t. Dah đơ̆ng char glă ôh mă đei tơdrong kơkuh pơyom

English: But God is the Judge: He puts down one, And exalts another.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla sek tơlang; Sư tơjur đe âu păng hơtŏk đe noh.

English: For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, And the wine is red; It is fully mixed, and He pours it out; Surely its dregs shall all the wicked of the earth Drain and drink down.
Bahnar: Lăm ti Kră Yang đei chĕp pơnhan. Tơdrô blôk yuh; Sư tuh 'bĕnh kơ tơdrô hơkăm. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kơnê̆ lăm teh đak gô huch tơdrô noh; păng huch pơgoh đĭ kơdroh sư.

English: But I will declare forever, I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
Bahnar: Gah inh wă ră roi tơdrong sư noh ling-lang Inh kư̆m gô hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp.

English: “All the horns of the wicked I will also cut off, But the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ret lê̆ đĭ hơke lu bơngai kơnê̆, mă-lei gah hơke lu bơngai tơpăt gô hơtŏk kơjung.

English: In Judah God is known; His name is great in Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm Juđa, đe băt hơđăl kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Anăn Sư tih tơpă tơ lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: In Salem also is His tabernacle, And His dwelling place in Zion.
Bahnar: Hnam anih akŭm Sư tơ Salem păng anih oei Sư tơ Siôn

English: There He broke the arrows of the bow, The shield and sword of battle. Selah
Bahnar: Tơ anih noh boih Sư gơ̆ lê̆ 'brơ̆m hră. Khêl đao hơlă păng dôm tơmam tơblah. Sêla

English: You are more glorious and excellent Than the mountains of prey.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ư-ang rang mơnhal. Wih đơ̆ng kông blah jei.

English: The stouthearted were plundered; They have sunk into their sleep; And none of the mighty men have found the use of their hands.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nuih kơtang đe tơgar iŏk tơmam tơblah lu sư đĭ boih. Lu sư tep hlŏng hloi pă đei bu nuih pran mă oei gơh hiŏng kơkŏng ti.

English: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob, Both the chariot and horse were cast into a dead sleep.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp, mưh Ih hil chrih, Gre aseh păng lu aseh pơ̆k lôch đĭ

English: You, Yourself, are to be feared; And who may stand in Your presence When once You are angry?
Bahnar: Lăp minh 'nu Ih đĕch trŏ kơ hli yom; Layơ Ih hil bu kĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Ih

English: You caused judgment to be heard from heaven; The earth feared and was still
Bahnar: Ih pơma khan đơ̆ng plĕnh kơ tơdrong sek tơlang. Na teh hli tơrơ, ngăn hreh. Sêla

English: When God arose to judgment, To deliver all the oppressed of the earth. Selah
Bahnar: Mưh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iung sek tơlang. Wă dŏng pơklaih lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kơpal teh.

English: Surely the wrath of man shall praise You; With the remainder of wrath You shall gird Yourself.
Bahnar: Tơpă tơdrong kon bơngai hil kư̆m jing hơri bơnê kơ Ih, Lu bơngai mă oei đei arih noh. Gô năm pơm giĕng ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Make vows to the LORD your God, and pay them; Let all who are around Him bring presents to Him who ought to be feared.
Bahnar: Pơkă bĕ lu kon pơlei oei tăp dăr kơ sư păng pơm pơkeh nơ̆r pơkă hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm; Pơyơ̆r bĕ tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang, Sư boih trŏ kơ hli yom.

English: He shall cut off the spirit of princes; He is awesome to the kings of the earth.
Bahnar: Sư gô hŭt lê̆ tơdrong pơang, đơ̆ng lu yŏng mơng; Pơm kơ lu pơtao lăm teh đak, hli tơrơ kơ Sư.

English: I cried out to God with my voice— To God with my voice; And He gave ear to me.
Bahnar: Inh krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh ôr krao Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r inh.

English: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; My hand was stretched out in the night without ceasing; My soul refused to be comforted.
Bahnar: Lăm năr anat anot inh krao chă Kră Yang; Kơmăng inh yơ̆r ti krao apinh ưh kơ rơgah; Bơhngol inh ưh kơ wă bu pơlung

English: I remembered God, and was troubled; I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah
Bahnar: Inh 'blŏk kơ Ih, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Inh ôr tơtok, Inh tơchĕng dêh na jơhngơ̆m inh rơdu rơmơ̆n. Sêla

English: You hold my eyelids open; I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
Bahnar: Ih wei gơnur măt inh oei lar, Inh rŭng răng mah ưh pă gơh pơma.

English: I have considered the days of old, The years of ancient times.
Bahnar: Inh tơchĕng kơ chăl sơ̆, kơ lu sơnăm mă hloh boih sơ̆ ki

English: I call to remembrance my song in the night; I meditate within my heart, And my spirit makes diligent search.
Bahnar: Kơmăng inh 'blŏk dơ̆ng 'bai hơri inh, Jơhngơ̆m inh tơchĕng păng bơhngol inh chă apinh

English: Will the Lord cast off forever? And will He be favorable no more?
Bahnar: “Kră Yang achăng lê̆ bơ̆n hlŏng hloi boih hă? Sư ưh pă mơnat ăn kơ bơ̆n dơ̆ng hă?

English: Has His mercy ceased forever? Has His promise failed forevermore?
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơnat Sư ưh pă đei boih hă Nơ̆r Sư pơkă wă jor hlŏng hloi boih hă?

English: Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has He in anger shut up His tender mercies? Selah
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hiơt tơdrong mơnat ăn boih hă? Lăm Sư hil mĭl Sư chĭt lê̆ pă mơnat boih hă?” Sêla

English: And I said, “This is my anguish; But I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High.”
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Âu boih pơmat-tat kơ inh, Ti 'ma Kră Yang Tih Hloha tơplih boih.”

English: I will remember the works of the LORD; Surely I will remember Your wonders of old.
Bahnar: Inh tơ'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ dôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang, Inh 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ lu tơdrong mơsêh hlĭch Ih pơm sơ̆

English: I will also meditate on all Your work, And talk of Your deeds.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m gô tơchĕng kơ dôm tơdrong Ih pơm boih. Păng oei tơchĕng kơ lu tơdrong jang hlĭch Ih noh.

English: Your way, O God, is in the sanctuary; Who is so great a God as our God?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tôm tơdrong Ih pơm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ngăl. Hăm đei yang kiơ tih hơtŏ hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh?

English: You are the God who does wonders; You have declared Your strength among the peoples.
Bahnar: Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp, Ih đei tơ'bôh boih tơdrong mơsêh Ih kơ kon pơlei.

English: You have with Your arm redeemed Your people, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
Bahnar: Ih yua kơkŏng ti Ih kơdih pơklaih kon pơlei pơla Ih. Lu kon drŏ-nglo Jakôp păng kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep. Sêla

English: The waters saw You, O God; The waters saw You, they were afraid; The depths also trembled.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu đak 'bôh Ih hli tơtơ̆; Lu sơlŭng jrŭ kư̆m tơrơ.

English: The clouds poured out water; The skies sent out a sound; Your arrows also flashed about.
Bahnar: Lu hơmơ̆l pruh đak 'mi, Tơ rơwơ̆ng đei re jơwa grơ̆m glaih đei kơmlat thoi 'brơ̆m tơ jơ̆p-jang.

English: The voice of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; The lightnings lit up the world; The earth trembled and shook.
Bahnar: Grơ̆m Ih re kiơ̆ lăm kial hơbŭt; Kơmlat pơchrang hơdah kơ teh đak; Teh pơpơ̆ păng tơdrŏ.

English: Your way was in the sea, Your path in the great waters, And Your footsteps were not known.
Bahnar: Ih yak lăm đak dơsĭ. Trong Ih rok đak dơsĭ jrŭ, mă-lei đêl jơ̆ng Ih ưh kơ đei bu 'bôh.b

English: You led Your people like a flock By the hand of Moses and Aaron.
Bahnar: Ih yua ti Môis păng Arôn chông anhăk kon pơlei pơla Ih thoi khŭl triu.

English: Give ear, O my people, to my law; Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla Inh, pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh bơtho. Pơgrê đon mơ̆ng bĕ đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh pơma.

English: I will open my mouth in a parable; I will utter dark sayings of old
Bahnar: Inh gô pơih 'bơ̆r Inh pơma pơđơ̆k, tơblang nơ̆r pơpơn sơ̆ ki

English: Which we have heard and known, And our fathers have told us.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mă lu bơ̆n đei kơtơ̆ng boih păng băt boih. Đe 'bok bơ̆n đei roi ăn kơ lu bơ̆n boih.

English: We will not hide them from their children, Telling to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, And His strength and His wonderful works that He has done.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n kư̆m ưh kơ ôn dôm tơdrong noh kơ kon sâu lu bơ̆n. Bơ̆n gô roi kơ adrĕch adrung đơ̆ng rŏng dôm tơdrong trŏ hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang, Tơdrong mơsêh păng tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp mă Kră Yang đei pơm.

English: For He established a testimony in Jacob, And appointed a law in Israel, Which He commanded our fathers, That they should make them known to their children
Bahnar: Sư đei ăn boih nơ̆r tơtă? Jakôp. Sư ăn lê̆ khôi juăt lăm Isơrael. Noh sư pơkă boih kơ 'bok bơ̆n wă kơ bơtho khôi juăt kơ lu kon sâu sư.

English: That the generation to come might know them, The children who would be born, That they may arise and declare them to their children
Bahnar: Wă kơ adrĕch adrung đơ̆ng rŏng băt kơ khôi juăt Sư. Lu kon sâu tơpŭ đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng gơh băt kơ dôm khôi juăt noh. Na đơ̆ng noh lu sư bơtho dơ̆ng kơ lu kon sâu sư.

English: That they may set their hope in God, And not forget the works of God, But keep His commandments
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m băt gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Wă huay kơ hiơt kơ dôm tơdrong Kră Yang đei pơm. Păng wei răk dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă.

English: And may not be like their fathers, A stubborn and rebellious generation, A generation that did not set its heart aright, And whose spirit was not faithful to God.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư huay kơ rok lu 'bok sư. Jơ̆ minh adrĕch kơchu păng arăng kơ̆l, Ưh kơ đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt păng ưh kơ đei đon lui kơjăp kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows, Turned back in the day of battle.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êphraim chĕp hră păng 'brơ̆m, mă-lei kơdŭn tơ rŏng lăm năr tơblah

English: They did not keep the covenant of God; They refused to walk in His law
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ wei răk nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Hơngah ưh kơ chu arih kiơ̆ khôi juăt Sư.

English: And forgot His works And His wonders that He had shown them.
Bahnar: Hiơt đĭ dôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang mă đei pơm. Păng tơdrong hlĭch chrơp mă Kră Yang đei tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư.

English: Marvelous things He did in the sight of their fathers, In the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơm boih dôm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok lu sư. Tơ lăm char Êyiptơ, lăm anih thŭng dơnă Sôan.

English: He divided the sea and caused them to pass through; And He made the waters stand up like a heap.
Bahnar: Kră Yang blă lê̆ đak dơsĭ ăn kơ lu sư tŏk rok, Pơm ăn kơ đak dơ̆ng minh 'bôt tơbơ̆ng thoi dur.

English: In the daytime also He led them with the cloud, And all the night with a light of fire.
Bahnar: Sư chông ba lu sư kơ'năr hăm hơmơ̆l, kơmăng hăm hơdah ŭnh.

English: He split the rocks in the wilderness, And gave them drink in abundance like the depths.
Bahnar: Sư blah tơmo lăm char 'blach, ăn kơ lu sư đak nhă hrăp thoi đơ̆ng tu đak jrŭ

English: He also brought streams out of the rock, And caused waters to run down like rivers.
Bahnar: sư ăn đak lĕch đơ̆ng tơmo ro thoi đak krong.

English: But they sinned even more against Him By rebelling against the Most High in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư kư̆m oei pơm yoch păng Kră Yang. Hil plơ̆ kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh tơ lăm char 'blach.

English: And they tested God in their heart By asking for the food of their fancy.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơrơ̆ng pơlong lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Na apinh tơmam sa kiơ̆ thoi lu sư wă.

English: Yes, they spoke against God: They said, “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
Bahnar: Sư pơma kơnê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm gơh ưh hơmet gơ'bang sŏng sa tơ char 'blach?

English: Behold, He struck the rock, So that the waters gushed out, And the streams overflowed. Can He give bread also? Can He provide meat for His people?”
Bahnar: To sư teh tơmo, đak bluh lĕch ro hloi, 'bĕnh kơ thong. Mă-lei bĕ tơmam sa Sư ưh kơ gơh ăn kơ bơ̆n hă? Bĕ 'nhĕm kông sư ưh kơ gơh ăn kơ kon pơlei Sư hă?”

English: Therefore the LORD heard this and was furious; So a fire was kindled against Jacob, And anger also came up against Israel
Bahnar: Wă kơ Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng na Sư hil dêh; ŭnh Sư hil soh sa Jakôp. Sư kư̆m hil kơ Isơrael.

English: Because they did not believe in God, And did not trust in His salvation.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ wă lui kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; Kŭm ưh kơ wă gơnang kơ tơdrong dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng Sư.

English: Yet He had commanded the clouds above, And opened the doors of heaven
Bahnar: Mă-lei ră, Sư kư̆m athei lu tăl plĕnh tơ kơpal ti, Păng Sư pơih 'măng plĕnh

English: Had rained down manna on them to eat, And given them of the bread of heaven.
Bahnar: Tơjruh 'mi mana ăn kơ lu sư sa, ăn 'ba đơ̆ng plĕnh

English: Men ate angels’ food; He sent them food to the full.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai sa boih 'bĕng lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng. Sư gơih ăn tơmam sa phĭ mah

English: He caused an east wind to blow in the heavens; And by His power He brought in the south wind.
Bahnar: Sư ăn tơ plĕnh ti đei kial tơthu đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch. Đơ̆ng tơdrong mơsêh Sư ba ăn kial đơ̆ng gah gơal.

English: He also rained meat on them like the dust, Feathered fowl like the sand of the seas
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'mi 'nhĕm jruh tơ lu sư thoi 'mui teh. Ăn lu sem păr lơ thoi chuơh cheng dơsĭ.

English: And He let them fall in the midst of their camp, All around their dwellings.
Bahnar: Sư ăn lu sem noh jruh tơ anih lu sư. Tăp dăr bơsŭn lu sư oei.

English: So they ate and were well filled, For He gave them their own desire.
Bahnar: Na lu sư sa, phĭ hrăp dĭng bơ̆l. Sư ăn tơmam kiơ̆ kơ lu sư hơpơi

English: They were not deprived of their craving; But while their food was still in their mouths
Bahnar: Mă-lei adrol kơ lu sư bơ̆l sa tơmam mă lu sư 'maih sa kơplah noh tơmam sa oei oei lăm 'bơ̆r lu sư.

English: The wrath of God came against them, And slew the stoutest of them, And struck down the choice men of Israel.
Bahnar: Đei hloi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil kơ lu sư, pơlôch lu bơngai mă pran hloh lăm lu sư, Sư pơrăm lu kon tơdăm Isơrael.

English: In spite of this they still sinned, And did not believe in His wondrous works.
Bahnar: Mă khan thoi noh ră, lu sư kư̆m oei pơm yoch. Oei ưh kơ lui kơ tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Kră Yang đei pơm.

English: Therefore their days He consumed in futility, And their years in fear.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Sư pơm kơ 'năr lu sư hiong đĭ ưh kơ yua. Pơm kơ khei sơnăm lu sư hiong tôch lăm tơdrong hli krưp.

English: When He slew them, then they sought Him; And they returned and sought earnestly for God.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang pơlôch lu sư, lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang. Tơbral chơchă krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then they remembered that God was their rock, And the Most High God their Redeemer.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'blŏk kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ tơmo tih lu sư. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh jơ̆ Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư.

English: Nevertheless they flattered Him with their mouth, And they lied to Him with their tongue
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư chă pơma 'bơ̆r đĕch hăm Kră Yang. Yua hơpiĕt lu sư pơma hơlĕnh kơ Sư.

English: For their heart was not steadfast with Him, Nor were they faithful in His covenant.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m lu sư ưh kơjăp păng Kră Yang. Lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ tơpăt lăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơtă.

English: But He, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, And did not destroy them. Yes, many a time He turned His anger away, And did not stir up all His wrath
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Sư huay kơ jô̆ yoch, ưh kơ wă pơrăm lu sư; Lơ wơ̆t sư gơ̆t lê̆ kơ hil, Sư ưh kơ mah tơ'bôh dêh tơdrong Sư hil.

English: For He remembered that they were but flesh, A breath that passes away and does not come again.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'blŏk kơ lu sư jơ̆ bơngai hmă đĕch. Thoi hơyuh kial lĕch boih pă wih dơ̆ng

English: How often they provoked Him in the wilderness, And grieved Him in the desert!
Bahnar: Băt đei hơdôm wơ̆t lu sư pơm kơnê̆ hăm Kră Yang tơ char 'blach, păng pơm ăn kơ Sư sơ'ngon tơ teh dơnă!

English: Yes, again and again they tempted God, And limited the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu sư lơ wơ̆t pơlong lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Pơjah păng Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: They did not remember His power: The day when He redeemed them from the enemy
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ 'blŏk tơdrong mơsêh Kră Yang, lăm năr Kră Yang pơklaih lu sư

English: When He worked His signs in Egypt, And His wonders in the field of Zoan
Bahnar: Sư ăn boih tơdra hlĭch chrơp tơ char Êyiptơ, Lu tơdrong mơsêh Sư lăm thŭng dơnă Sôar

English: Turned their rivers into blood, And their streams, that they could not drink.
Bahnar: Tơplih lu đak krong Êyiptơ jing pham lei lu sư pă gơh nhă dơ̆ng đơ̆ng tu đak.

English: He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them, And frogs, which destroyed them.
Bahnar: Sư ăn khŭl roi vŏng kăp lu sư; păng kit pơrăm lu sư

English: He also gave their crops to the caterpillar, And their labor to the locust.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lep tung-nut sa lu 'ba hơ'bo lu sư. Jao kơ lep 'ba sa plei 'long lu sư.

English: He destroyed their vines with hail, And their sycamore trees with frost.
Bahnar: Sư pơrăm pơgar hơmu lu sư păng 'mi prĕl, pơrăm 'long hơra lu sư hăm đak prĕl gom.

English: He also gave up their cattle to the hail, And their flocks to fiery lightning.
Bahnar: Sư pơrăm sem dơrong lu sư hăm 'mi prĕl. Păng khŭl triu lu sư ăn kơ grơ̆m glaih.

English: He cast on them the fierceness of His anger, Wrath, indignation, and trouble, By sending angels of destruction among them.
Bahnar: Sư tuh tơdrong hil, tơdrong hil mĭl dêh. Tơdrong hil mĭl păng pơmat-tat. Wơh minh khŭl linh jang chă pơrăm.

English: He made a path for His anger; He did not spare their soul from death, But gave their life over to the plague
Bahnar: Sư pơih trong kơ tơdrong hil Sư. Ưh pă ăn kơ bơhngol lu sư klaih kơ lôch. Na jao ăn tơdrong arih lu sư lôch kơ jĭ hơpoh

English: And destroyed all the firstborn in Egypt, The first of their strength in the tents of Ham.
Bahnar: Sư pơlôch đĭ lu kon kơdră lăm char Êyiptơ, Wă khan lu pran kơtang tơpŭ blŭng-a lăm kơđông bơsŭn Cham.

English: But He made His own people go forth like sheep, And guided them in the wilderness like a flock
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư chông ba kon pơlei Sư lĕch thoi triu, Chông ba lu sư thoi khŭl triu rok char glă.

English: And He led them on safely, so that they did not fear; But the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
Bahnar: Sư chông anhăk lu sư hiôk rơnŭk. Ưh pă đei hli kơ kiơ; Mă-lei đak dơsĭ kơlơ̆p lê̆, lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu sư.

English: And He brought them to His holy border, This mountain which His right hand had acquired.
Bahnar: Sư anhăk ba lu sư truh tơ anih teh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư, Truh tơ tơring groi mă ti 'ma Sư đei blah iŏk.

English: He also drove out the nations before them, Allotted them an inheritance by survey, And made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
Bahnar: Sư puh tơweh lu kon pơlei nai 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, Hlang păng klah song teh ăn kơ lu sư jang sa. Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael oei tơ lăm anih hnam kon pơlei ei.

English: Yet they tested and provoked the Most High God, And did not keep His testimonies
Bahnar: Mă-lei, lu sư pơlong lăng pơjăng pơjah hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, Ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Kră Yang

English: But turned back and acted unfaithfully like their fathers; They were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
Bahnar: Lu sư plơ̆ pơm kơnê̆ thoi 'bok yă lu sư sơ̆. Lu sư weh thoi 'brơ̆m hră đŏng.

English: For they provoked Him to anger with their high places, And moved Him to jealousy with their carved images.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih kơjung lu sư pơm kơ Kră Yang blĕk; Pơm ăn kơ Sư hil ơha yua kơ rup yang

English: When God heard this, He was furious, And greatly abhorred Israel
Bahnar: wă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, Sư blĕk tơpă; Sư hil achăng lê̆ lu bơngai Isơrael hloi

English: So that He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, The tent He had placed among men
Bahnar: Sư weh lê̆ đơ̆ng anih akŭm Sư tơ Silô, Anih mă Sư oei hăm kon bơngai

English: And delivered His strength into captivity, And His glory into the enemy’s hand.
Bahnar: Sư jao hom pơgơ̆p Sư đe păng jao tơdrong ư-ang Sư lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt.

English: He also gave His people over to the sword, And was furious with His inheritance.
Bahnar: Sư jao kon pơlei Sư, ăn kơ đe pơlôch hăm đao hơlă. Sư blĕk dêh kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư.

English: The fire consumed their young men, And their maidens were not given in marriage.
Bahnar: Ŭnh sa lu kon tơdăm lu sư. Păng kon adruh lu sư ưh pă đei bu iŏk oei.

English: Their priests fell by the sword, And their widows made no lamentation.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi sư pơ̆k lôch yua kơ đao hơlă, mă-lei lu drŏ-kăn adro pă đei hmoi.

English: Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, Like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang hơdơ̆r thoi iung đơ̆ng tep. Thoi bơngai nuih pran jreo tơkĕch đơ̆ng tơdrô pơm.

English: And He beat back His enemies; He put them to a perpetual reproach.
Bahnar: Sư blah drŭt lu ayăt kơdŭn tơ rŏng, ăn kơ lu ayăt mơlâu ling-lang hloi.

English: Moreover He rejected the tent of Joseph, And did not choose the tribe of Ephraim
Bahnar: Sư lê̆ Hnam Jôsep, Ưh pă rơih iŏk adrĕch adrung Êphraim.

English: But chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion which He loved.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư rơih iŏk adrĕch Juđa. Păng Kông Siôn mă Sư 'mêm kơeng.

English: And He built His sanctuary like the heights, Like the earth which He has established forever.
Bahnar: Sư pơdơ̆ng hnam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư thoi anih tơ plĕnh ti Thoi plei teh mă sư đei pơjing boih kơjăp ling-lang

English: He also chose David His servant, And took him from the sheepfolds
Bahnar: Sư rơih iŏk Đawit đĭch đam Sư. Iŏk sư đơ̆ng lăm war triu

English: From following the ewes that had young He brought him, To shepherd Jacob His people, And Israel His inheritance.
Bahnar: Sư rôp iŏk Đawit đơ̆ng oei wei-lăng triu. Wă kơ Đawit jing bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Jakôp, kon pơlei pơla Sư. Pơm pơtao Isơrael, kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart, And guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
Bahnar: Đawit wei lu sư kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Hăm tơdrong gơh hơgei na chông anhăk lu sư.

English: O God, the nations have come into Your inheritance; Your holy temple they have defiled; They have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai tơmoi blah iŏk boih teh đak Ih. Pơm mơgrĭ kơ hnam akŭm Ih păng pơm kơ Jêrusalem hĕch hoch đĭ.

English: The dead bodies of Your servants They have given as food for the birds of the heavens, The flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.
Bahnar: Lu sư klơ̆m lê̆ akâu lôch lu đĭch đam Ih, Ăn kơ lu sem păr sa, ăn kơ lu sem bri sa lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih.

English: Their blood they have shed like water all around Jerusalem, And there was no one to bury them.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơlôch pham lĕch thoi đak ro tăp dăr kơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Ưh kơ đei bu 'bŭ akâu bơngai lôch.

English: We have become a reproach to our neighbors, A scorn and derision to those who are around us.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn jing bơngai pơm pơhiĕk ăn kơ rông 'bôt. Jing bơngai lu dêh char tăp dăr đe che bơle păng pơjăm.

English: How long, LORD? Will You be angry forever? Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Dĭng truh dang yơ? Ih wă hil khŏm khŏm hloi ah? Ih wă hil gar oei sa thoi ŭnh ah?

English: Pour out Your wrath on the nations that do not know You, And on the kingdoms that do not call on Your name.
Bahnar: Tuh bĕ tơdrong Ih hil kơ lu teh đak mă ưh kơ băt kơ Ih. Păng tơ lu teh đak mă ưh kơ đei krao apinh hăm anăn Ih

English: For they have devoured Jacob, And laid waste his dwelling place.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư luăn sa boih adrĕch Jakôp, păng pơrăm tơhiong boih teh tơring sư oei.

English: Oh, do not remember former iniquities against us! Let Your tender mercies come speedily to meet us, For we have been brought very low.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'nĕ pă 'blŏk, 'nĕ pă jô̆ dôm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu yă 'bok nhôn sơ̆; Apinh tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Ih tĕnh tĕnh tơgŭm lu nhôn, yua kơ lu nhôn pơmat dêh boih.

English: Help us, O God of our salvation, For the glory of Your name; And deliver us, and provide atonement for our sins, For Your name’s sake!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih nhôn, yua kơ wă ư-ang anăn Ih apinh Ih tơgŭm nhôn. Yua kơ anăn Ih, apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn, păng mơnat ăn kơ tơdrong yoch lu nhôn.

English: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let there be known among the nations in our sight The avenging of the blood of Your servants which has been shed.
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ lu teh đak pơ̆n khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư tơ yơ?” 'Bơ̆t anăp lu nhôn ăn kơ kon bơngai băt iung kơting kơ lu đĭch đam Ih, mă đe pơlôch boih.

English: Let the groaning of the prisoner come before You; According to the greatness of Your power Preserve those who are appointed to die
Bahnar: Ăn kơ tơdrong lu bơngai bơnă krao ôr tơtok truh tơ Ih; Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong mơsêh tih Ih apinh Ih tơgŭm pơklaih bĕ lu bơngai mă đe wă pơlôch.

English: And return to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom Their reproach with which they have reproached You, O Lord.
Bahnar: Pơm tơwih bĕ tơpơh wơ̆t tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu teh đak tăp dăr kơ nhôn. Kơ, nơ̆r pơjăm pơjuă mă lu sư pơjăm boih Ih ơ Kră Yang.

English: So we, Your people and sheep of Your pasture, Will give You thanks forever; We will show forth Your praise to all generations.
Bahnar: Gah lu nhôn jing kon pơlei pơla Ih păng jing triu lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt Ih. Lu nhôn gô bơnê kơkuh kơ Ih ling-lang. Lu nhôn gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, You who lead Joseph like a flock; You who dwell between the cherubim, shine forth!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang mă wei-lăng Isơrael. Ơ Kră Yang chông anhăk adrĕch Jôsep thoi khŭl triu. Pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ. Ơ Kră Yang oei tơ kơpal chêrubim pơchrang bĕ hơdah Ih

English: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, Stir up Your strength, And come and save us!
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp Êphraim, Bênjamin păng Manase, pơdah bĕ tơdrong mơsêh Ih. Păng năm dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn.

English: Restore us, O God; Cause Your face to shine, And we shall be saved!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh Ih tơiung lu nhôn dơ̆ng. Pơdah bĕ muh măt Ih wă kơ lu nhôn gơh klaih.

English: O LORD God of hosts, How long will You be angry Against the prayer of Your people?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh. Ih hil mĭl dêh ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r kon pơlei pơla Ih krao khan dĭng dang yơ?

English: You have fed them with the bread of tears, And given them tears to drink in great measure.
Bahnar: Ih 'me rong lu sư hăm đak măt. Păng ăn kơ lu sư nhă đak măt hrăp hreng.

English: You have made us a strife to our neighbors, And our enemies laugh among themselves.
Bahnar: Ih pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai jih 'ma pơjah tơgar kơ lu nhôn; Păng lu ayăt kơ nhôn lu sư hiĕk pơjăm lu nhôn.

English: Restore us, O God of hosts; Cause Your face to shine, And we shall be saved!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, apinh Ih tơiung lu nhôn dơ̆ng, pơdah bĕ muh măt Ih wă kơ lu nhôn gơh klaih.

English: You have brought a vine out of Egypt; You have cast out the nations, and planted it.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ Ih rô̆ ba boih minh tơnơm hơmu; Ih pơpuh boih lu dêh char na pơtăm tơnơm hơmu noh

English: You prepared room for it, And caused it to take deep root, And it filled the land.
Bahnar: Ih bơ'nguơih teh kơ tơm hơmu. Sư sôr rơh păng chăt hro jơ̆p kơ teh.

English: The hills were covered with its shadow, And the mighty cedars with its boughs.
Bahnar: Yơ̆p sư jơ̆p kơ groi kông păng lu dơng sư hro jơ̆p kơ 'long hơngo Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: She sent out her boughs to the Sea, And her branches to the River.
Bahnar: Lu dơng sư hro truh tơ đak dơsĭ, Păng tơmơ̆ng sư bluh truh tơ đak Krong.

English: Why have You broken down her hedges, So that all who pass by the way pluck her fruit?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ Ih teh tơpăk lê̆ dur sư Achăng lê̆ kơ lu bơngai năm rok noh phĕ tơtông plei hơmu?

English: The boar out of the woods uproots it, And the wild beast of the field devours it.
Bahnar: Lê̆ hơke chưk sa păng lu kon sem bri sa sư

English: Return, we beseech You, O God of hosts; Look down from heaven and see, And visit this vine
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh! Apinh Ih hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng bĕ, đơ̆ng plĕnh nger lăng tơ teh, lăng păng bơwei tơm hơmu âu

English: And the vineyard which Your right hand has planted, And the branch that You made strong for Yourself.
Bahnar: Tơm hơmu mă đơ̆ng ti 'ma Ih pơtăm. Mă kon tơdăm Ih đei rong bơwei kơdih boih

English: It is burned with fire, it is cut down; They perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.
Bahnar: Tơm hơmu noh chơ̆ng lê̆ păng ŭnh đĭ sa. Ăn kơ lu sư hiong răm đĭ yua kơ đơ̆ng Ih chrih hil.

English: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, Upon the son of man whom You made strong for Yourself.
Bahnar: Hơpơi kơ Ih tơgŭm bơngai hơ-oei cheng 'ma Ih. Bơngai drŏ-nglo mă Ih đei bơwei rong kơdih boih.

English: Then we will not turn back from You; Revive us, and we will call upon Your name.
Bahnar: Na lu nhôn pă đei tơklah đơ̆ng Ih dơ̆ng; Apinh Ih ăn kơ lu nhôn arih dơ̆ng. Kơna lu nhôn gô krao apinh hăm anăn Ih.

English: Restore us, O LORD God of hosts; Cause Your face to shine, And we shall be saved!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, apinh Ih tơiung lu nhôn dơ̆ng. Păng pơdah bĕ muh măt Ih wă kơ lu nhôn gơh klaih.

English: Sing aloud to God our strength; Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob.
Bahnar: Hơri chơt hiôk bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ tơdrong pran kơtang lu bơ̆n; Athei ôr chơt hiôk bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp.

English: Raise a song and strike the timbrel, The pleasant harp with the lute.
Bahnar: Pơre bĕ tơ'nguơ̆ hơri păng teh hơgơ̆r iĕ, reh bĕ brŏ dung tơmơ̆t păng tĭng-nĭng.

English: Blow the trumpet at the time of the New Moon, At the full moon, on our solemn feast day.
Bahnar: Hlôm bĕ tơgiĕp kơplah khei tơ'bang kơplah khei pơnil, tơbăt kơ lu năr giĕng tih lu bơ̆n.

English: For this is a statute for Israel, A law of the God of Jacob.
Bahnar: Noh minh tơdrong juăt kơ Isơrael, Minh tơdrong tơtă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp.

English: This He established in Joseph as a testimony, When He went throughout the land of Egypt, Where I heard a language I did not understand.
Bahnar: Sư pơjing tơdrong noh tơ'bôh ăn kơ adrĕch Jôsep. Kơplah Kră Yang blah dêh char Êyiptơ, anih inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r mă-lei ưh kơ hlôh.

English: “I removed his shoulder from the burden; His hands were freed from the baskets.
Bahnar: “Inh hơleh boih tung trăp đơ̆ng hơngiĕng lu iĕm; ti lu iĕm tơplôch boih đơ̆ng chĕp bai.

English: You called in trouble, and I delivered you; I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah
Bahnar: Lăm năr anat anot iĕm krao apinh, Inh dŏng pơklaih iĕm. Inh tơl tơwih kơ iĕm đơ̆ng anih hlơp lăm grơ̆m glaih, Păng pơlong lăng ih 'bơ̆t tu đak Mêri 'ba. Sêla

English: “Hear, O My people, and I will admonish you! O Israel, if you will listen to Me!
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Inh, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh mưh inh tơbăt kơ iĕm. Ơ Isơrael, rŏ kơ iĕm oei mơ̆ng Inh!

English: There shall be no foreign god among you; Nor shall you worship any foreign god.
Bahnar: Lăm lu iĕm, 'nĕ kơ đei yang nai dơ̆ng; Kŭm 'nĕ chă kơkuh kơ yang lu bơngai tơmoi.

English: I am the LORD your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt; Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, Inh Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ. Ha bĕ 'bơ̆r iĕm mă să, Inh gô tah 'bĕnh.

English: “But My people would not heed My voice, And Israel would have none of Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei Inh ưh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh. Isơrael ưh kơ wă chu yom kơ Inh.

English: So I gave them over to their own stubborn heart, To walk in their own counsels.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Inh achăng lê̆ lu sư pơm kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m arăng kơ chu lu sư. Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong lu sư chă đon kơdih.

English: “Oh, that My people would listen to Me, That Israel would walk in My ways!
Bahnar: Ơ! Rŏ kơ lu kon pơlei Inh oei mơ̆ng Inh. Rŏ kơ Isơrael chu yak kiơ̆ trong Inh!

English: I would soon subdue their enemies, And turn My hand against their adversaries.
Bahnar: Lei ưh kơ đunh ôh Inh gô pơrăm lu bơngai ayăt kơ sư. Hiŏng ti Inh pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư.

English: The haters of the LORD would pretend submission to Him, But their fate would endure forever.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă hil areh kơ Kră Yang gô chu yom kơ Sư. Tơdrong chu lui kơ Sư oei oei ling-lang.

English: He would have fed them also with the finest of wheat; And with honey from the rock I would have satisfied you.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô iŏk phe 'ba mi mă 'lơ̆ng hloh 'me rong lu sư. Păng ăn kơ lu sư phĭ jơnap, hăm đak sut bri đơ̆ng lăm tơmo.”

English: God stands in the congregation of the mighty; He judges among the gods.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm khŭl akŭm tơ plĕnh ti. Sư sek tơlang kơ lu yang.

English: How long will you judge unjustly, And show partiality to the wicked? Selah
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm gô sek tơlang ưh kơ tơpăt păng mơ̆t lu bơngai kơnê̆ dĭng dang yơ? Sêla

English: Defend the poor and fatherless; Do justice to the afflicted and needy.
Bahnar: Athei sek mă tơpăt lu bơngai rơdu tơrăn păng mơti mĕ 'bă; Athei sek tơpăt kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat păng lu hoh kơ đei.

English: Deliver the poor and needy; Free them from the hand of the wicked.
Bahnar: Pơklaih bĕ lu bơngai rơdu tơrăn păng lu dơnuh hin pơmat-tat, Pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai kơnê̆.”

English: They do not know, nor do they understand; They walk about in darkness; All the foundations of the earth are unstable.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ băt kiơ, kư̆m ưh kơ hlôh kiơ; Lu sư oei yak tơ âu tơ to lăm măng mu; Jơ̆p anih kơpal teh pă đei tơdrong tơpăt boih.

English: I said, “You are gods, And all of you are children of the Most High.
Bahnar: Inh khan boih: “Lu iĕm jơ̆ yang đĭ-đăng iĕm jing kon Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: But you shall die like men, And fall like one of the princes.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm gô lôch thoi kon bơngai hmă. Lu iĕm gô pơ̆k huŏng thoi lu yŏng pơgơ̆r.”

English: Arise, O God, judge the earth; For You shall inherit all nations.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, iung, sek tơlang bĕ kơ teh đak; Yua kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei tơmam Ih ngăl.

English: Do not keep silent, O God! Do not hold Your peace, And do not be still, O God!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nĕ kơ ngăn, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'nĕ kơ ĕnh 'nĕ kơ dơ̆ng đĕch.

English: For behold, Your enemies make a tumult; And those who hate You have lifted up their head.
Bahnar: Yua kơ to, lu ayăt kơ Ih iung boih, Păng lu bơngai hil areh kơ Ih ngơk kơ̆l boih.

English: They have taken crafty counsel against Your people, And consulted together against Your sheltered ones.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơđâu wă blah kon pơlei Ih, Lu sư chă đon wă pơm kơ lu bơngai mă Ih đei bơwei.

English: They have said, “Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation, That the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm pơlôch pơđĭ adrĕch lu sư đơ̆ng teh đak, Wă kơ pă đei bu 'blŏk kơ anăn Isơrael dơ̆ng.”

English: For they have consulted together with one consent; They form a confederacy against You
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư minh jơhngơ̆m pơđâu băl. Lu sư pơkă băl wă blah Ih

English: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab and the Hagrites
Bahnar: Kơđông lu bơngai Eđôm păng bơngai Ismael, bơngai Môap păng bơngai Hagrit.

English: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre
Bahnar: Gêbal, Ammôn păng Amalek, bơngai Philistin, hăm kon pơlei Tirơ

English: Assyria also has joined with them; They have helped the children of Lot. Selah
Bahnar: Asiri kư̆m mơ̆t lu sư, na tơgŭm kon sâu Lot. Sêla

English: Deal with them as with Midian, As with Sisera, As with Jabin at the Brook Kishon
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ kơ lu sư thoi Ih pơm kơ Madian kơ Sisêra păng Jabin tơ đak krong Kisôn

English: Who perished at En Dor, Who became as refuse on the earth.
Bahnar: Đe pơlôch lu sư tơ Endôr, jing pơm mơ̆r kơ teh.

English: Make their nobles like Oreb and like Zeeb, Yes, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna
Bahnar: Pơm kơ yŏng lu sư thoi Ih pơm kơ Ôrep păng Sêep. Păng đĭ-đăng kơ kon pơtao kră pơgơ̆r lu sư thoi Sêba păng Salmuna

English: Who said, “Let us take for ourselves The pastures of God for a possession.”
Bahnar: Khan: “Bĕ bơ̆n blah iŏk teh tơmăn 'nhĕt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jing tơmam bơ̆n.”

English: O my God, make them like the whirling dust, Like the chaff before the wind!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Pơm bĕ kơ lu sư thoi 'mui teh đông kơ phŭt huơ̆r. Thoi hơkam 'ba kial bơbơ̆t.

English: As the fire burns the woods, And as the flame sets the mountains on fire
Bahnar: Thoi ŭnh sa bri, thoi pla ŭnh sa kông groi, thoi yơ

English: So pursue them with Your tempest, And frighten them with Your storm.
Bahnar: ăn bĕ hơbŭt hơbang Ih druh drŭt lu sư. Păng yua hơbŭt hơbang Ih, pơm kơ lu sư hli krưp thoi noh.

English: Fill their faces with shame, That they may seek Your name, O LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih pơm ăn kơ muh măt lu sư kơdơ̆ mơlâu, wă kơ lu sư krao chă Ih.

English: Let them be confounded and dismayed forever; Yes, let them be put to shame and perish
Bahnar: Pơm kơ lu sư kơdơ̆ mơlâu păng hli tơrơ ling-lang hlŏng hloi; Pơm kơ lu sư mơlâu păng lôch hiong

English: That they may know that You, whose name alone is the LORD, Are the Most High over all the earth.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư băt, lăp minh 'nu Ih đĕch, anăn Kră Yang; Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơgơ̆r kơpal teh âu.

English: How lovely is Your tabernacle, O LORD of hosts!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh. Anih Ih oei trŏ kơ 'mêm dêh hloh

English: My soul longs, yes, even faints For the courts of the LORD; My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
Bahnar: Bơhngol inh 'maih dêh năm tơ cham hnam Kră Yang, Inh ôr krao Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m sĕch akar inh.

English: Even the sparrow has found a home, And the swallow a nest for herself, Where she may lay her young— Even Your altars, O LORD of hosts, My King and my God.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, pơtao inh păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, Sem rĕch chă đei boih anih oei păng sem pleng chă pơm boih tơpu wă kơ cheh kon, jê̆ tơ chơnang soi Ih.

English: Blessed are those who dwell in Your house; They will still be praising You. Selah
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bu mă oei lăm hnam Kră Yang! Lu sư gô kơkuh hơri bơnê kơ ih ling-lang. Sêla

English: Blessed is the man whose strength is in You, Whose heart is set on pilgrimage.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bu mă đei jơhngơ̆m pran lăm Ih, Păng đei jơhngơ̆m 'maih năm truh tơ Siôn!

English: As they pass through the Valley of Baca, They make it a spring; The rain also covers it with pools.
Bahnar: Kơplah năm rok thŭng thong tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi lu sư pơm kơ thong ei jing đei tu đak lĕch ro; 'Mi hrôih kư̆m pơm kơ anih noh đei đak dơnâu 'bĕnh lơ̆p pŭn hiôk.

English: They go from strength to strength; Each one appears before God in Zion.
Bahnar: Lu sư yak năm tơ anăp lu sư rai pran kơtang dêh, Dĭng truh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Siôn.

English: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; Give ear, O God of Jacob! Selah
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, apinh Ih mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh krao khan; Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp, pơgling đon Ih mơ̆ng inh. Sêla

English: O God, behold our shield, And look upon the face of Your anointed.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih jơ̆ khêl pĕng lu nhôn, Lăng mơnat bĕ kơ tơ'ngla mă Ih đei hling đak rơmă pôk pơm pơtao.

English: For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God Than dwell in the tents of wickedness.
Bahnar: Minh năr lăm cham hnam akŭm Ih gĭt hloh kơ minh-rơbâu năr tơ anih nai. Lê̆ inh jing bơngai wei 'măng dur lăm hnam Ih, Hloh kơ oei lăm hnam lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: For the LORD God is a sun and shield; The LORD will give grace and glory; No good thing will He withhold From those who walk uprightly.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆ măt 'năr păng khêl; Kră Yang ăn tơdrong mơnat păng ư-ang, Sư ưh kơ đei sơngah ôh ăn tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Kơ bu mă oei arih sa tơpăt.

English: O LORD of hosts, Blessed is the man who trusts in You!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, pŭn dêh kơ bơngai bu mă gơnang kơ Ih!

English: LORD, You have been favorable to Your land; You have brought back the captivity of Jacob.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih mơnat ăn boih tơdrong 'lơ̆ng kơ dêh char Ih; Ih chông adrĕch Jakôp đêl pơm bơnă wih brŏk.

English: You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; You have covered all their sin. Selah
Bahnar: Ih mơnat ăn boih kon pơlei Ih, đêl pơm kơnê̆. Păng klơ̆p lê̆ đĭ dôm yoch glăi lu sư. Sêla

English: You have taken away all Your wrath; You have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.
Bahnar: Ih lê̆ boih tơdrong hil mĭl, iŏk lê̆ boih tơdrong Ih blĕk tơtŏ.

English: Restore us, O God of our salvation, And cause Your anger toward us to cease.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn, apinh Ih tơiung lu nhôn dơ̆ng bĕ. Apinh Ih lê̆ pă blĕk kơ lu nhôn.

English: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You prolong Your anger to all generations?
Bahnar: Ih oei wă hil kơ lu nhôn ling-lang aah? Tơdrong blĕk Ih oei khŏm khŏm hă?

English: Will You not revive us again, That Your people may rejoice in You?
Bahnar: Ih ưh pă tơiung lu nhôn dơ̆ng boih hă? Wă kơ kon pơlei Ih chơt hiôk lăm Ih?

English: Show us Your mercy, LORD, And grant us Your salvation.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh ăn kơ lu nhôn 'bôh tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat, Păng ăn kơ lu nhôn tơdrong Ih dŏng pơklaih.

English: I will hear what God the LORD will speak, For He will speak peace To His people and to His saints; But let them not turn back to folly.
Bahnar: Inh gô mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan; Sư gô ăn hiôk-hian kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư păng ăn kơ lu bơngai lui yom kơ Sư, Mă-lei 'nĕ pă lê̆ lu sư hơlơ̆k pơm kơtul kơwao dơ̆ng

English: Surely His salvation is near to those who fear Him, That glory may dwell in our land.
Bahnar: Tơpă tơdrong sư dŏng pơklaih oei jê̆ tơ lu đe bu mă hli yom kơ sư. Wă kơ tơdrong ư-ang đei oei lăm char bơ̆n.

English: Mercy and truth have met together; Righteousness and peace have kissed.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong 'mêm mơnat hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt tơ'bơ̆p băl; Tơdrong tơpăt hăm tơdrong hiôk-hian tơchŭm băl.

English: Truth shall spring out of the earth, And righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpăt bluh đơ̆ng teh đak. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Kră Yang bơngai đơ̆ng plĕnh nger tơ ala teh.

English: Yes, the LORD will give what is good; And our land will yield its increase.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă, Kră Yang gô ăn pŭn hiôk, Păng teh bơ̆n gô đei plei sa.

English: Righteousness will go before Him, And shall make His footsteps our pathway.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpăt 'lơ̆ng gô năm adrol 'bơ̆t anăp Sư, gô pơm ăn trong kơ jơ̆ng Sư rok.

English: Bow down Your ear, O LORD, hear me; For I am poor and needy.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng păng tơl tơwih kơ inh, Yua kơ inh pơmat-tat păng dơnuh hin.

English: Preserve my life, for I am holy; You are my God; Save Your servant who trusts in You!
Bahnar: Apinh Ih wei-lăng bơhngol inh, yua kơ inh tơnăp; Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Apinh dŏng pơklaih đĭch đam Ih mă oei gơnang kơ Ih.

English: Be merciful to me, O Lord, For I cry to You all day long.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh, yua kơ prăt năr inh krao apinh Ih.

English: Rejoice the soul of Your servant, For to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
Bahnar: Apinh ăn bĕ kơ bơhngol lu đĭch đam Ih chơt hiôk. Yua kơ, ơ Kră Yang, bơhngol inh gơnang hơmĕng kơ Ih.

English: For You, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive, And abundant in mercy to all those who call upon You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt băt mơnat ăn. Ih 'bĕnh kơ 'mêm mơnat rơkah rơkai kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă krao chă Ih.

English: Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer; And attend to the voice of my supplications.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, pơgling đon Ih mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r inh krao khan. Mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh ôr krao apinh.

English: In the day of my trouble I will call upon You, For You will answer me.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơmat-tat inh gô krao chă Ih; na Ih gô tơl tơwih; nơ̆r inh.

English: Among the gods there is none like You, O Lord; Nor are there any works like Your works.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, lăm lu yang ưh kơ đei bu thoi Ih; Dôm tơdrong jang lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei thoi tơdrong jang Ih.

English: All nations whom You have made Shall come and worship before You, O Lord, And shall glorify Your name.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu teh đak mă Ih pơjing, gô năm kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, ơ Kră Yang Păng hơri ư-ang kơ anăn Ih.

English: For You are great, and do wondrous things; You alone are God.
Bahnar: Ih Kră Yang mơsêh, pơm tôm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp; Lăp minh 'nu Ih đĕch Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Teach me Your way, O LORD; I will walk in Your truth; Unite my heart to fear Your name.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih bơtho tơ'bôh kơ inh trong Ih. Na inh gô yak kiơ̆ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih; Apinh Ih ăn kơ inh đei jơhngơ̆m băt hli yom kơ Ih

English: I will praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And I will glorify Your name forevermore.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh. Inh kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m. Inh gô ư-ang anăn Ih ling-lang.

English: For great is Your mercy toward me, And You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong Ih 'mêm kơ inh tih tơpă. Ih dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng jrŭ lăm dêh atâu.

English: O God, the proud have risen against me, And a mob of violent men have sought my life, And have not set You before them.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai pơang iung pơrăm inh. Khŭl bơngai kơnê̆ chă wă pơlôch inh, Lu sư ưh pă lăng Ih boih.

English: But You, O Lord, are a God full of compassion, and gracious, Longsuffering and abundant in mercy and truth.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ Kră Yang! Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă 'mêm băt mơnat. Hiơ̆ kơ hil, 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong 'mêm păng tơdrong tơpăt sĭt.

English: Oh, turn to me, and have mercy on me! Give Your strength to Your servant, And save the son of Your maidservant.
Bahnar: Ôi! Apinh Kră Yang lăng inh păng mơnat kơ inh. Apinh Ih ăn tơdrong pran kơtang kơ lu đĭch đam Ih. Apinh pơklaih kon drŏ-nglo đam drŏ-kăn Ih.

English: Show me a sign for good, That those who hate me may see it and be ashamed, Because You, LORD, have helped me and comforted me.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih tơ'bôh ăn tơdra tơdrong Ih mơnat kơ inh, wă kơ lu bơngai areh kơ inh gơh 'bôh păng mơlâu, ơ Kră Yang! Ih boih mă tơgŭm păng pơlung inh.

English: His foundation is in the holy mountains.
Bahnar: Sư man boih hơnă tơ kơpal kông 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: The LORD loves the gates of Zion More than all the dwellings of Jacob.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'mêm kơ lu 'măng jang pơlei Siôn, Hloh kơ lu anih nai mă adrĕch Jakôp oei

English: Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of God! Selah
Bahnar: Ơ pơlei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, đe roi boih tơdrong ư-ang kơ ih. Sêla

English: “I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to those who know Me; Behold, O Philistia and Tyre, with Ethiopia: ‘This one was born there.’ ”
Bahnar: “Inh gô roi gah Êyiptơ păng Babilôn lu bơngai char mă băt kơ inh. To Philistin, Tirơ păng Êthiôpi; Lu bơngai âu tơpŭ tơ Siôn.”

English: And of Zion it will be said, “This one and that one were born in her; And the Most High Himself shall establish her.”
Bahnar: Đe gô roi gah Siôn thoi âu: “Lu đe âu đe noh tơpŭ boih Siôn noh; Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô pơm kơ Siôn kơjăp.”

English: The LORD will record, When He registers the peoples: “This one was born there.” Selah
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô chih anăn lu kon pơlei lăm sơ̆p hla bơar na Sư gô jô̆: “Âu đe tơpŭ kơ sư tơ Siôn.” Sêla

English: Both the singers and the players on instruments say, “All my springs are in you.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hat hơri păng lu đe suang gô khan thoi âu: “Đĭ-đăng tơm tơdrong arih inh oei lăm Ih.”

English: O LORD, God of my salvation, I have cried out day and night before You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei, Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh măng năr inh krao ôr 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: Let my prayer come before You; Incline Your ear to my cry.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ nơ̆r inh krao khan truh tơ Ih. Apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh krao apinh.

English: For my soul is full of troubles, And my life draws near to the grave.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơhngol inh 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong pơmat. Tơdrong arih inh năm wă jê̆ dêh atâu.

English: I am counted with those who go down to the pit; I am like a man who has no strength
Bahnar: Đe đĭ jô̆ inh hăm khŭl jur lăm sơlŭng lôch; Inh thoi bơngai mă ưh kơ đei jơhngơ̆m pran

English: Adrift among the dead, Like the slain who lie in the grave, Whom You remember no more, And who are cut off from Your hand.
Bahnar: Đe lê̆ inh hăm lu bơngai lôch, thoi bơngai mă đe pơlôch tơ'bĭch lăm bơsat. Thoi bơngai mă Ih ưh pă 'blŏk boih, thoi lu bơngai mă ti Ih pă bơwei.

English: You have laid me in the lowest pit, In darkness, in the depths.
Bahnar: Ih 'măn boih inh tơ kơđĕl sơlŭng jrŭ. Tơ anih măng mu gueo lăm sơlŭng jrŭ hơnhuey.

English: Your wrath lies heavy upon me, And You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah
Bahnar: Tơdrong Ih hil trăp kơtĭt kơpal inh, Ih yua lu đak poh-yă pơmat inh. Sêla

English: You have put away my acquaintances far from me; You have made me an abomination to them; I am shut up, and I cannot get out
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơ lu buăl inh weh achăng lê̆ inh. Ih pơm kơ inh jing minh 'nu bơngai lu sư areh. Đe chĭt lê̆ inh, pă gơh lĕch dơ̆ng

English: My eye wastes away because of affliction. LORD, I have called daily upon You; I have stretched out my hands to You.
Bahnar: Măt inh đĭ hrŏ, yua kơ ơh sơ'ngon pơmat. Ơ Kră Yang, rim năr inh krao apinh Ih, Inh yơ̆r ti apinh Ih.

English: Will You work wonders for the dead? Shall the dead arise and praise You? Selah
Bahnar: Ih wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh kơ lu bơngai lôch hă? Lu bơngai mă lôch gô iung arih na kơkuh bơnê kơ Ih hă? Sêla

English: Shall Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave? Or Your faithfulness in the place of destruction?
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'mêm Ih, đe gô ră roi tơ lăm bơsat hă? Tơdrong tơpăt Ih đe gô bơtho tơ lăm anih lôch răm mơ̆n hă?

English: Shall Your wonders be known in the dark? And Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơsêh Ih gô tơbăt tơ anih măng mu mơ̆n hă? Păng hăm trŏ tơdrong tơpăt Ih gô tơ'bôh tơ lăm dêh mă đĭ pă 'blŏk?

English: But to You I have cried out, O LORD, And in the morning my prayer comes before You.
Bahnar: Gah inh ơ Kră Yang! Inh krao apinh Ih Lăp 'brưch pơgê hrôih nơ̆r inh apinh truh boih 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: LORD, why do You cast off my soul? Why do You hide Your face from me?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Yua kơ kiơ Ih achăng lê̆ bơhngol inh păng liơ ôn muh măt Ih kơ Inh?

English: I have been afflicted and ready to die from my youth; I suffer Your terrors; I am distraught.
Bahnar: Inh pơmat-tat wă lôch iŏk đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p. Inh hli krưp păng tơrơ dêh.

English: Your fierce wrath has gone over me; Your terrors have cut me off.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Ih hil dêh 'bơm tơ inh. Tơdrong Ih tơhli pơlôch pơrăm inh.

English: They came around me all day long like water; They engulfed me altogether.
Bahnar: Prăt năr dôm tơdrong noh wang tăp kơ inh thoi đak lơ̆p. Lu sư wang klơ̆p tăp dăr kơ inh

English: Loved one and friend You have put far from me, And my acquaintances into darkness.
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơ lu buăl juăt bơngai inh 'mêm weh achăng lê̆ inh. Anih măng mu pơm buăl juăt jê̆ inh anih măng mu.

English: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD forever; With my mouth will I make known Your faithfulness to all generations.
Bahnar: Inh gô hơri bơnê kơ tơdrong 'mêm tih Kră Yang ling-lang; 'Bơ̆r inh gô ră roi tơdrong tơpăt Ih lăm đĭ jơhnơr.

English: For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up forever; Your faithfulness You shall establish in the very heavens.”
Bahnar: Inh gô khan: “Tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Ih oei oei ling-lang hlŏng hloi. Tơdrong tơpăt ih pơjing kơjăp thoi kơ plĕnh ti.”

English: “I have made a covenant with My chosen, I have sworn to My servant David
Bahnar: Ih khan: “Inh pơjing boih nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hăm lu bơngai mă Inh đei rơih. Inh đei pơkă hăm Đawit, đĭch đam Inh

English: ‘Your seed I will establish forever, And build up your throne to all generations.’ ” Selah
Bahnar: ‘Inh gô tơiung adrĕch adrung ih kơjăp ling-lang hlŏng hloi, Păng ăn tang-dŏ pơtao kơjăp ling-lang hloi.’ ” Sêla

English: And the heavens will praise Your wonders, O LORD; Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the saints.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, jơ̆p kơ plĕnh, gô kơkuh bơnê kơ tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Ih. Tơdrong tơpăt Ih đe kư̆m gô kơkuh bơnê. Tơ lăm khŭl 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: For who in the heavens can be compared to the LORD? Who among the sons of the mighty can be likened to the LORD?
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơ plĕnh, hăm đei bu gơh pơtŏ hăm Kră Yang? Hăm đei bu lăm lu yang nhen thoi Kră Yang.

English: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, And to be held in reverence by all those around Him.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei trŏ kơ hli yom tơpă lăm khŭl Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Trŏ kơ hli krưp hloh kơ lu Yang tăp dăr kơ Sư.

English: O LORD God of hosts, Who is mighty like You, O LORD? Your faithfulness also surrounds You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, bu mơsêh thoi Ih? Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih oei tăp dăr kơ Ih.

English: You rule the raging of the sea; When its waves rise, You still them.
Bahnar: Ih boih pơgơ̆r đĭ đak dơsĭ, tơdrŏ poh-yă. Mưh sư poh-yă Ih khă sư thĕng hơđơ̆ng.

English: You have broken Rahab in pieces, as one who is slain; You have scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.
Bahnar: Kră Yang teh pơjuă Rahap.a Thoi akâu bơngai lôch. Ih yua kơkŏng ti pran Ih teh tơklah lu ayăt kơ Ih.

English: The heavens are Yours, the earth also is Yours; The world and all its fullness, You have founded them.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ plĕnh hăm teh đak jơ̆ tơmam Ih, Ih đei pơjing teh đak păng dôm tơmam kơpal teh.

English: The north and the south, You have created them; Tabor and Hermon rejoice in Your name.
Bahnar: Ih pơjing boih yă-nơ̆m păng gơal Kông Ta'bor păng Hermôn hơri chơt hiôk kơ anăn Ih.

English: You have a mighty arm; Strong is Your hand, and high is Your right hand.
Bahnar: Ih đei kơkŏng ti mơsêh mơyang Tơpang ti Ih pran kơtang Ti 'ma Ih yơ̆r kơjung.

English: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne; Mercy and truth go before Your face.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng jing hơnă tăng dŏ pơtao Ih. Tơdrong 'mêm, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt năm 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: Blessed are the people who know the joyful sound! They walk, O LORD, in the light of Your countenance.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ kon pơlei ayơ mă băt đei nơ̆r chơt hiôk hơri bơnê kơ Ih, Ơ Kră Yang, lu sư yak lăm hơdah đơ̆ng anăp muh măt Ih

English: In Your name they rejoice all day long, And in Your righteousness they are exalted.
Bahnar: Prăt năr lu sư chơt hiôk lăm anăn Ih, lu sư đe pơyom đơ̆ng tơdrong tơpăt Ih.

English: For You are the glory of their strength, And in Your favor our horn is exalted.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih jơ̆ tơdrong ư-ang pran kơtang lu sư; Đơ̆ng Ih mơnat na hơke lu nhôn tưk kơjung.b

English: For our shield belongs to the LORD, And our king to the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Ih jơ̆ khêl pĕng lu nhôn. Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Isơrael jơ̆ pơtao lu nhôn.

English: Then You spoke in a vision to Your holy one, And said: “I have given help to one who is mighty; I have exalted one chosen from the people.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ lăm tơdrong tơ'bôh, Ih đei pơma hăm lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih. Na khan: “Inh tơgŭm ăn boih kơ bơngai pran kơtang Inh hơtŏk bơngai mă đei rơih iŏk boih đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei

English: I have found My servant David; With My holy oil I have anointed him
Bahnar: Inh chă 'bôh boih Đawit, đĭch đam Inh, Tuh boih kơ sư đak rơmă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh.

English: With whom My hand shall be established; Also My arm shall strengthen him.
Bahnar: Ti Inh gô dŏng tơiung sư. Kơkŏng ti Inh gô pơm ăn kơ sư pran kơtang.

English: The enemy shall not outwit him, Nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
Bahnar: Lu ayăt pă kĕ pơjuă sư boih, Lu bơngai kơnê̆ kư̆m pă đei pơjuă pơđep sư dơ̆ng

English: I will beat down his foes before his face, And plague those who hate him.
Bahnar: Inh gô blah tơhuŏng lu ayăt kơ sư 'bơ̆t anăp sư. Păng kư̆m teh pơrăm lu bơngai hil areh kơ sư.

English: “But My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with him, And in My name his horn shall be exalted.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpăt Inh păng tơdrong 'mêm Inh gô oei hơdai hăm sư. Đơ̆ng anăn Inh, hơke sư gô rai tŏk kơjung.c

English: Also I will set his hand over the sea, And his right hand over the rivers.
Bahnar: Inh gô dan ti sư tơ kơpal đak dơsĭ, Păng ti 'ma sư tơ kơpal đak krong.

English: He shall cry to Me, ‘You are my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation.’
Bahnar: Sư gô krao Inh: Ih boih 'Bă Inh. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh păng Tơmo Tih tơdrong dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: Also I will make him My firstborn, The highest of the kings of the earth.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ sư jing kon kơdră drŏ-nglo Inh, jing pơtao tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng pơtao lăm teh âu.

English: My mercy I will keep for him forever, And My covenant shall stand firm with him.
Bahnar: Inh gô 'măn lê̆ kơ sư tơdrong 'mêm inh ling-lang, Inh gô pơgơ̆p hăm sư kơjăp.

English: His seed also I will make to endure forever, And his throne as the days of heaven.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ adrĕch adrung sư kơjăp ling-lang. Păng tang-dŏ pơtao sư oei sot jơnoi thoi năr tơ plĕnh.

English: “If his sons forsake My law And do not walk in My judgments
Bahnar: Tơdah kon sâu sư achăng lê̆ tơdrong juăt Inh, ưh kơ kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă.

English: If they break My statutes And do not keep My commandments
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Inh, ưh kơ wei nơ̆r Inh tơtă

English: Then I will punish their transgression with the rod, And their iniquity with stripes.
Bahnar: Na Inh gô yua sơnguĕt teh bơtho tơdrong lu sư pơm glăi. Păng teh bơtho lu sư yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư.

English: Nevertheless My lovingkindness I will not utterly take from him, Nor allow My faithfulness to fail.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh ưh kơ đei lê̆ ôh tơdrong 'mêm kơ lu sư. Păng inh kư̆m ưh kơ lê̆ mơ̆n pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm sư.

English: My covenant I will not break, Nor alter the word that has gone out of My lips.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m ưh kơ layơ pơm yoch kơ nơ̆r Inh pơgơ̆p. Kŭm ưh kơ đei tơplih nơ̆r mă lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh đei pơma.

English: Once I have sworn by My holiness; I will not lie to David
Bahnar: Inh yua anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh na pơkă pơkăm minh wơ̆t đĕch keh boih. Păng ưh kơ đei pơma hơlĕnh hăm Đawit

English: His seed shall endure forever, And his throne as the sun before Me
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung sư oei oei ling-lang, Tang-dŏ pơtao sư gô sot thoi măt 'năr 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: It shall be established forever like the moon, Even like the faithful witness in the sky.” Selah
Bahnar: Sư gô kơjăp ling-lang thoi măt khei. Thoi đei tơ'bôh sĭt tơ kơpal plĕnh noh.” Sêla

English: But You have cast off and abhorred, You have been furious with Your anointed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih sơngah păng achăng lê̆ sư. Ih hil mĭl bơngai mă Ih đei hling đak rơmă.

English: You have renounced the covenant of Your servant; You have profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
Bahnar: Ih lăng krưp dêh boih kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu đĭch đam Ih. Ih hŭt lê̆ boih môk pơtao tơ teh rơpŭk 'mê̆-'mach.

English: You have broken down all his hedges; You have brought his strongholds to ruin.
Bahnar: Ih teh tơlơ̆ lê̆ boih dur sư, pơrăm lê̆ kơđông kơjăp sư pơchah đĭ.

English: All who pass by the way plunder him; He is a reproach to his neighbors.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ lu bơngai yak rok noh tơgar iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng sư. Sư jing bơngai rông 'bôt pơjăm.

English: You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries; You have made all his enemies rejoice.
Bahnar: Ih tưk ti 'ma lu ayăt kơ sư. Ih pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ sư hiôk chơt.

English: You have also turned back the edge of his sword, And have not sustained him in the battle.
Bahnar: Tơpă Ih plơ̆ lê̆ pla đao sư, Ưh kơ đei tơgŭm sư wă kơ kĕ dơ̆ng tơblah

English: You have made his glory cease, And cast his throne down to the ground.
Bahnar: Ih tơhiong lê̆ 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư tơhuŏng lê̆ tang-dŏ pơtao sư tơ teh

English: The days of his youth You have shortened; You have covered him with shame. Selah
Bahnar: Pơm kơ sơnăm hơmuh hơmŏng sư jing djăl. Păng gom lê̆ sư hăm tơdrong mơlâu. Sêla

English: How long, LORD? Will You hide Yourself forever? Will Your wrath burn like fire?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih ôn akâu Ih dĭng truh dang yơ? Wă khŏm khŏm hloi hă? Tơdrong Ih hil mĭl thoi ŭnh sa dĭng dang yơ?

English: Remember how short my time is; For what futility have You created all the children of men?
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'blŏk kơ măng năr inh kơđeh dêh. Ih pơjing boih kon bơngai tơdrong kơ đei.

English: What man can live and not see death? Can he deliver his life from the power of the grave? Selah
Bahnar: Bu gơh arih hloi mă ưh kơ đei lôch? Bu gơh dŏng pơklaih bơhngol sư kơdih dơ̆ng dêh atâu pơgơ̆r.

English: Lord, where are Your former lovingkindnesses, Which You swore to David in Your truth?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơ yơ tơdrong 'mêm tih Ih, tơ yơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih mă đei pơkă pơkăm hăm Đawit sơ̆?

English: Remember, Lord, the reproach of Your servants— How I bear in my bosom the reproach of all the many peoples
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! 'Blŏk bĕ kơ tơdrong mơlâu đe pơjăm lu đĭch đam Ih pŭ, jơhngơ̆m inh pŭ đĭ tơdrong mơlâu đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei

English: With which Your enemies have reproached, O LORD, With which they have reproached the footsteps of Your anointed.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơdrong mă lu ayăt kơ Ih pơjăm. Lu sư pơjăm boih kơnao yak lu bơngai mă Ih đei hling đak 'bâu phu tơ kơ̆l.

English: Blessed be the LORD forevermore! Amen and Amen.
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang ling-lang! A-men! A-men!

English: Lord, You have been our dwelling place in all generations.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih jơ̆ anih lu nhôn oei.a Lăm đĭ jơhnơr.

English: Before the mountains were brought forth, Or ever You had formed the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, You are God.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ kông đak tam mă đei, teh hăm dêh char tam mă jing. Adrol kơ 'măng blŭng truh tơ ning-mônh Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: You turn man to destruction, And say, “Return, O children of men.”
Bahnar: Ih ăn kơ kon bơngai wih brŏk tơ 'mui teh, Ih khan: “Ơ kon bơngai, brŏk bĕ tơ 'mui teh.”

English: For a thousand years in Your sight Are like yesterday when it is past, And like a watch in the night.
Bahnar: Yua kơ minh-rơbâu sơnăm 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, thoi minh năr brei mă hloh boih, thoi minh măng kral.

English: You carry them away like a flood; They are like a sleep. In the morning they are like grass which grows up
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơ lu sư hoch kiơ̆ đak lơ̆p ro. Thoi kơ tep lôch. Lu sư thoi hla 'nhĕt chăt hơdrih pơgê hrôih.

English: In the morning it flourishes and grows up; In the evening it is cut down and withers.
Bahnar: Pơgê hrôih chăt bluh 'lơ̆ng. Kơsơ̆ sư jô kro.

English: For we have been consumed by Your anger, And by Your wrath we are terrified.
Bahnar: Tơpă, lu nhôn lôch răm yua kơ tơdrong Ih hil mĭl. Lu nhôn hli tơrơ yua kơ Ih hil mĭl.

English: You have set our iniquities before You, Our secret sins in the light of Your countenance.
Bahnar: Ih dan boih tơdrong kơnê̆ lu nhôn 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, păng pơdah dôm tơdrong yoch hlơp lu nhôn. Lăm hơdah 'bơ̆t anăp Ih

English: For all our days have passed away in Your wrath; We finish our years like a sigh.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng ih hil, na măng năr lu nhôn hiong tôch đĭ. Sơnăm lu nhôn arih tôch thoi nơ̆r tơhôih dui jơhngơ̆m.

English: The days of our lives are seventy years; And if by reason of strength they are eighty years, Yet their boast is only labor and sorrow; For it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
Bahnar: Sơnăm lu nhôn arih kư̆m lăp truh tơpơh-jĭt. Dah đei pran 'biơ̆ truh tơ tơhngam-jĭt. Mă-lei tơdrong pơang lu sư, jơ̆ lăp pơmat-tat păng ơh sơ'ngon. Yua kơ tơdrong arih lu nhôn 'bônh kơ tôch, đơ̆ng noh lu nhôn păr hiong.

English: Who knows the power of Your anger? For as the fear of You, so is Your wrath.
Bahnar: Bu băt tơdrong kơtang mă Kră Yang hil? Bu kĕ băt tơdrong Ih hil mĭl, sư gô jing thoi yơ?

English: So teach us to number our days, That we may gain a heart of wisdom.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih bơtho lu nhôn băt kơ jô̆ khei năr lu nhôn arih. Wă kơ lu nhôn đei jơhngơ̆m đon hơgei

English: Return, O LORD! How long? And have compassion on Your servants.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng. Ih wă hil dĭng dang yơ? Tơplih jơhngơ̆m Ih mơnat kơ đĭch đam Ih

English: Oh, satisfy us early with Your mercy, That we may rejoice and be glad all our days!
Bahnar: Ơ! Apinh Ih ăn kơ lu nhôn rim pơgê hrăp jơhngơ̆m kơ tơdrong Ih 'mêm. Wă kơ đĭ lăm chăl arih lu nhôn chơt hiôk hơri bơnê.

English: Make us glad according to the days in which You have afflicted us, The years in which we have seen evil.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih ăn kơ lu nhôn đei jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk hơtŏ hơnơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ năr mă Ih đei ăn kơ nhôn pơmat, Păng hơtŏ hơnơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ sơnăm mă lu nhôn đei tơdrong hơnat hơnot

English: Let Your work appear to Your servants, And Your glory to their children.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu đĭch đam Ih tơdrong jang Ih. Păng tơdrong mơsêh ư-ang Ih pơchrang tơ kon sâu lu sư.

English: And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us, And establish the work of our hands for us; Yes, establish the work of our hands.
Bahnar: Apinh tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, oei hơdai lu nhôn; Apinh Ih pơm ăn mă kơjăp dôm tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti lu nhôn. Tơpă, apinh Ih pơm ăn mă kơjăp tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti lu nhôn pơm.

English: He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei lăm anih hlơp Kră Yang mă Tih Hloh. Gô oei lăm yơ̆p Tơ'ngla mơsêh mơyang.

English: I will say of the LORD, “He is my refuge and my fortress; My God, in Him I will trust.”
Bahnar: Inh gô khan gah Kră Yang: “Sư boih anih mă inh kơ'nơp păng kơđông kơjăp mă inh hơđơ̆ng. Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă inh gơnang.”

English: Surely He shall deliver you from the snare of the fowler And from the perilous pestilence.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơklaih ih đơ̆ng hơđong kap sem. Păng đơ̆ng lôch hơbuh.

English: He shall cover you with His feathers, And under His wings you shall take refuge; His truth shall be your shield and buckler.
Bahnar: Sư gô pĕng bơwei ih hăm sŏk pơnăr sư. Ih gô kơ'nơp tơ ala pơnăr sư. Tơdrong tơpăt Sư jing khêl păng kơđông kơjăp pĕng ih.

English: You shall not be afraid of the terror by night, Nor of the arrow that flies by day
Bahnar: Ih pă đei hli boih mă tơdrong hli krưp kơmăng, mă 'brơ̆m păr kơ'năr

English: Nor of the pestilence that walks in darkness, Nor of the destruction that lays waste at noonday.
Bahnar: Kŭm huay kơ hli tơdrong jĭ hơbuh truh lăm măng mu. Dah tơdrong đe pơlôch pơrăm kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: A thousand may fall at your side, And ten thousand at your right hand; But it shall not come near you.
Bahnar: Gô đei rơbâu bơngai pơ̆k cheng ih păng hơngan bơngai pơ̆k lôch gah 'ma ih. Mă-lei tơdrong răm noh huay kơ truh tơ ih.

English: Only with your eyes shall you look, And see the reward of the wicked.
Bahnar: Ih lăp lăng 'bôh hăm măt đĕch. Păng gô 'bôh tơdrong pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Because you have made the LORD, who is my refuge, Even the Most High, your dwelling place
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang yua kơ Ih jing anih inh kơ'nơp. Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh Ih pơjing boih anih oei

English: No evil shall befall you, Nor shall any plague come near your dwelling
Bahnar: Thoi noh ưh kơ đei tơdrong răm kiơ mă truh kơ ih. Kŭm ưh kơ đei jĭ hơbuh kiơ mă truh tơ bơsŭn ih.

English: For He shall give His angels charge over you, To keep you in all your ways.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư gô ăn linh jang Sư, wei-lăng rim trong ih năm.

English: In their hands they shall bear you up, Lest you dash your foot against a stone.
Bahnar: Linh jang gô pôk ih lăm ti lu sư. Hli kơ jơ̆ng ih kơtơih 'bơm tơmo

English: You shall tread upon the lion and the cobra, The young lion and the serpent you shall trample underfoot.
Bahnar: Ih gô yak juă kơpal kơ̆l 'bih dong păng dăm-brang; Gah dăm-brang păng 'bih choh lôch ih juă bơhlơ̆r lê̆ tơ ala jơ̆ng.

English: “Because he has set his love upon Me, therefore I will deliver him; I will set him on high, because he has known My name.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ ih 'mêm kơ Inh na Inh gô dŏng pơklaih ih; Yua kơ ih băt anăn Inh. Na Inh gô wei-lăng ih

English: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him and honor him.
Bahnar: Sư gô krao khan apinh Inh, Inh gô tơl tơwih kơ sư; Lăm năr pơmat-tat, Inh oei hơdai sư, dŏng pơklaih sư păng pôk pơư kơ sư.

English: With long life I will satisfy him, And show him My salvation.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ sư arih sot păng chơt hiôk păng gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ sư tơdrong Inh dŏng pơklaih.”

English: It is good to give thanks to the LORD, And to sing praises to Your name, O Most High
Bahnar: 'Lơ̆ng dêh tơdrong kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang, Păng hơri ư-ang kơ anăn Ih. Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: To declare Your lovingkindness in the morning, And Your faithfulness every night
Bahnar: Pơgê hrôih ră roi tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat, Kơmăng ră roi tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih.

English: On an instrument of ten strings, On the lute, And on the harp, With harmonious sound.
Bahnar: Lăm Brŏ mơjĭt dăng tơlei păng tĭng-nĭng. Reh tơmơ̆t hăm brŏ dung.

English: For You, LORD, have made me glad through Your work; I will triumph in the works of Your hands.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih pơhiôk ăn kơ inh boih lăm tơdrong jang Ih; Inh gô hơri hiôk chơt kơ tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti Ih pơm.

English: O LORD, how great are Your works! Your thoughts are very deep.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơdrong jang Ih tih tơpă. Tơdrong tơchĕng Ih jrŭ dêh.

English: A senseless man does not know, Nor does a fool understand this.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơwao ưh kơ gơh băt, lu bơngai kơtul kư̆m ưh kơ gơh hlôh

English: When the wicked spring up like grass, And when all the workers of iniquity flourish, It is that they may be destroyed forever.
Bahnar: Mă khan lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ chăt hrôh thoi 'nhĕt, Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ iung mơdrŏng, noh 'măn lê̆ kơ lu sư wă hiong răm ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: But You, LORD, are on high forevermore.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ Kră Yang! Ih boih mă nhôn pơư ling-lang.

English: For behold, Your enemies, O LORD, For behold, Your enemies shall perish; All the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
Bahnar: Yua kơ, ơ Kră Yang, to lu ayăt kơ Ih. Tơpă, lu ayăt kơ Ih gô hiong răm; Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô tơklah tơklang.

English: But my horn You have exalted like a wild ox; I have been anointed with fresh oil.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih ăn kơ hơke inh rai kơjung thoi rơmo bri. Ih tuh boih kơ inh hăm đak pơgang 'bâu phu 'nao.

English: My eye also has seen my desire on my enemies; My ears hear my desire on the wicked Who rise up against me.
Bahnar: Măt inh 'bôh boih lu ayăt kơ inh hiong răm. Păng đon inh kơtơ̆ng boih lu ayăt kơ inh đĭ rŭng răng nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơpăt gô bluh thoi 'long gol păng gô rai kơjung thoi 'long hơngo tơ char Liban.

English: Those who are planted in the house of the LORD Shall flourish in the courts of our God.
Bahnar: Đe pơtăm lu sư lăm hnam Kră Yang. Wơ̆ tih tơ lăm cham Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: They shall still bear fruit in old age; They shall be fresh and flourishing
Bahnar: Mă khan truh tơ kră, lu sư oei đei pơkao plei. Sư jing păng hơdrih ling-lang

English: To declare that the LORD is upright; He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.
Bahnar: Wă tơ'bôh kơ Kră Yang tơpăt; Sư jơ̆ tơmo pĕng inh lăm Sư ưh kơ đei đŏng đĕo.

English: The LORD reigns, He is clothed with majesty; The LORD is clothed, He has girded Himself with strength. Surely the world is established, so that it cannot be moved.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơgơ̆r; Sư hrŭk ư-ang rang mơnhal. Kră Yang hrŭk tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal păng tơ̆n tơdrong pran kơtang, tơpă pơjing teh đak kơjăp, ưh kơ đei pơpơ̆.

English: Your throne is established from of old; You are from everlasting.
Bahnar: Tang-dŏ pơtao Sư pơjing kơjăp đơ̆ng sơ̆. Sư đei adrol hloh kơ 'măng blŭng

English: The floods have lifted up, O LORD, The floods have lifted up their voice; The floods lift up their waves.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, đak dơsĭ tŏk kơjung. Đak dơsĭ jơwa re dêh; Đak dơsĭ poh-yă tŏk kơjung jơwa grơ̆m grăm.

English: The LORD on high is mightier Than the noise of many waters, Than the mighty waves of the sea.
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei pơgơ̆r tơ kơpal đei tơdrong mơsêh. Mơsêh hloh kơ jơwa đak dơsĭ. Mơsêh hloh kơ lu jơwa đak dơsĭ poh-yă.

English: Your testimonies are very sure; Holiness adorns Your house, O LORD, forever.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, dôm tơdrong Ih tơtă kơjăp sĭt; Hnam Ih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tơpă truh tơ ning-mônh hloi.

English: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongs— O God, to whom vengeance belongs, shine forth!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, iung kơting. Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iung kơting. Pơchrang bĕ tơdrong Ih hil mĭl.

English: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; Render punishment to the proud.
Bahnar: Iung bĕ, ơ Yŏng Sek Tơlang kơ teh đak. Pơm tơwih bĕ kơ lu bơngai pơang kiơ̆ trŏ thoi lu sư pơm.

English: LORD, how long will the wicked, How long will the wicked triumph?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ dĭng truh dang yơ? Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ oei wă pơang dĭng dang yơ?
