English: They utter speech, and speak insolent things; All the workers of iniquity boast in themselves.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma nơ̆r pơang ling-lang, lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ tă kơ pơư kơdih ngăl.

English: They break in pieces Your people, O LORD, And afflict Your heritage.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, lu sư pơjuă pơđep kon pơlei Ih. Pơmat lu kon pơlei Ih.

English: They slay the widow and the stranger, And murder the fatherless.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơlôch bơngai drŏ-kăn adro; Lu bơngai tơmoi. Păng kư̆m pơlôch lu bơngai mơti.

English: Yet they say, “The LORD does not see, Nor does the God of Jacob understand.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Kră Yang ưh kơ 'bôh ôh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei adrĕch Jakôp kư̆m ưh kơ băt.”

English: Understand, you senseless among the people; And you fools, when will you be wise?
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai bơlŭk lăm kon pơlei kơchăng bĕ; Ơ lu bơngai kơtul kơwao, dang yơ mă iĕm gơh hơgei?

English: He who planted the ear, shall He not hear? He who formed the eye, shall He not see?
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơ'ngla pơjing hla đon ưh kơtơ̆ng hă? Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing măt ưh kơ 'bôh hă?

English: He who instructs the nations, shall He not correct, He who teaches man knowledge?
Bahnar: Kră Yang mă phak lu dêh char boih wă ưh kơ chrih hă? Sư boih Kră Yang bơtho ăn tơdrong hơgei kơ kon bơngai.

English: The LORD knows the thoughts of man, That they are futile.
Bahnar: Kră Yang băt tơdrong tơchĕng kon bơngai. Tă tơdrong kơ đei ngăl.

English: Blessed is the man whom You instruct, O LORD, And teach out of Your law
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, pŭn dêh kơ bơngai bu mă Ih đei bơtho pơhrăm, Păng bơtho ăn khôi juăt Ih kơ sư.

English: That You may give him rest from the days of adversity, Until the pit is dug for the wicked.
Bahnar: Wă ăn kơ sư pơdơh hiôk-hian đơ̆ng năr pơmat-tat. Dĭng mă sir sơlŭng jrŭ kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ noh keh đang.

English: For the LORD will not cast off His people, Nor will He forsake His inheritance.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang ưh kơ đei achăng lê̆ kon pơlei Sư. Kŭm ưh kơ lê̆ ôh dôm lu bơngai jing kon pơlei pơla Sư

English: But judgment will return to righteousness, And all the upright in heart will follow it.
Bahnar: Tơdrong sek tơlang tơpăt gô wih tơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Păng noh bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô rok kiơ̆.

English: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
Bahnar: Bu gô iung blah lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ Ăn kơ inh? Bu gô dŏng inh pơm kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆?

English: Unless the LORD had been my help, My soul would soon have settled in silence.
Bahnar: Dah Kră Yang ưh kơ đei dŏng tơgŭm inh, Lei bơhngol inh oei boih tơ lăm bơsat.

English: If I say, “My foot slips,” Your mercy, O LORD, will hold me up.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, mưh inh khan: “Jơ̆ng inh tơsĕr.” Na tơdrong 'mêm Ih dui tơiung inh hloi.

English: In the multitude of my anxieties within me, Your comforts delight my soul.
Bahnar: Mưh inh đei tơdrong rŭng răng. Na tơdrong Ih pơlung pơm ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk.

English: Shall the throne of iniquity, which devises evil by law, Have fellowship with You?
Bahnar: Hăm gơh lu bơngai pơyơ̆r mă pơm kơnê̆ pơgơ̆p hăm Ih, yua khôi juăt wă pơrăm ih.

English: They gather together against the life of the righteous, And condemn innocent blood.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơđâu băl wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai tơpăt. Păng sek pơlôch lu bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch.

English: But the LORD has been my defense, And my God the rock of my refuge.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang jing anih kơđông kơjăp pĕng inh. Kră Yang thoi Tơmo Tih, anih mă inh kơ'nơp.

English: He has brought on them their own iniquity, And shall cut them off in their own wickedness; The LORD our God shall cut them off.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm tơwih yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư. Kră Yang gô pơlôch lu sư yua kơ tơdrong lu sư pơm kơnê̆; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơlôch pơrăm lu sư.

English: Oh come, let us sing to the LORD! Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation.
Bahnar: Bĕ bơ̆n hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang. Bĕ bơ̆n hơri chơt hiôk kơ Tơmoa Sư dŏng pơklaih bơ̆n

English: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; Let us shout joyfully to Him with psalms.
Bahnar: Bĕ bơ̆n năm 'bơ̆t anăp Sư hăm nơ̆r bơnê. Chơt hiôk 'nă hal hăm nơ̆r hơri bơnê kơ Sư.

English: For the LORD is the great God, And the great King above all gods.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang jơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh. Sư pơtao Tih Hloh kơ đĭ-đăng yang

English: In His hand are the deep places of the earth; The heights of the hills are His also.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng sơlŭng jrŭb tơ lăm teh tơ lăm ti Sư, Dôm lu wĕch kông kư̆m gah Sư.

English: The sea is His, for He made it; And His hands formed the dry land.
Bahnar: Đak dơsĭ kư̆m tơmam sư, yua kơ đơ̆ng Sư pơjing; Gah teh hrĕng kro, kư̆m đơ̆ng ti Sư man

English: Oh come, let us worship and bow down; Let us kneel before the LORD our Maker.
Bahnar: Năm bĕ, kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh kơ Sư. Hơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng drap kơkuh bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla pơjing lu bơ̆n

English: For He is our God, And we are the people of His pasture, And the sheep of His hand. Today, if you will hear His voice
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n. Lu bơ̆n jing kon pơlei oei lăm dơnih 'nhĕt Sư. Păng jing triu kiơ̆ kơ ti Sư chông anhăk. Năr âu tơdah iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư

English: “Do not harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, As in the day of trial in the wilderness
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m iĕm 'nĕ pă arăng thoi tơ Mêriba. Thoi lăm năr tơ Masa lăm char 'blach.

English: When your fathers tested Me; They tried Me, though they saw My work.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu 'bok yă iĕm pơlong lăng Inh, lu sư pơlong Inh, Mă 'bôh boih tơdrong jang Inh pơm.

English: For forty years I was grieved with that generation, And said, ‘It is a people who go astray in their hearts, And they do not know My ways.’
Bahnar: Lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm Inh hil mĭl dêh kơ adrĕch adrung noh; Inh khan: “Noh minh adrĕch đei jơhngơ̆m yoch păng lu sư ưh kơ băt trong inh;”

English: So I swore in My wrath, ‘They shall not enter My rest.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh na Inh hil păng pơkă khan: “Lu sư ưh kơ đei layơ mơ̆t pơdơh lăm tơdrong hiôk Inh.”

English: Oh, sing to the LORD a new song! Sing to the LORD, all the earth.
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ kơ Kră Yang; minh tơdrong hơri 'nao Ơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak hơri bĕ kơ Kră Yang.

English: Sing to the LORD, bless His name; Proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ kơ Kră Yang păng bơnê ư-ang kơ anăn Sư; Rim năr athei ră roi tơdrong Sư dŏng pơklaih

English: Declare His glory among the nations, His wonders among all peoples.
Bahnar: Ră roi tơdrong ư-ang kơ Sư tơ jơ̆p dêh char. Roi tơbăt dôm tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư kơ rim adrĕch kon bơngai.

English: For the LORD is great and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, trŏ kơkuh bơnê; Sư noh trŏ kơ hli yom hloh kơ đĭ-đăng yang

English: For all the gods of the peoples are idols, But the LORD made the heavens.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng yang mă kon pơlei kơkuh noh jơ̆ yang man kơdih; Mă-lei Kră Yang Sư pơjing plĕnh.

English: Honor and majesty are before Him; Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ păng tơdrong rŏ krưp oei 'bơ̆t anăp Sư. Tơdrong mơsêh păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ oei tơ anih rơgoh Sư.

English: Give to the LORD, O families of the peoples, Give to the LORD glory and strength.
Bahnar: Ơ lu adrĕch adrung kon pơlei pơla. Pơyơ̆r ăn bĕ kơ Kră Yang; pơyơ̆r ăn bĕ kơ Kră Yang tơdrong ư-ang pran kơtang

English: Give to the LORD the glory due His name; Bring an offering, and come into His courts.
Bahnar: Pơyơ̆r ăn bĕ tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang. Mă trŏ kơ Anăn Sư. Athei chĕp tơmam soi na mơ̆t tơ cham hnam Sư.

English: Oh, worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness! Tremble before Him, all the earth.
Bahnar: Athei hrŭk hơbĕn ao rơgoh na kơkuh kơ Kră Yang; Ơ đĭ-đăng teh đak, hli tơtey bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns; The world also is firmly established, It shall not be moved; He shall judge the peoples righteously.”
Bahnar: Athei roi bĕ kơ lu dêh char: “Kră Yang pơgơ̆r. Teh đak đei pơjing kơjăp, ưh kơ đei pơpơ̆. Sư gô sek tơlang kơ kon pơlei pơla tơpăt.”

English: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; Let the sea roar, and all its fullness
Bahnar: Ơ lu plĕnh chơt hiôk păng teh 'nă hal bĕ. Ơ đak dơsĭ păng lu kon sem brem oei lăm dơsĭ ôr jreo chơt hiôk bĕ.

English: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it. Then all the trees of the woods will rejoice before the LORD.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ mir chŭn păng tơmam lăm noh chơt hiôk bĕ; Na lu 'long pơle lăm bri brah gô hơri chơt hiôk. 'Bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: For He is coming, for He is coming to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with righteousness, And the peoples with His truth.
Bahnar: Sư truh wă sek tơlang kơ teh đak, Sư gô sek tơlang kơ teh đak hăm tơdrong tơpăt. Yua tơdrong tơpăt sĭt Sư na sek kơ kon pơlei pơla.

English: The LORD reigns; Let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of isles be glad!
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơgơ̆r, ơ teh chhôk hal bĕ; Ơ lu bŏl đaka chơt hiôk bĕ.

English: Clouds and darkness surround Him; Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
Bahnar: Hơmơ̆l păng măng mu gom tăp dăr kơ Sư; Tơdrong tơpăt tơdrong hơnơ̆ng pơm hơnă tang-dŏ pơtao Sư.

English: A fire goes before Him, And burns up His enemies round about.
Bahnar: Ŭnh năm adrol tơ anăp Sư soh pơrăm lê̆ lu ayăt tăp dăr kơ sư.

English: His lightnings light the world; The earth sees and trembles.
Bahnar: Kơmlat đơ̆ng Sư pơchrang hơdah tơ lăm teh đak, Plei teh 'bôh na hli pơpơ̆

English: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD, At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
Bahnar: Lu kông lek hach thoi jrĕnh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak.

English: The heavens declare His righteousness, And all the peoples see His glory.
Bahnar: Tơ jơ̆p kơ plĕnh roi tơdrong tơpăt Sư, păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei 'bôh boih tơdrong ư-ang Sư.

English: Let all be put to shame who serve carved images, Who boast of idols. Worship Him, all you gods.
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kơkuh kơ rup yang mơlâu. Lu gơnang kơ rup yang tơdrong kơ đei. Ơ lu yang, kơkuh bĕ kơ Kră Yang.

English: Zion hears and is glad, And the daughters of Judah rejoice Because of Your judgments, O LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Siôn kơtơ̆ng na chơt hiôk, Păng lu pơlei Juđa đei jơhngơ̆m 'nă hal, Yua kơ tơdrong Ih sek tơlang

English: For You, LORD, are most high above all the earth; You are exalted far above all gods.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih boih jơ̆ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, kơpal hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lăm teh. Ih đei tơdrong pơyom hloh loi kơ đĭ-đăng lu yang.

English: You who love the LORD, hate evil! He preserves the souls of His saints; He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai mă 'mêm kơ Kră Yang areh bĕ kơ tơdrong kơnê̆; Sư wei wêr tơdrong arih bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư. Păng dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Light is sown for the righteous, And gladness for the upright in heart.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơdahb pơchrang kơ lu bơngai tơpăt. Păng chơt hiôk kơ lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m tơpăt.

English: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai tơpăt lu iĕm chơt hiôk bĕ lăm Kră Yang. Bơnê kơ Anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư.

English: Oh, sing to the LORD a new song! For He has done marvelous things; His right hand and His holy arm have gained Him the victory.
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ kơ Kră Yang minh 'bai hơri 'nao; Yua kơ Sư pơm boih tơdrong hlĭch chrơp. Ti 'ma păng kơkŏng ti 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư, ăn jei Sư boih.

English: The LORD has made known His salvation; His righteousness He has revealed in the sight of the nations.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơbăt boih tơdrong Sư dŏng pơklaih. Păng pơdah boih tơdrong tơpăt Sư 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla.

English: He has remembered His mercy and His faithfulness to the house of Israel; All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
Bahnar: Sư 'blŏk kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư hăm bơngai Isơrael; Đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak 'bôh boih tơdrong Kră Yang lu bơ̆n dŏng pơklaih.

English: Shout joyfully to the LORD, all the earth; Break forth in song, rejoice, and sing praises.
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng teh đak, ôr chơt 'nă hal bĕ kơ Kră Yang. Hơri chơt hiôk bĕ păng hơri tơ'nguơ̆ bơnê kơkuh bĕ kơ sư

English: Sing to the LORD with the harp, With the harp and the sound of a psalm
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ brŏ reh, hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang. Iŏk brŏ tĭng-nĭng hơri tơ'nguơ̆ ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang

English: With trumpets and the sound of a horn; Shout joyfully before the LORD, the King.
Bahnar: Hăm tơgiĕp păng jơwa keng. Na hơri chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao, Kră Yang

English: Let the sea roar, and all its fullness, The world and those who dwell in it
Bahnar: Đak dơsĭ păng lu sem brem oei lăm noh. Kơpal teh đak hăm lu oei lăm teh đak ôr jreo bĕ.

English: Let the rivers clap their hands; Let the hills be joyful together before the LORD
Bahnar: Đak krong wang tap ti bĕ! Kông groi kư̆m wang hơri chơt hiôk bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang!

English: For He is coming to judge the earth. With righteousness He shall judge the world, And the peoples with equity.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư truh wă sek tơlang kơ teh đak. Sư sek tơlang kơ teh đak hăm tơdrong tơpăt sư, tơpăt hơnơ̆ng. Sư sek tơlang kơ kon pơlei pơla.

English: The LORD reigns; Let the peoples tremble! He dwells between the cherubim; Let the earth be moved!
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơgơ̆r; lu kon pơlei athei hli yom bĕ; Sư hơ-oei tơ kơpal chêrubim;a plei teh hli pơpơ̆ bĕ.

English: The LORD is great in Zion, And He is high above all the peoples.
Bahnar: Lăm Siôn Kră Yang tih hloh, Sư đe pơyom hloh kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei.

English: Let them praise Your great and awesome name— He is holy.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư hơri kơkuh kơ anăn Ih mă tih hloh trŏ kơ hli; Sư boih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh

English: The King’s strength also loves justice; You have established equity; You have executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.
Bahnar: Pơtao mơsêh mơyang, Sư 'mêm kơ tơdrong tơpăt; Ih pơjing kơjăp tơdrong hơtŏ hơnơ̆ng. Ih sek tơlang hăm tơdrong tơpăt trŏ lăm Jakôp

English: Exalt the LORD our God, And worship at His footstool— He is holy.
Bahnar: Athei pôk pơư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n Păng drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Sư; Sư boih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh!

English: Moses and Aaron were among His priests, And Samuel was among those who called upon His name; They called upon the LORD, and He answered them.
Bahnar: Lăm lu 'bok soi Sư, đei Môis păng Arôn; Lăm lu bơngai krao apinh hăm anăn Sư đei Samuel; Lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang păng Sư đei tơl tơwih.

English: He spoke to them in the cloudy pillar; They kept His testimonies and the ordinance He gave them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm jrăng hơmơ̆l Sư pơma hăm lu sư: Lu sư bơwei tơdrong Kră Yang bơtho; Păng tơdrong juăt mă Sư đei ăn.

English: You answered them, O LORD our God; You were to them God-Who-Forgives, Though You took vengeance on their deeds.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, Ih tơl tơwih boih nơ̆r lu sư, Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă đei mơnat ăn kơ lu sư, Mă-lei Ih kư̆m pơm tơwih tơdrong yoch đêl lu sư pơm.

English: Exalt the LORD our God, And worship at His holy hill; For the LORD our God is holy.
Bahnar: Athei pôk pơư bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, Păng drap kơkuh tơ kơpal kông rơgoh Sư. Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n 'lơ̆ng rơgoh!

English: Make a joyful shout to the LORD, all you lands!
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng bơngai mă oei lăm teh đak. Ôr chơt hiôk bĕ kơ Kră Yang!

English: Serve the LORD with gladness; Come before His presence with singing.
Bahnar: Bơ̆jang bĕ kơ Kră Yang hăm tơdrong chơt hiôk, Năm hơri 'nă hal bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: Know that the LORD, He is God; It is He who has made us, and not we ourselves; We are His people and the sheep of His pasture.
Bahnar: Athei băt Kră Yang jơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư boih Tơ'ngla pơjing bơ̆n, lu bơ̆n jing tơmam Sư. Lu bơ̆n kon pơlei pơla Sư, jơ̆ kon triu lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt Sư

English: Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, And into His courts with praise. Be thankful to Him, and bless His name.
Bahnar: Athei bơnê na mơ̆t lăm 'măng jang Sư, bơnê ư-ang bĕ na mơ̆t lăm cham Sư. Bơnê bĕ kơ Sư păng hơri ư-ang kơ anăn Sư.

English: For the LORD is good; His mercy is everlasting, And His truth endures to all generations.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong 'mêm Sư oei oei ling-lang. Păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư dĭng truh tơ ning-mônh.

English: I will sing of mercy and justice; To You, O LORD, I will sing praises.
Bahnar: Inh gô hơri kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat păng tơdrong tơpăt Ih; Ơ Kră Yang, Inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Ih.

English: I will behave wisely in a perfect way. Oh, when will You come to me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
Bahnar: Inh gô kơchăng oei arih sa trŏ 'lơ̆ng. Dang yơ Ih wă truh tơ inh? Inh gô iŏk jơhngơ̆m tơpăt na oei sa lăm hnam inh.

English: I will set nothing wicked before my eyes; I hate the work of those who fall away; It shall not cling to me.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ ăn minh tơdrong kiơ kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t muh măt inh. Inh areh kơ tơdrong jang lu bơngai achăng lê̆ Ih: Tơdrong noh ưh kơ 'bơm tơ inh.

English: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will not know wickedness.
Bahnar: Inh gô weh ataih đơ̆ng lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆. Inh ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dơ̆ng.

English: Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor, Him I will destroy; The one who has a haughty look and a proud heart, Him I will not endure.
Bahnar: Inh gô ngăn hreh kơ lu đe mă pơma roi 'bơm lu rông 'bôt. Gah lu bơngai đei măt pơrŏ păng jơhngơ̆m pơang, Inh ưh kơ lăp ôh.

English: My eyes shall be on the faithful of the land, That they may dwell with me; He who walks in a perfect way, He shall serve me.
Bahnar: Măt inh gô hnhoi kiơ̆ lu bơngai tơpăt lăm tơring. Lu sư gô oei hơdai hăm inh; Bu kiơ̆ trong tơpăt, bơngai noh gô bơ̆jang kơ inh.

English: He who works deceit shall not dwell within my house; He who tells lies shall not continue in my presence.
Bahnar: Lu mă hơlĕnh pơdăr ưh kơ gơh oei tơ lăm hnam inh. Bơngai pơma hơlĕnh ưh kơ gơh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp inh.

English: Early I will destroy all the wicked of the land, That I may cut off all the evildoers from the city of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm rim pơgê inh gô pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ lăm tơring. Wă pơrăm lê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, đơ̆ng pơlei Kră Yang.

English: Hear my prayer, O LORD, And let my cry come to You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih mơng nơ̆r inh krao khan. Ăn kơ nơ̆r inh hơpơi dŏng truh tơ Ih.

English: Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my trouble; Incline Your ear to me; In the day that I call, answer me speedily.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơmat-tat, apinh 'nĕ ôn muh măt Ih kơ inh. Apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh; Lăm năr inh krao hơpơi, apinh mă kuăng jah tơl tơwih kơ inh.

English: For my days are consumed like smoke, And my bones are burned like a hearth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ khei năr inh oei arih hiong hach thoi 'nhui, Kơting inh ngŭr thoi ŭnh sa ngar.

English: My heart is stricken and withered like grass, So that I forget to eat my bread.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh đe pơjuă, jô kro thoi 'nhĕt. Dĭng inh mah hiơt kơ sŏng sa.

English: Because of the sound of my groaning My bones cling to my skin.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong inh tơtok tơtăm sĕch inh đĭ klep kơ kơting.

English: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am like an owl of the desert.
Bahnar: Inh nhen thoi grơ̆ lăm char glă, kư̆m thoi bơrơ̆m oei lăm tơ bri brah.

English: I lie awake, And am like a sparrow alone on the housetop.
Bahnar: Inh kral, inh nhen thoi sem rĕch oei hơdrô̆ kơpal bơbŭng hnam.

English: My enemies reproach me all day long; Those who deride me swear an oath against me.
Bahnar: Prăt năr lu bơngai ayăt pơ'brơh kơ inh; Lu bơngai pơrăm inh yua anăn inh blei hiap.

English: For I have eaten ashes like bread, And mingled my drink with weeping
Bahnar: Inh sa tơnuh tơplih kơ por. Đak inh nhă hrâu păng đak măt.

English: Because of Your indignation and Your wrath; For You have lifted me up and cast me away.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Ih hil mĭl dêh hiŏng klơ̆m lê̆ inh tơ ataih.

English: My days are like a shadow that lengthens, And I wither away like grass.
Bahnar: Khei năr inh oei arih nhen thoi yơ̆p wă kơsơ̆ măng. Inh jô kro thoi 'nhĕt

English: But You, O LORD, shall endure forever, And the remembrance of Your name to all generations.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ơ Kră Yang! Ih oei pơm pơtao ling-lang. 'Blŏk kơ anăn Ih đĭ jơhnơr.

English: You will arise and have mercy on Zion; For the time to favor her, Yes, the set time, has come.
Bahnar: Ih gô iung păng 'mêm kơ Siôn; Trŏ boih năr wă mơnat ăn kơ Siôn, năr đêl pơkă truh boih.

English: For Your servants take pleasure in her stones, And show favor to her dust.
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam Ih 'mêm dêh kơ tơmo Siôn. Păng 'mêm kơ 'mui teh sư mơ̆n.

English: So the nations shall fear the name of the LORD, And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
Bahnar: Đĭ kon pơlei pơla gô hli yom kơ anăn Kră Yang, Đĭ-đăng pơtao lăm teh đak gô hli yom kơ tơdrong ư-ang Ih.

English: For the LORD shall build up Zion; He shall appear in His glory.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơjing dơ̆ng pơlei Siôn. Sư gô pơdah Sư kơdih lăm tơdrong ư-ang

English: He shall regard the prayer of the destitute, And shall not despise their prayer.
Bahnar: Sư gô mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu bơngai pơmat-tat krao khan. Ưh kơ đei pơdê lê̆ dôm nơ̆r lu sư apinh.

English: This will be written for the generation to come, That a people yet to be created may praise the LORD.
Bahnar: Chih 'măn lê̆ bĕ tơdrong âu kơ chăl đơ̆ng rŏng. Minh adrĕch pơjing đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư gô kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang

English: For He looked down from the height of His sanctuary; From heaven the LORD viewed the earth
Bahnar: Kră Yang nger lăng bơih đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh Sư lăng tơ teh đak.

English: To hear the groaning of the prisoner, To release those appointed to death
Bahnar: Wă kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng lu bơnă ôr krao. Păng dŏng pơklaih bơngai mă đe wă pơlôch

English: To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, And His praise in Jerusalem
Bahnar: Wă kơ đe ră roi anăn Kră Yang lăm Siôn. Păng kơkuh bơnê kơ Sư tơ lăm Jêrusalem

English: When the peoples are gathered together, And the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu kon pơlei, lu dêh char pơtao akŭm băl wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: He weakened my strength in the way; He shortened my days.
Bahnar: Sư pơm ăn jơhngơ̆m inh rơdu lăm chăl arih inh, Pơm ăn kơ lu năr arih inh rai djăl.

English: I said, “O my God, Do not take me away in the midst of my days; Your years are throughout all generations.
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! 'Nĕ kơ iŏk lê̆ inh tŏk-bŏk oei hơmuh hơmŏng. Lu sơnăm Ih oei oei ling-lang.”

English: Of old You laid the foundation of the earth, And the heavens are the work of Your hands.
Bahnar: Blŭng-a sơ̆ Ih pơjing teh đak păng lu plĕnh đơ̆ng ti Ih pơjing.

English: They will perish, but You will endure; Yes, they will all grow old like a garment; Like a cloak You will change them, And they will be changed.
Bahnar: Lu plĕnh teh gô hiong răm mă-lei Ih oei oei ling-lang; Plĕnh teh gô so thoi ao tai; Ih gô tơplih plĕnh teh thoi tơplih ao păng lu sư jing hŭt lê̆.

English: But You are the same, And Your years will have no end.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih ưh kơ đei layơ tơplih. Lu sơnăm Ih ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.

English: The children of Your servants will continue, And their descendants will be established before You.”
Bahnar: Lu kon sâu đĭch đam Ih oei đei ling-lang. Adrĕch adrung lu sư đei pơjing rai kơjăp 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: Bless the LORD, O my soul; And all that is within me, bless His holy name!
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang! Đĭ jơhngơ̆m hơri bơnê bĕ kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư!

English: Bless the LORD, O my soul, And forget not all His benefits
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh, kơkuh bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang. 'Nĕ hiơt dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng Sư pơm.

English: Who forgives all your iniquities, Who heals all your diseases
Bahnar: Sư mơnat ăn dôm tơdrong yoch đêl ih pơm, Pơklaih dôm tơdrong jĭ jăn ih.

English: Who redeems your life from destruction, Who crowns you with lovingkindness and tender mercies
Bahnar: Sư dŏng pơklaih tơdrong arih ih đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ. Iŏk tơdrong 'mêm păng tơdrong mơnat na pơm môk pơtao pơyơ̆l ăn kơ ih.

English: Who satisfies your mouth with good things, So that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ hơlŏng ih hrăp jơnap. Hăm tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng, sơnăm hơmuh hơmŏng ih wih 'nao dơ̆ng thoi Klang.

English: The LORD executes righteousness And justice for all who are oppressed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm tơdrong tơpăt, Păng sek trŏ hơnơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai mă gơ̆p pơjuă pơđep.

English: He made known His ways to Moses, His acts to the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Sư tơ'bôh ăn kơ Môis trong Sư, păng ăn kơ Isơrael băt dôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư.

English: The LORD is merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abounding in mercy.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei tơdrong 'mêm mơnat. Huay 'bônh kơ blĕk păng 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong 'mêm.

English: He will not always strive with us, Nor will He keep His anger forever.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ chrih kơ bơ̆n ling-lang ôh; Kŭm huay kơ hil mĭl khŏm khŏm mơ̆n.

English: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, Nor punished us according to our iniquities.
Bahnar: Sư huay pơm kơ lu bơ̆n kiơ̆ thoi yoch lu bơ̆n ôh; Kŭm ưh kơ hil 'mong kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơ̆n pơm boih.

English: For as the heavens are high above the earth, So great is His mercy toward those who fear Him
Bahnar: Yua kơ plĕnh kơjung đơ̆ng teh dang yơ. Na tơdrong 'mêm sư dang noh mơ̆n, kơ lu bơngai bu mă hli yom kơ Sư.

English: As far as the east is from the west, So far has He removed our transgressions from us.
Bahnar: Gah hơlĕch ataih đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t dang yơ, Na Sư kư̆m hŭt lê̆ dôm yoch glăi lu bơ̆n ataih dang noh mơ̆n.

English: As a father pities his children, So the LORD pities those who fear Him.
Bahnar: Thoi 'bă 'mêm kơ kon hơ'lơ̆p sư dang yơ. Kră Yang 'mêm kơ lu bơngai bu mă hli yom kơ Sư dang noh mơ̆n.

English: For He knows our frame; He remembers that we are dust.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư băt bơ̆n jing đơ̆ng yơ, Sư 'blŏk kơ bơ̆n đơ̆ng 'mui teh.

English: As for man, his days are like grass; As a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
Bahnar: Chăl arih kon bơngai thoi 'nhĕt. Sư arih thoi pơkao tơ lăm mir

English: For the wind passes over it, and it is gone, And its place remembers it no more.
Bahnar: Mưh kial tơthu tơ pơkao, sư hiong hloi, anih sư chăt ưh pă 'blŏk kơ sư boih.

English: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting On those who fear Him, And His righteousness to children’s children
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong 'mêm Kră Yang oei oei ling-lang. Ăn kơ lu bơngai hli yom kơ Sư, păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư 'măn kơ lu kon sâu lu sư.

English: To such as keep His covenant, And to those who remember His commandments to do them.
Bahnar: Wă khan ăn kơ lu đe bu mă wei răk tơdrong pơgơ̆p Sư. Păng 'blŏk na pơm kiơ̆ kơ dôm nơ̆r Sư bơtho pơkă.

English: The LORD has established His throne in heaven, And His kingdom rules over all.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơjing boih anih pơtao Sư tơ plĕnh. Dêh char Sư pơgơ̆r kơ đĭ-đăng tôm tơmam.

English: Bless the LORD, you His angels, Who excel in strength, who do His word, Heeding the voice of His word.
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang: Ơ lu linh jang Kră Yang, lu yang mă đei jơhngơ̆m pran kơtang pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơtă Sư; mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư khan.

English: Bless the LORD, all you His hosts, You ministers of His, who do His pleasure.
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang! Ơ lu linh Kră Yang, đĭch đam pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư.

English: Bless the LORD, all His works, In all places of His dominion. Bless the LORD, O my soul!
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang! Ơ dôm lu sem tơmam mă Kră Yang pơjing, Lăm jơ̆p anih teh đak Sư, Ơ bơhngol inh, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang!

English: Bless the LORD, O my soul! O LORD my God, You are very great: You are clothed with honor and majesty
Bahnar: Ơ bơhngol inh hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang! Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh. Ih Tih tơpă. Ih hrŭk boih tơdrong ư-ang păng krưp rŏ tơpă!

English: Who cover Yourself with light as with a garment, Who stretch out the heavens like a curtain.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gom Sư kơdih hăm tơdrong hơdah, Nhen thoi minh blah ao tai Sư bơyar plĕnh thoi bơyar bơsŭn.

English: He lays the beams of His upper chambers in the waters, Who makes the clouds His chariot, Who walks on the wings of the wind
Bahnar: Sư roh hơpok hnam kơpal sư tơ kơpal đak,a Sư yua hơmơ̆l pơm gre. Sư hao kơpal pơnăr kial.

English: Who makes His angels spirits, His ministers a flame of fire.
Bahnar: Sư yua kial pơm bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư. Pla ŭnh pơm đĭch đam Sư.

English: You who laid the foundations of the earth, So that it should not be moved forever
Bahnar: Sư dan teh tơ kơpal lu hơnă teh noh, wă kơ teh ưh pă tơdrŏ pơpơ̆ dơ̆ng

English: You covered it with the deep as with a garment; The waters stood above the mountains.
Bahnar: Ih yua dơsĭ jrŭ gom teh thoi gom hăm ao. Đak tŏk kơjung hloh kơ lu kông

English: At Your rebuke they fled; At the voice of Your thunder they hastened away.
Bahnar: Ih hil chrih đak tơrơ hloi kơtơ̆ng jơwa grơ̆m Ih đak kơdâu ôn đĭ

English: They went up over the mountains; They went down into the valleys, To the place which You founded for them.
Bahnar: Đĭ kông tŏk kơjung, lu thŭng thong huŏng tơ ala truh tơ anih mă Ih đei 'măn kơ sư.

English: You have set a boundary that they may not pass over, That they may not return to cover the earth.
Bahnar: Ih hơgăt kơ đak dang noh boih ưh pă gơh tŏk hloh dơ̆ng, na huay kơ lơ̆p teh.

English: He sends the springs into the valleys; They flow among the hills.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơ lu đak glung lĕch ro jơ̆p kơ thong sư ro sơlam kông.

English: They give drink to every beast of the field; The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
Bahnar: Đak glung noh ăn lu sem bri nhă; đơ̆ng đak noh lu seh bri klaih rơhing.

English: By them the birds of the heavens have their home; They sing among the branches.
Bahnar: Lu sem păr pơm tơpu oei tơ rok cheng glung noh. Hmoi asi tơ kơpal dơng 'long.

English: He waters the hills from His upper chambers; The earth is satisfied with the fruit of Your works.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih kơjung Sư, Sư ruh đak tơ lu kông, 'Bĕnh kơ teh đei plei yua, lĕch đơ̆ng tơdrong jang Sư.

English: He causes the grass to grow for the cattle, And vegetation for the service of man, That he may bring forth food from the earth
Bahnar: Sư pơm ăn kơ 'nhĕt bluh ăn kơ lu sem brem. 'Long pơle wă yua kơ kon bơngai păng 'ba hơ'bo 'nhot sa chăt đơ̆ng teh.

English: And wine that makes glad the heart of man, Oil to make his face shine, And bread which strengthens man’s heart.
Bahnar: Sik hơmu tơmam pơhiôk jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai. Đak rơmă ôliwơ pơm ăn kơ muh măt hơdah hơdong, Por sŏng wă ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai pran.

English: The trees of the LORD are full of sap, The cedars of Lebanon which He planted
Bahnar: Lu tơm 'long Kră Yang đei ruh hơiuh đĭ-đăng 'long hơngo char Liban đêl Sư pơtăm.

English: Where the birds make their nests; The stork has her home in the fir trees.
Bahnar: Tơ noh mă lu sem pơm tơpu; Gah klang kok sư yua 'long hơngo pơm anih sư oei.

English: The high hills are for the wild goats; The cliffs are a refuge for the rock badgers.
Bahnar: Tơ lu kông kơjung anih lu bơbe bri oei. Hơgơp tơmo anih kơ lu kơne bri ôn.

English: He appointed the moon for seasons; The sun knows its going down.
Bahnar: Sư pơjing boih măt khei wă kơ tơdra bơyan. Măt 'năr băt dang yơ jơ sư mơ̆t.

English: You make darkness, and it is night, In which all the beasts of the forest creep about.
Bahnar: Ih pơjing măng mu, noh jô̆ kơmăng; Kơplah noh đĭ lu sem bri lĕch

English: The young lions roar after their prey, And seek their food from God.
Bahnar: Lu dăm-brang mơlôh grĕnh chă sa, chă sa tơmam mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư.

English: When the sun rises, they gather together And lie down in their dens.
Bahnar: Dah 'năr lĕch lu sư brŏk wih, 'bĭch ôn tơ lăm trôm anih lu sư.

English: Man goes out to his work And to his labor until the evening.
Bahnar: Na kon bơngai, lĕch năm jang, Bơ̆jang dĭng truh kơ kơsơ̆.

English: O LORD, how manifold are Your works! In wisdom You have made them all. The earth is full of Your possessions
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơdrong jang Ih lơ tơpă. Hăm tơdrong gơh hơgei Ih pơjing tôm tơmam. Kơpal teh 'bĕnh-'bang kơ tơmam Ih.

English: This great and wide sea, In which are innumerable teeming things, Living things both small and great.
Bahnar: To đak dơsĭ tih să pă băt. Lăm noh đei kon sem, ka tih iĕ pă kĕ jô̆.

English: There the ships sail about; There is that Leviathan Which You have made to play there.
Bahnar: Tơ noh duk, thŏng-nan brŏk năm; Lêwiathanb mă Kră Yang đei pơjing boih glơi hơnul tơ lăm noh.

English: These all wait for You, That You may give them their food in due season.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sem brem chang gô Ih ăn tơmam sa kơ lu sư kiơ̆ kơ lăp.

English: What You give them they gather in; You open Your hand, they are filled with good.
Bahnar: Layơ Ih ăn kơ lu sư, lu sư sơng iŏk, Ih bơlang tơpang ti, lu sư sa phĭ mah tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng.

English: You hide Your face, they are troubled; You take away their breath, they die and return to their dust.
Bahnar: Layơ Ih ôn muh măt, lu sư rŭng răng. Layơ Ih pơdrâu kial dui jơhngơ̆m. Lu sư lôch păng brŏk tơ 'mui teh.

English: You send forth Your Spirit, they are created; And You renew the face of the earth.
Bahnar: Wă ih ăn Bơhngol đơ̆ng Ih, lu sư jing đei hloi. Ih pơm ming teh jing 'nao dơ̆ng.

English: May the glory of the LORD endure forever; May the LORD rejoice in His works.
Bahnar: Hơpơi kơ tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang oei oei ling-lang; Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang hiôk chơt kơ tơdrong jang Sư.

English: He looks on the earth, and it trembles; He touches the hills, and they smoke.
Bahnar: Sư lăng tơ teh teh pơpơ̆ hloi; Sư pel kông na kông lĕch 'nhui.

English: I will sing to the LORD as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
Bahnar: Đĭ chăl arih inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang. Inh oei arih dang yơ, inh gô hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dang noh

English: May my meditation be sweet to Him; I will be glad in the LORD.
Bahnar: Ăn tơdrong inh tơchĕng 'lơ̆ng lăp đon Sư. Inh gô chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang.

English: May sinners be consumed from the earth, And the wicked be no more. Bless the LORD, O my soul! Praise the LORD!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu bơngai yoch lôch hiong đĭ đơ̆ng teh đak. Păng lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pă đei dơ̆ng, Ơ bơhngol inh hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang: Halêluya!

English: Oh, give thanks to the LORD! Call upon His name; Make known His deeds among the peoples!
Bahnar: Bơnê ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang. Krao apinh pao anăn Sư bĕ. Ră roi bĕ kơ lu kon pơlei pơla dôm tơdrong jang Sư pơm boih.

English: Sing to Him, sing psalms to Him; Talk of all His wondrous works!
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ kơ Sư, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Sư. Ră roi bĕ tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp sư.

English: Glory in His holy name; Let the hearts of those rejoice who seek the LORD!
Bahnar: Ư-ang bĕ kơ lu iĕm kơdih lăm anăn rơgoh Sư, Ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai chơchă Kră Yang đei hiôk chơt.

English: Seek the LORD and His strength; Seek His face evermore!
Bahnar: Chă bĕ Kră Yang păng tơdrong pran kơtang Sư chơchă bĕ muh măt Sư ling-lang.

English: Remember His marvelous works which He has done, His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth
Bahnar: Athei 'blŏk bĕ dôm tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư đei pơm boih Tơdrong hlĭch chrơp păng tơdrong sek tơlang đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư đei khan.

English: O seed of Abraham His servant, You children of Jacob, His chosen ones!
Bahnar: Ơ lu adrĕch adrung Abraham, đĭch đam Sư. Ơ lu kon sâu Jakôp, lu bơngai mă Sư rơih.

English: He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
Bahnar: Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n. Tơdrong Sư sek tơlang kơ jơ̆p lăm teh.

English: He remembers His covenant forever, The word which He commanded, for a thousand generations
Bahnar: Sư 'blŏk tơdrong pơgơ̆p Sư ling-lang. Sư ưh kơ hiơt tơdrong pơkă pơkăm mă truh rơbâu chăl.

English: The covenant which He made with Abraham, And His oath to Isaac
Bahnar: Tơdrong Sư pơgơ̆p hăm Abraham. Nơ̆r Sư pơkăm hăm Isăk

English: And confirmed it to Jacob for a statute, To Israel as an everlasting covenant
Bahnar: Sư pơsĭt boih hăm Jakôp noh jing minh tơdrong juăt. Păng hăm Isơrael jing minh tơdrong pơgơ̆p ling-lang

English: Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan As the allotment of your inheritance,”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Inh gô ăn kơ Ih teh char Kanaan, Noh teh lu iĕm jang sa;”

English: When they were few in number, Indeed very few, and strangers in it.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu sư lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch, ưh tam đei lơ păng jing bơngai tơmoi lăm char noh.

English: When they went from one nation to another, From one kingdom to another people
Bahnar: Lu sư năm đơ̆ng dêh âu, truh tơ dêh to. Đơ̆ng teh đak âu tơ teh đak nai.

English: He permitted no one to do them wrong; Yes, He rebuked kings for their sakes
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ ăn đei bu gơh pơjuă pơđep lu sư. Kră Yang hil kơ lu pơtao yua kơ lu sư.

English: Saying, “Do not touch My anointed ones, And do My prophets no harm.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “'Nĕ kơ hơtŭt 'bơm kơ lu bơngai mă inh đei tuh đak 'bâu phu, 'nĕ pơrăm lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol Inh.”

English: Moreover He called for a famine in the land; He destroyed all the provision of bread.
Bahnar: Sư ăn tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt lăm dêh char, Păng pơrăm lê̆ đĭ tơmam sŏng sa lu sư

English: He sent a man before them— Joseph—who was sold as a slave.
Bahnar: Sư wơh minh 'nu năm adrol kơ lu sư, Noh jơ̆ Jôsep, đe tĕch boih pơm đĭch.

English: They hurt his feet with fetters, He was laid in irons.
Bahnar: Lu đe jơlŏng lê̆ jơ̆ng sư, chô̆ hơko sư păng glang mam.

English: Until the time that his word came to pass, The word of the LORD tested him.
Bahnar: Dĭng truh 'blep kơ năr đêl sư khan, Nơ̆r Kră Yang pơsĭt nơ̆r sư khan trŏ.

English: The king sent and released him, The ruler of the people let him go free.
Bahnar: Pơtao athei đe achăng Jôsep tơ'ngla pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơklaih sư.

English: He made him lord of his house, And ruler of all his possessions
Bahnar: Pơtao jao kơ sư pơm yŏng wei-lăng hnam pơtao păng lăng đĭ-đăng mŭk măk, lăm char sư

English: To bind his princes at his pleasure, And teach his elders wisdom.
Bahnar: Wă kơ sư gơh bơtho athei lu kră pơgơ̆r mơ̆ng kiơ̆ sư. Păng sư bơtho pơhrăm ăn kơ lu kră wă kơ băt gơh hơgei.

English: Israel also came into Egypt, And Jacob dwelt in the land of Ham.
Bahnar: Isơrael mơ̆t oei tơ Êyiptơ; Jakôp oei tơ dêh Cham thoi bơngai tơmoi.

English: He increased His people greatly, And made them stronger than their enemies.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla sư rai hrôh, ăn kơ lu sư pran hloh kơ lu đe mă pơjuă pơđep lu sư.

English: He turned their heart to hate His people, To deal craftily with His servants.
Bahnar: Na Sư tơplih jơhngơ̆m bơngai Êyiptơ, areh kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư. Chă đon wă pơrăm lu đĭch đam Sư.

English: He sent Moses His servant, And Aaron whom He had chosen.
Bahnar: Sư wơh Môis đĭch đam Sư păng Arôn bơngai mă Sư rơih boih.

English: They performed His signs among them, And wonders in the land of Ham.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Kră Yang. Tŏk-bŏk lu đe noh. Pơm kơdranh hlĭch chrơp lăm dêh Cham.

English: He sent darkness, and made it dark; And they did not rebel against His word.
Bahnar: Sư wơh măng mu, măng mu jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh ei. Wă kơ lu sư pă đei pơm kơnê̆ kơ nơ̆r Sư dơ̆ng.

English: He turned their waters into blood, And killed their fish.
Bahnar: Sư tơplih đak lu đe noh jing pham, Păng pơlôch đĭ ka lăm đak.

English: Their land abounded with frogs, Even in the chambers of their kings.
Bahnar: Đei kit lơlap 'bĕnh-'bang kơ dêh lu sư. Dĭng truh tơ lăm anih pơtao kư̆m đei.

English: He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, And lice in all their territory.
Bahnar: Sư pơma na đei hloi roi wŏng truh, Păng mur 'bĕnh-'bang kơ dêh lu sư

English: He gave them hail for rain, And flaming fire in their land.
Bahnar: Sư ăn 'mi prĕl, tơplih kơ đak 'mi păng ăn kơmlat tơ jơ̆p kơ char noh

English: He struck their vines also, and their fig trees, And splintered the trees of their territory.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơrăm pơgar hơmu păng plei 'long hơra. Sư gơ̆ lê̆ lu 'long tơ lăm char noh.

English: He spoke, and locusts came, Young locusts without number
Bahnar: Sư pơma đei hloi lep tung-nut păng lep 'ba lơlap pă kĕ jô̆.

English: And ate up all the vegetation in their land, And devoured the fruit of their ground.
Bahnar: Kăp hek sa đĭ lu 'long 'nhĕt lăm teh char noh, Păng kư̆m sa pơrăm lu hơ'bo 'ba plei sa lăm mir chŭn.

English: He also destroyed all the firstborn in their land, The first of all their strength.
Bahnar: Sư pơlôch đĭ lu kon kơdră lăm char noh. Wă khan đĭ kơ lu plei blŭng-a. Đĭ lu pran kơtang.

English: He also brought them out with silver and gold, And there was none feeble among His tribes.
Bahnar: Na Sư chông ba Isơrael lĕch đei chĕp ba hu maih, Ưh kơ đei bu lap rơmơ̆n lăm lu adrĕch lu sư.

English: Egypt was glad when they departed, For the fear of them had fallen upon them.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êyiptơ chhôk hal dêh kơ Isơrael weh năm, Yua kơ lu sư hli krưp dêh kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: He spread a cloud for a covering, And fire to give light in the night.
Bahnar: Sư bơyar hơmơ̆l wă kơ pơyơ̆l kơ kon pơlei Sư, Păng kơmăng đei ŭnh pơchrang hơdah.

English: The people asked, and He brought quail, And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
Bahnar: Lu sư krao apinh, Kră Yang ăn đei Sem wăt truh, Păng 'bĕng sa đơ̆ng plĕnh ăn kơ lu sư sŏng sa phĭ hrăp.

English: He opened the rock, and water gushed out; It ran in the dry places like a river.
Bahnar: Sư blah tơmo, na đei hloi đak lĕch, ro tơ char glă thoi đak krong.

English: For He remembered His holy promise, And Abraham His servant.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư 'blŏk kơ nơ̆r pơgơ̆p rơgoh Sư mă đei pơkă hăm Abraham đĭch đam Sư.

English: He brought out His people with joy, His chosen ones with gladness.
Bahnar: Sư chông ba kon pơlei Sư lĕch năm hiôk-hian; lu bơngai Kră Yang rơih. Lu sư lĕch năm hăm nơ̆r hơri chơt hiôk.

English: He gave them the lands of the Gentiles, And they inherited the labor of the nations
Bahnar: Sư jao ăn teh kơ lu sư đơ̆ng lu dêh char. Lu sư yua iŏk mir chŭn pơgar đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei.

English: That they might observe His statutes And keep His laws. Praise the LORD!
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu sư bơwei tơdrong Kră Yang tơtă Păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm khôi juăt Sư Halêluya!

English: Praise the LORD! Oh, give thanks to the LORD, for He is good! For His mercy endures forever.
Bahnar: Halêluya! Kơkuh bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư 'lơ̆ng. Tơdrong 'mêm Sư oei oei ling-lang

English: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? Who can declare all His praise?
Bahnar: Bu gơh roi dôm tơdrong jang mơsêh mơyang Kră Yang, bu kĕ roi dôm nơ̆r hơri bơnê kơ Sư?

English: Blessed are those who keep justice, And he who does righteousness at all times!
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bu wei răk tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ling-lang!

English: Remember me, O LORD, with the favor You have toward Your people. Oh, visit me with Your salvation
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh 'blŏk kơ inh, mưh Ih mơnat ăn kơ kon pơlei Ih. Năm tơgŭm inh, mưh Ih dŏng pơklaih lu sư?

English: That I may see the benefit of Your chosen ones, That I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, That I may glory with Your inheritance.
Bahnar: Wă kơ inh 'bôh tơdrong pŭn hiôk lu bơngai mă Ih đei rơih. Wă kơ wang chơt hiôk thoi lăm teh đak Ih, Păng hơri bơnê hơdai hăm kon pơlei Ih.

English: We have sinned with our fathers, We have committed iniquity, We have done wickedly.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn păng 'bok lu nhôn pơm yoch boih; Lu nhôn đei yoch glăi pơm kơnê̆ tơpă.

English: Our fathers in Egypt did not understand Your wonders; They did not remember the multitude of Your mercies, But rebelled by the sea—the Red Sea.
Bahnar: Tơ dêh char Êyiptơ 'bok lu nhôn ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Ih kư̆m ưh kơ 'blŏk tơdrong Ih 'mêm mơnat dêh Mă-lei rai pơm plơ̆ tơ đak dơsĭ, noh đak dơsĭ 'brê.

English: Nevertheless He saved them for His name’s sake, That He might make His mighty power known.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Kră Yang oei tơgŭm lu sư, yua kơ anăn Sư. Wă kơ tơ'bôh tơdrong mơsêh pran Sư.

English: He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it dried up; So He led them through the depths, As through the wilderness.
Bahnar: Sư chrih kơ đak dơsĭ 'brê, na đak hrơ̆ hloi. Sư chông ba Isơrael rok đak dơsĭ jrŭ, thoi yak rok char 'blach.

English: He saved them from the hand of him who hated them, And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
Bahnar: Sư dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆. Huai iŏk lu sư đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai ayăt.

English: The waters covered their enemies; There was not one of them left.
Bahnar: Đak lơ̆p lê̆ lu bơngai ayăt lu sư, Ưh pă đei minh 'nu oei arih.

English: Then they believed His words; They sang His praise.
Bahnar: Na lu sư lui kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang. Păng hơri bơnê kơ Sư.

English: They soon forgot His works; They did not wait for His counsel
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư 'bônh kơ hiơt kơ tơdrong Sư đei pơm boih. Ưh pă đei gô nơ̆r Kră Yang pơđâu.

English: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, And tested God in the desert.
Bahnar: Lăm char 'blach jơhngơ̆m lu sư ham rơhing dêh. Păng pơlong lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lăm bri brah.

English: And He gave them their request, But sent leanness into their soul.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong lu sư apinh; Mă-lei ăn tơdrong jĭ răm truh kơ tơdrong arih lu sư

English: When they envied Moses in the camp, And Aaron the saint of the LORD
Bahnar: Lu sư hil areh kơ Môis. 'Bơ̆t anih lu sư pơdơh. Păng Arôn, bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang.

English: The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan, And covered the faction of Abiram.
Bahnar: Teh hơđang na luăn Đathan păng 'bŭ klơ̆p lê̆ khŭl Abiram.

English: A fire was kindled in their company; The flame burned up the wicked.
Bahnar: Đei ŭnh sa khŭl lu sư, pla ŭnh sa đĭ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: They made a calf in Horeb, And worshiped the molded image.
Bahnar: Lu sư man rup kon rơmo mơlôh tơ Hôrêp, Na drap Kơkuh kơ rup mam noh

English: Thus they changed their glory Into the image of an ox that eats grass.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơplih Kră Yang Ư-Ang lu sư jing thoi rup rơmo sa 'nhĕt.

English: They forgot God their Savior, Who had done great things in Egypt
Bahnar: Lu sư hiơt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu sư. Păng đei pơm lơ tơdrong tih tơ Êyiptơ

English: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, Awesome things by the Red Sea.
Bahnar: Đei pơm lơ tơdrong hlĭch chrơp tơ dêh Cham păng lu tơdrong trŏ kơ hli tơ đak dơsĭ 'brê.

English: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, Had not Moses His chosen one stood before Him in the breach, To turn away His wrath, lest He destroy them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh; Sư khan: Sư wă pơlôch pơđĭ lu sư. Dah ưh kơ Môis, bơngai Sư rơih, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.a Wă apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lê̆ pă hil, huay kơ pơlôch đĭ lu sư.

English: Then they despised the pleasant land; They did not believe His word
Bahnar: Lu sư lăng hơi đĕch dêh char 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Ưh kơ lui kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă.

English: But complained in their tents, And did not heed the voice of the LORD.
Bahnar: Na đei pơma jŏk lăm bơsŭn lu sư. Ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Therefore He raised His hand in an oath against them, To overthrow them in the wilderness
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang yơ̆r ti pơkăm khan: “Sư gô pơrăm lu sư pơ̆k lôch tơ lăm char 'blach

English: To overthrow their descendants among the nations, And to scatter them in the lands.
Bahnar: Pơm kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư kơdâu tơklah băl tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak, Păng pơm ăn kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ dêh char.”

English: They joined themselves also to Baal of Peor, And ate sacrifices made to the dead.
Bahnar: 'Bok lu nhôn kơkuh kơ yang Baal tơ Pêôr, Sa tơmam soi pơm yang kơ bơngai lôch

English: Thus they provoked Him to anger with their deeds, And the plague broke out among them.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơblĕk Kră Yang hăm tơdrong jang lu sư pơm kơnê̆. Păng jĭ lôch hơbuh truh tơ lăm lu sư

English: Then Phinehas stood up and intervened, And the plague was stopped.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei Phinêhas iung apinh. Na lôch hơbuh đei pơdơh.

English: And that was accounted to him for righteousness To all generations forevermore.
Bahnar: Lăm đĭ jơhnơr jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, dĭng truh tơ ning-mônh hloi.

English: They angered Him also at the waters of strife, So that it went ill with Moses on account of them
Bahnar: 'Bok lu nhôn pơm kơ Kră Yang blĕk tơ đak Mêriba. Yua kơ đơ̆ng lu sư, na Môis đei tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: Because they rebelled against His Spirit, So that he spoke rashly with his lips.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư pơm kơ kơ̆l 'ngok sư, na Môis pơma kư̆ kă ưh kơ tơchĕng.

English: They did not destroy the peoples, Concerning whom the LORD had commanded them
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ pơrăm đĭ lu kon pơlei tơring noh kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei athei lu sư.

English: But they mingled with the Gentiles And learned their works
Bahnar: Mă-lei oei hơbĭ hơdai hăm kon pơlei noh. Pơhrăm pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt lu đe noh.

English: They served their idols, Which became a snare to them.
Bahnar: Bơ̆jang ăn kơ rup man đe noh. Âu boih pơm hơđong pơrăm lu sư kơdih.

English: They even sacrificed their sons And their daughters to demons
Bahnar: Lu sư rôp kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn lu sư. Pơm tơmam soi kơ Yang kơnê̆.

English: And shed innocent blood, The blood of their sons and daughters, Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; And the land was polluted with blood.
Bahnar: Tuh pham tơdrong ưh kơ đei. Pham lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn sư kơdih. Lu sư pơm tơmam soi ăn kơ rup yang char Kanaan; Na, char noh jing 'mê̆ kơnê̆ yua kơ pham noh.

English: Thus they were defiled by their own works, And played the harlot by their own deeds.
Bahnar: Lu sư jing 'mê̆ yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong jang kơdih lu sư. Na lu sư jing pơm đi ngôi kư̆ kă.

English: Therefore the wrath of the LORD was kindled against His people, So that He abhorred His own inheritance.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil mĭl dêh kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư. Lăng krưp dêh kơ kon pơlei.

English: And He gave them into the hand of the Gentiles, And those who hated them ruled over them.
Bahnar: Na Sư pơjao lê̆ lu sư lăm ti lu bơngai dêh tơmoi, Ăn lu bơngai mă areh kơ lu sư pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Their enemies also oppressed them, And they were brought into subjection under their hand.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ayăt pơjuă pơđep lu sư. Lu sư chu kŭp kơ̆l jang kơ đe noh.

English: Many times He delivered them; But they rebelled in their counsel, And were brought low for their iniquity.
Bahnar: Đei lơ wơ̆t Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư. Mă-lei lu sư pơrơ̆ng pơm plơ̆. Păng lu sư jing răm lăm tơdrong yoch kơdih.

English: Nevertheless He regarded their affliction, When He heard their cry
Bahnar: Mă-lei ră, mưh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư krao apinh, Sư kư̆m lăng ba lu sư lăm năr pơmat-tat.

English: And for their sake He remembered His covenant, And relented according to the multitude of His mercies.
Bahnar: 'Blŏk dơ̆ng kơ lu sư, yua đơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư pơgơ̆p. Yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tih Sư 'mêm mơnat kơ lu sư.

English: He also made them to be pitied By all those who carried them away captive.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m ăn kơ lu sư đei pŭn hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai mă rôp lu sư pơm bơnă.

English: Save us, O LORD our God, And gather us from among the Gentiles, To give thanks to Your holy name, To triumph in Your praise.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn. Akŭm pơpôi lu nhôn đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char. Wă kơ lu nhôn bơnê ư-ang kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih păng gơh oei hiôk hơri kơkuh kơ Ih.

English: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel From everlasting to everlasting! And let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the LORD!
Bahnar: Kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael. Đơ̆ng blŭng-a adrol kơ đĭ-đăng dĭng truh tơ ning-mônh ling-lang! Đĭ kon pơlei pơla gô khan “A-men”! Halêluya!

English: Oh, give thanks to the LORD, for He is good! For His mercy endures forever.
Bahnar: Bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư pơm 'lơ̆ng; Tơdrong 'mêm Sư oei oei ling-lang.

English: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, Whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu bơngai mă Kră Yang huai iŏk boih. Lu bơngai mă đei dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai ayăt pơjuă, pơma bĕ thoi âu

English: And gathered out of the lands, From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă đei krao akŭm boih đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char, Đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch, gah bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m gah gơal.

English: They wandered in the wilderness in a desolate way; They found no city to dwell in.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei chă yak tơ lăm char 'blach. Yak trong bri brah chă trong wă mơ̆t oei tơ pơlei ưh kơ 'bôh

English: Hungry and thirsty, Their soul fainted in them.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơngot păng ol kơ đak. Jơhngơ̆m lu sư rơmơ̆n pă kĕ.

English: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He delivered them out of their distresses.
Bahnar: Kơplah đei tơdrong pơmat-tat lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang. Na Kră Yang pơklaih hloi lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat

English: And He led them forth by the right way, That they might go to a city for a dwelling place.
Bahnar: Dui ba lu sư rok trong tơpăt. Lu sư năm truh tơ pơlei tih mă gơh oei.

English: Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Sư. Yua kơ tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Sư pơm boih kơ kon bơngai.

English: For He satisfies the longing soul, And fills the hungry soul with goodness.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư pơm kơ bơngai rơhing gơh hrăp. Ăn kơ bơngai pơngot, sa phĭ rơkah kơ tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng

English: Those who sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, Bound in affliction and irons
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai oei lăm măng mu păng yơ̆p tơdrong lôch. Đei lu bơnă pơmat-tat păng oei chô̆ hăm glang mam.

English: Because they rebelled against the words of God, And despised the counsel of the Most High
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư pơjah kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng sơngah kơ tơdrong Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơđâu.

English: Therefore He brought down their heart with labor; They fell down, and there was none to help.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh na Kră Yang ăn kơ lu sư jang gleh pơmat. Lu sư pơ̆k ưh kơ đei bu tơgŭm tơiung.

English: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơmat-tat lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang na Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat

English: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And broke their chains in pieces.
Bahnar: Sư dui iŏk lu sư đơ̆ng lăm măng mu păng yơ̆p tơdrong lôch. Kŭm hrĕch lê̆ glang đêl chô̆ lu sư.

English: Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Sư. Yua kơ tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư pơm boih kơ kon bơngai.

English: For He has broken the gates of bronze, And cut the bars of iron in two.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư pơrăm boih 'măng jang bơsei. Sư chơ̆ng tơgơ̆ lê̆ boih lu dơhlông bơsei.

English: Fools, because of their transgression, And because of their iniquities, were afflicted.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơ hlôh đei tơdrong gleh yua kơ pơm tơdrong yoch păng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: Their soul abhorred all manner of food, And they drew near to the gates of death.
Bahnar: Lu sư lăng areh dêh kơ lu tơmam sa. Lu sư năm tơ jê̆ 'măng jang tơdrong lôch.

English: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơmat-tat lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang, Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: He sent His word and healed them, And delivered them from their destructions.
Bahnar: Sư tơlĕch nơ̆r păng pơklaih jĭ lu sư, Sư dui hơtŏk lu sư đơ̆ng sơlŭng bơsat.

English: Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, Yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Sư yua kơ tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư pơm boih kơ kon bơngai.

English: Let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And declare His works with rejoicing.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi bơnê iŏk 'bai hơri chơt hiôk na roi pơdah tơdrong jang Sư.

English: Those who go down to the sea in ships, Who do business on great waters
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai jur hao thŏng-nan lăm đak dơsĭ. Păng bơ̆jang tơ lăm đak dơsĭ

English: They see the works of the LORD, And His wonders in the deep.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh tơdrong jang Kră Yang. 'Bôh tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư tơ lăm đak jrŭ.

English: For He commands and raises the stormy wind, Which lifts up the waves of the sea.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Sư athei na đei hloi kial hơbŭt pơm kơ đak poh-yă tŏk.

English: They mount up to the heavens, They go down again to the depths; Their soul melts because of trouble.
Bahnar: Hơtŏk lu sư kơjung truh tơ plĕnh, đơ̆ng noh tơjur truh tơ jrŭ hloh. Jơhngơ̆m lu sư pơchah, yua kơ pơmat.

English: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, And are at their wits’ end.
Bahnar: Lu sư mơngưt mơngat nhen thoi bơngai suai. Tơdrong hơgei lu sư hiong đĭ.

English: Then they cry out to the LORD in their trouble, And He brings them out of their distresses.
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơmat-tat lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang. Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: He calms the storm, So that its waves are still.
Bahnar: Sư khă hơbŭt thĕng jing hơđơ̆ng. Păng đak poh-yă thĕng nhĕt.

English: Then they are glad because they are quiet; So He guides them to their desired haven.
Bahnar: Lu sư chơt hiôk yua kơ huay pă poh-yă boih. Kră Yang chông ba lu sư tơ anih mă lu sư hơpơi wă.

English: Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Sư, Yua kơ tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư pơm boih kơ kon bơngai!

English: Let them exalt Him also in the assembly of the people, And praise Him in the company of the elders.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư pơư pơang kơ Kră Yang lăm năr kon pơlei akŭm. Păng bơnê kơ Sư tơ lăm lu Kră akŭm pơđâu.

English: He turns rivers into a wilderness, And the watersprings into dry ground
Bahnar: Sư tơplih đak Krong jing char 'blach. Tu đak glung jing teh hrĕng kro.

English: A fruitful land into barrenness, For the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
Bahnar: Teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng jing teh 'băt 'boh, Yua kơ đei tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm lu kon pơlei oei tơ noh.

English: He turns a wilderness into pools of water, And dry land into watersprings.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơ char 'blach jing đak dơnâu. Teh hrĕng kro jing đak glung

English: There He makes the hungry dwell, That they may establish a city for a dwelling place
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai pơngot oei tơ noh. Lê̆ lu sư pơjing pơlei tih wă oei.

English: And sow fields and plant vineyards, That they may yield a fruitful harvest.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm mir rei adrĕch păng pơtăm tơm hơmu lăm mir chŭn tơm hơmu đei plei lơ.

English: He also blesses them, and they multiply greatly; And He does not let their cattle decrease.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư, lu kon pơlei rai hrôh. Sư ưh kơ đei ăn kơ kon sem dơrong lu sư hrŏ hiong

English: When they are diminished and brought low Through oppression, affliction, and sorrow
Bahnar: Dah lu sư hrŏ jơhngơ̆m ơh klai. Yua kơ đe pơjuă pơđep, đei tơdrong pơmat-tat păng ơh sơ'ngon.

English: He pours contempt on princes, And causes them to wander in the wilderness where there is no way
Bahnar: Sư tuh tơdrong đe areh kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r. Ăn kơ lu sư yak thông lăm char glă ưh kơ đei trong.

English: Yet He sets the poor on high, far from affliction, And makes their families like a flock.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sư hơtŏk lu bơngai dơnuh hin klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong pơmat-tat. Ăn kơ hnam dơnŏ hrôh ngôh rai lơ thoi khŭl triu.

English: The righteous see it and rejoice, And all iniquity stops its mouth.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpăt 'bôh păng chhôk hơnôk. Gah bơngai pơm kơnê̆ lu sư pơŏm 'bơ̆r.

English: Whoever is wise will observe these things, And they will understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă hlôh wao gơh hơgei 'blŏk kơ tơdrong 'nâu. Păng tơchĕng răk tơdrong 'mêm Kră Yang.

English: O God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, jơhngơ̆m inh kơjăp; Inh gô hơri, hơri bơnê hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m

English: Awake, lute and harp! I will awaken the dawn.
Bahnar: Ơ brŏ dung hăm tĭng-nĭng hơđơ̆r bĕ. Inh gô râu pơgê hrôih hơđơ̆r.

English: I will praise You, O LORD, among the peoples, And I will sing praises to You among the nations.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, inh gô bơnê kơ Ih, lăm lu kon pơlei pơla. Inh gô hơri ư-ang kơ Ih lăm lu dêh char.

English: For Your mercy is great above the heavens, And Your truth reaches to the clouds.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm tih Ih kơjung hloh kơ plĕnh, Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih truh tơ hơmơ̆l.

English: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, And Your glory above all the earth
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, ăn kơ anăn ih đe pơyom kơjung hloh kơ plĕnh; Ăn tơdrong ư-ang Ih tơ jơ̆p kơpal teh đak!

English: That Your beloved may be delivered, Save with Your right hand, and hear me.
Bahnar: Yua bĕ ti 'ma Ih dŏng pơklaih păng tơl tơwih nơ̆r lu nhôn. Wă kơ lu bơngai mă Ih 'mêm gơh klaih hlôi.

English: God has spoken in His holiness: “I will rejoice; I will divide Shechem And measure out the Valley of Succoth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan đơ̆ng lăm anih rơgoh Sư: “Inh gô 'nă hal, klah song Sichem păng pơtŏ thŭng Sikôt.

English: Gilead is Mine; Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim also is the helmet for My head; Judah is My lawgiver.
Bahnar: Gileat gah Inh, Manase kư̆m lei-lăi; Êphraim jơ̆ môk pĕng kơ̆l inh; Juđa jơ̆ 'long jra pơtao inh.

English: Moab is My washpot; Over Edom I will cast My shoe; Over Philistia I will triumph.”
Bahnar: Môap jơ̆ bơng Inh hum 'nhao. Inh dan chơkhŏ Inh tơ Eđôm, Inh gô jreo chơt hiôk jei tơ teh đak Philistin.”

English: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me to Edom?
Bahnar: Bu gô ba inh tơ pơlei tih kơjăp? Bu gô chông ba inh truh tơ char Eđôm?

English: Is it not You, O God, who cast us off? And You, O God, who did not go out with our armies?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm trŏ kơ Ih jơ̆ Tơ'ngla mă achăng lê̆ lu nhôn? Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih ưh pă đei năm tơblah hơdai hăm linh lu nhôn dơ̆ng.

English: Give us help from trouble, For the help of man is useless.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih tơgŭm lu nhôn, blah lu ayăt. Yua kơ tơdrong tơgŭm tơduă kon bơngai ưh kơ yua kiơ.

English: Through God we will do valiantly, For it is He who shall tread down our enemies.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei na lu nhôn kĕ jei. Yua kơ Kră Yang gô pơjuă bơhlơ̆r lê̆ lu ayăt kơ lu nhôn.

English: Do not keep silent, O God of my praise!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla inh bơnê, apinh lê̆ kơ ngăn ôh

English: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful Have opened against me; They have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ păng 'bơ̆r hơlĕnh pơdăr. Đei pơma kơnê̆ kơ inh. Hơpiĕt lu sư pơma hơlĕnh kơ inh

English: They have also surrounded me with words of hatred, And fought against me without a cause.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma hăm nơ̆r hil areh wang tăp kơ inh. Blah inh hăm tơdrong ưh kơ đei.

English: In return for my love they are my accusers, But I give myself to prayer.
Bahnar: Mă inh 'mêm kơ lu sư, lu sư oei ayăt kơ inh. Mă inh oei krao khan kơ lu sư.

English: Thus they have rewarded me evil for good, And hatred for my love.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ tơplih kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng inh. Lu sư hil areh tơplih kơ inh 'mêm.

English: Set a wicked man over him, And let an accuser stand at his right hand.
Bahnar: Ăn bĕ bơngai kơnê̆ pơm kơ lu sư, Ăn bơngai jâu dơ̆ng gah 'ma kơ lu sư.

English: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, And let his prayer become sin.
Bahnar: Tơdah sek tơlang kơ lu sư jô̆ bĕ lu sư yoch. Păng jô̆ tơdrong lu sư krao khan kư̆m yoch.

English: Let his days be few, And let another take his office.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ măng năr lu sư arih rai tŏ sĕt. Ăn kơ bơngai nai tơgar iŏk anih tơdrong jang sư.

English: Let his children be fatherless, And his wife a widow.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu kon sư jing mơti. Păng ăn kơ akăn sư jing adro.

English: Let his children continually be vagabonds, and beg; Let them seek their bread also from their desolate places.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu kon sư jing răm-'băm păng jing ăn-mai. Puh lu sư chă sa ataih đơ̆ng anih hnam đe pơrăm boih.

English: Let the creditor seize all that he has, And let strangers plunder his labor.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ tơ'ngla mă lu sư hre, năm hơrui iŏk đĭ mŭk tơmam sư? Lu bơngai tơmoi năm tơgar phĕ iŏk plei tơmam đêl lu sư jang sa.

English: Let there be none to extend mercy to him, Nor let there be any to favor his fatherless children.
Bahnar: Thŭ pă đei bu mơnat kơ lu sư, ưh pă đei bu mơnat kơ kon mơti sư.

English: Let his posterity be cut off, And in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
Bahnar: Thŭ ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung sư răm đĭ, Anăn lu sư thŭ sŭt lê̆ tơ chăl đơ̆ng rŏng.

English: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, And let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu 'bok sư oei tơ'blŏk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; Păng tơdrong yoch mĕ sư oei ưh kơ sut lê̆.

English: Let them be continually before the LORD, That He may cut off the memory of them from the earth
Bahnar: Ăn kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh oei đei ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; Na Sư sut lê̆ tơdrong 'blŏk kơ lu sư đơ̆ng lăm teh âu.

English: Because he did not remember to show mercy, But persecuted the poor and needy man, That he might even slay the broken in heart.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư pă đei 'blŏk mơnat kơ đe. Na rôp pơmat lu bơngai dơnuh răm. Lu bơngai pơmat-tat đei jơhngơ̆m ơh kư̆m wă pơlôch mơ̆n.

English: As he loved cursing, so let it come to him; As he did not delight in blessing, so let it be far from him.
Bahnar: Sư 'maih blei hiap, Thŭ blei hiap plơ̆ tơ lu sư; kư̆m ưh kơ 'maih wă sơkat đei pŭn hiôk; Thŭ tơdrong pŭn hiôk ataih đơ̆ng lu sư.

English: As he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment, So let it enter his body like water, And like oil into his bones.
Bahnar: Sư pơhrŭk boih kơ sư kơdih hăm tơdrong blei hiap thoi hơbĕn ao sư tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ mơ̆t tơ lăm akâu sư thoi đak, mơ̆t lăm kơting sư thoi rơmă.

English: Let it be to him like the garment which covers him, And for a belt with which he girds himself continually.
Bahnar: Thŭ tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ thoi ao sư hrŭk. Thoi tơlei tơ̆n, tơ̆n tơ kơiĕng ling-lang.

English: Let this be the LORD’s reward to my accusers, And to those who speak evil against my person.
Bahnar: Rŏ kơ Kră Yang pơm 'mong thoi noh kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh. Păng lu bơngai mă pơma kơnê̆ kơ bơhngol inh.

English: But You, O GOD the Lord, Deal with me for Your name’s sake; Because Your mercy is good, deliver me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Ih boih ơ Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla pơgơ̆r hăm anăn Ih, apinh Ih dŏng inh. Yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm Ih tih tơpă; Apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: For I am poor and needy, And my heart is wounded within me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh pơmat-tat păng dơnuh hin, Na jơhngơ̆m inh jing jĭ jăn

English: I am gone like a shadow when it lengthens; I am shaken off like a locust.
Bahnar: Inh đông thoi yơ̆p ngôi kiơ̆ kơsơ̆. Đe puh inh thoi lep.

English: My knees are weak through fasting, And my flesh is feeble from lack of fatness.
Bahnar: Kŭl-tăng inh đĭ rơdu yua kơ ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa. Akâu jăn inh đĭ hơkĕ hơkong.

English: I also have become a reproach to them; When they look at me, they shake their heads.
Bahnar: Inh jing bơngai lu sư pơjăm. Mưh 'bôh inh lu sư tơtreh kơ̆l.

English: Help me, O LORD my God! Oh, save me according to Your mercy
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Apinh Ih tơgŭm inh bĕ. Pơklaih inh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong 'mêm Ih.

English: That they may know that this is Your hand— That You, LORD, have done it!
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư băt đơ̆ng ti Ih boih pơklaih inh. Ih boih ơ Kră Yang, đei pơm tơdrong noh

English: Let them curse, but You bless; When they arise, let them be ashamed, But let Your servant rejoice.
Bahnar: Lê̆ lu sư blei hiap, mă-lei Ih ăn pŭn hiôk. Layơ lu sư iung blah lu sư gô mơlâu, Mă-lei gah lu đĭch đam Ih gô chơt hiôk.

English: Let my accusers be clothed with shame, And let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a mantle.
Bahnar: Lu ayăt kơ inh gô hrŭk iŏk tơdrong mơlâu. Tơdrong mơlâu gô gom lu sư thoi ao tai

English: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; Yes, I will praise Him among the multitude.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r inh gô bơnê kơ Kră Yang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m, Hơri ư-ang kơ Sư lăm tŏk-bŏk bơngai lơ

English: For He shall stand at the right hand of the poor, To save him from those who condemn him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư dơ̆ng gah 'ma kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin, Wă dŏng pơklaih tơdrong arih lu sư đơ̆ng đe jâu sư.

English: The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, Till I make Your enemies Your footstool.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ yŏng inh thoi âu: “Oei gah 'ma kơ Inh bĕ! Dĭng truh tơ Inh dan lu ayăt kơ ih tơ ala kơnơl jơ̆ng ih.”

English: The LORD shall send the rod of Your strength out of Zion. Rule in the midst of Your enemies!
Bahnar: Kră Yang đơ̆ng Siôn gô wơh 'long jra pơtao tơdrong kơtang Sư. Ăn kơ ih pơgơ̆r bĕ lu ayăt kơ Ih.

English: Your people shall be volunteers In the day of Your power; In the beauties of holiness, from the womb of the morning, You have the dew of Your youth.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơgơ̆r lu sư kơdih năm. Năm năr Ih năm tơblah, pơdah tơdrong mơsêh Ih, Nhen thoi đak ngom pơgê hrôih. Lu bơngai hơmuh hơmŏng pơguăng ao rơgoh năm tơ Ih.

English: The LORD has sworn And will not relent, “You are a priest forever According to the order of Melchizedek.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơkă pơkăm kơdih; Sư ưh kơ đei tơplih đon: “Ih jing 'bok soi ling-lang, kiơ̆ thoi Mêlkisêdek.”

English: The Lord is at Your right hand; He shall execute kings in the day of His wrath.
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei gah 'ma kơ ih gô pơrăm đĭ lu pơtao lăm năr Sư hil.

English: He shall judge among the nations, He shall fill the places with dead bodies, He shall execute the heads of many countries.
Bahnar: Sư sek tơlang kơ đĭ-đăng dêh char, pơm kơ jơ̆p-jang anih đei hơtâu bơngai lôch. Kŭm gô juă bơhlơ̆r lu yŏng mơng jơ̆p lăm teh.

English: He shall drink of the brook by the wayside; Therefore He shall lift up the head.
Bahnar: Sư gô nhă đak hơbong ro rok trong, yua kơ thoi noh sư gơh ngơk kơ̆l.

English: Praise the LORD! I will praise the LORD with my whole heart, In the assembly of the upright and in the congregation.
Bahnar: Halêluya! Inh hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m. Lăm năr lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt akŭm tih.

English: The works of the LORD are great, Studied by all who have pleasure in them.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang Kră Yang tih tơpă; Đĭ-đăng bơngai lăp kơ tơdrong jang noh; tă tơchĕng wă kơ băt.

English: His work is honorable and glorious, And His righteousness endures forever.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang Kră Yang đe ư-ang păng krưp rŏ. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư oei oei ling-lang.

English: He has made His wonderful works to be remembered; The LORD is gracious and full of compassion.
Bahnar: Sư tơ'blŏk tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư đei pơm boih. Kră Yang 'mêm păng mơnat.

English: He has given food to those who fear Him; He will ever be mindful of His covenant.
Bahnar: Sư ăn tơmam sŏng sa kơ lu đe bu mă hli yom kơ Sư. Păng 'blŏk ling-lang kơ dôm nơ̆r Sư pơgơ̆p.

English: He has declared to His people the power of His works, In giving them the heritage of the nations.
Bahnar: Sư đei tơ'bôh boih kơ kon pơlei Sư, tơdrong jang mơsêh pran kơtang Sư. Jao ăn kơ lu sư teh jang sa tơ dêh char đe.

English: The works of His hands are verity and justice; All His precepts are sure.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti Sư sĭt tơpă păng tơpăt; Lu nơ̆r Sư bơtho pơkă trŏ gơnang tơpă.

English: They stand fast forever and ever, And are done in truth and uprightness.
Bahnar: Kơjăp ling-lang, wă pơm kiơ̆ lăm tơdrong sĭt tơpă păng tơpăt.

English: He has sent redemption to His people; He has commanded His covenant forever: Holy and awesome is His name.
Bahnar: Sư ăn tơdrong dŏng pơklaih kơ kon pơlei pơla Sư. Nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Sư oei oei ling-lang, Anăn Sư 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng trŏ kơ hli yom.

English: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; A good understanding have all those who do His commandments. His praise endures forever.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang jing tơm tơdrong hơgei, Bơngai bu mă wei răk nơ̆r Sư bơtho pơkă gô đei đon hlôh wao. Tơdrong hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Sư oei oei ling-lang.

English: Praise the LORD! Blessed is the man who fears the LORD, Who delights greatly in His commandments.
Bahnar: Halêluya! Pŭn dêh bu băt kơ hli yom kơ Kră Yang. 'Maih wă dêh kơ tơdrong juăt Sư!

English: His descendants will be mighty on earth; The generation of the upright will be blessed.
Bahnar: Kon sâu sư gô pran kơtang tơ kơpal teh. Adrĕch adrung bơngai tơpăt gô đei pŭn hiôk.

English: Wealth and riches will be in his house, And his righteousness endures forever.
Bahnar: Mŭk măk păng mơdrŏng oei lăm hnam Sư. Păng tơdrong tơpăt Sư oei oei ling-lang.

English: Unto the upright there arises light in the darkness; He is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
Bahnar: Hơdah pơchrang tơ anih măng mu, kơ bơngai tơpăt. Bơngai 'lơ̆ng băt mơnat, đei jơhngơ̆m 'mêm mơnat păng 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: A good man deals graciously and lends; He will guide his affairs with discretion.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bu băt mơnat păng ăn kơ đe tŏk iŏk. Bơngai 'noh sư jang 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Surely he will never be shaken; The righteous will be in everlasting remembrance.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai tơpăt sư gô ưh kơ đei tơdrŏ pơpơ̆! Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đe gô 'blŏk kơ sư ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: He will not be afraid of evil tidings; His heart is steadfast, trusting in the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ hli ôh mă đe roi tơdrong kơnê̆, jơhngơ̆m sư oei hơđơ̆ng, gơnang kơ Kră Yang.

English: His heart is established; He will not be afraid, Until he sees his desire upon his enemies.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m sư kơjăp, ưh kơ hli tơrơ, truh tơ sư 'bôh lu ayăt thuơ kơ sư.

English: He has dispersed abroad, He has given to the poor; His righteousness endures forever; His horn will be exalted with honor.
Bahnar: Sư hơmrah asong ăn tơmam kơ lu dơnuh hin. Tơdrong tơpăt sư oei oei ling-lang. Đe gô ư-ang kơ tơdrong jei sư

English: The wicked will see it and be grieved; He will gnash his teeth and melt away; The desire of the wicked shall perish.
Bahnar: Lu ayăt gô 'bôh păng blĕk tơpă. Kăp hơnĕnh, đơ̆ng noh lôch hiong đĭ, Tơdrong lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ hơpơi gô ưh kơ đei.

English: Praise the LORD! Praise, O servants of the LORD, Praise the name of the LORD!
Bahnar: Halêluya! Ơ lu đĭch đam Kră Yang hơri bơnê bĕ. Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ anăn Kră Yang.

English: Blessed be the name of the LORD From this time forth and forevermore!
Bahnar: Trŏ hơri bơnê kơ anăn Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng dang ei truh tơ ning-mônh hlŏng hloi.

English: From the rising of the sun to its going down The LORD’s name is to be praised.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng gah măt năr lĕch truh tơ măt năr mơ̆t; Hơri ư-ang bĕ kơ anăn Kră Yang.

English: The LORD is high above all nations, His glory above the heavens.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak. Tơdrong ư-ang Sư kơjung hloh kơ plĕnh.

English: Who is like the LORD our God, Who dwells on high
Bahnar: Bu đei thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n? Tơ'ngla oei lăm anih kơpal hloh

English: Who humbles Himself to behold The things that are in the heavens and in the earth?
Bahnar: Sư nger lăng plĕnh păng teh

English: He raises the poor out of the dust, And lifts the needy out of the ash heap
Bahnar: Sư tơiung bơngai dơnuh hin đơ̆ng 'mui teh. Dui lu kơ'bah kơ'bôch đơ̆ng 'bruih 'brăm

English: That He may seat him with princes— With the princes of His people.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu sư ngôi hơdai hăm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r. Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla Sư.

English: He grants the barren woman a home, Like a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD!
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ drŏ-kăn hơwŏng lăm hnam sư, jing mĕ chơt hiôk hăm lu kon sư. Halêluya!

English: When Israel went out of Egypt, The house of Jacob from a people of strange language
Bahnar: Kơplah Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, hnam Jakôp đơ̆ng khŭl pơma nơ̆r hlĭch.

English: Judah became His sanctuary, And Israel His dominion.
Bahnar: Juđa jing hnam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư. Păng Isơrael jing khŭl Sư pơgơ̆r.

English: The sea saw it and fled; Jordan turned back.
Bahnar: Đak dơsĭ 'bôh thoi noh, na kơdâu ôn; Đak Krong Jôrđăn ro hơlơ̆k tơ rŏng

English: The mountains skipped like rams, The little hills like lambs.
Bahnar: Kông tih pơplŏng thoi triu tơno, Kông groi pơplŏng thoi lu triu kon.

English: What ails you, O sea, that you fled? O Jordan, that you turned back?
Bahnar: Ơ đak dơsĭ yua kơ kiơ ih kơdâu ôn? Ơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, yua kơ kiơ mah ro hơlơ̆k tơ rŏng?

English: O mountains, that you skipped like rams? O little hills, like lambs?
Bahnar: Ơ kông tih, yua kơ kiơ ih, mah pơplŏng thoi triu tơno? Ơ kông groi yua kơ kiơ ih mah pơplŏng thoi triu kon?

English: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, At the presence of the God of Jacob
Bahnar: Ơ teh pơpơ̆ tơdrŏ bĕ, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. 'Bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp.

English: Who turned the rock into a pool of water, The flint into a fountain of waters.
Bahnar: Sư boih ăn tơmo kŭk jing đak dơnâu. Tơplih tơmo hơrăk jing tu đak.

English: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, But to Your name give glory, Because of Your mercy, Because of Your truth.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ trŏ kơ lu nhôn, ơ Kră Yang, ưh kơ trŏ kơ lu nhôn. Mă-lei trŏ kơ ư-ang kơ Ih. Yua kơ tơdrong 'mêm mơnat păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Ih.

English: Why should the Gentiles say, “So where is their God?”
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ lu bơngai tơmoi pơ̆n khan: “Tơ yơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư?”

English: But our God is in heaven; He does whatever He pleases.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n tơ kơpal plĕnh ti, Sư pơm tơdrong kiơ mơ̆ng kơ Sư wă.

English: Their idols are silver and gold, The work of men’s hands.
Bahnar: Rup yang lu sư man păng hu maih. Noh đơ̆ng ti kon bơngai pơm.

English: They have mouths, but they do not speak; Eyes they have, but they do not see
Bahnar: Rup man đei 'bơ̆r, mă pơma ưh kơ gơh. Đei măt, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh

English: They have ears, but they do not hear; Noses they have, but they do not smell
Bahnar: Đei đon, mă ưh kơtơ̆ng; Đei muh, mă-lei ưh kơ băt kơ 'bâu

English: They have hands, but they do not handle; Feet they have, but they do not walk; Nor do they mutter through their throat.
Bahnar: Đei ti, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh pel mơn. Đei jơ̆ng, ưh kơ gơh yơyak; Dăng-hơlŏng, ưh kơ đei nơ̆r re.

English: Those who make them are like them; So is everyone who trusts in them.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai pơm rup yang; păng gơnang kơ sư, Tă kơ lei-lăi thoi sư ngăl.

English: O Israel, trust in the LORD; He is their help and their shield.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Isơrael, gơnang bĕ kơ Kră Yang; Sư boih Tơ'ngla dŏng tơgŭm păng khêl pĕng lu sư.

English: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD; He is their help and their shield.
Bahnar: Ơ hnam Arôn gơnang bĕ kơ Kră Yang; Sư boih Tơ'ngla dŏng tơgŭm păng khêl pĕng lu sư.

English: You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD; He is their help and their shield.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai mă hli yom kơ Kră Yang, lui gơnang kơ sư bĕ, Sư boih Tơ'ngla dŏng tơgŭm păng khêl pĕng lu sư.

English: The LORD has been mindful of us; He will bless us; He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'blŏk kơ lu bơ̆n Sư gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu bơ̆n. Ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ hnam Isơrael, Kŭm gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ hnam Arôn.

English: He will bless those who fear the LORD, Both small and great.
Bahnar: Sư gô ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu đe bu mă hli yom kơ Kră Yang. Mă lu iĕ dah tih kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: May the LORD give you increase more and more, You and your children.
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ iĕm hrôh ngôh. Ăn kơ lu iĕm păng lu kon sâu iĕm.
